description:
How can you go wrong? This place is a classic marina sushi spot that delivers quality and consistent yummy sushi and snacks. If you don't like sushi, there is plenty on the menu for you as well.

I love the hamachi rolls with extra jalapeños and Siracha which they hand out freely, Thankgod! I recommend this place if you want a reliable meal for a good price and they always have such friendly staff with a bumping atmosphere.

I also brought my family here and they loved it.
author: Ellie J.

description:
Oooooh this my shhhhhh! Can't stay silent any longer! 

SIT @ THE BAR & HAVE UBEN WORK HIS MAGIC! He is THE man! Don't take my word, just let these pics speak for themselves (I know I know, you're salivating at each pic, do yourself a favor & make a reservation!) This place can get busy on Friday & Saturday nights, so a reservation helps. It can be loud & give clubby atmosphere but their music choice makes it tolerable. Bingo night & happy hour on sushi is a splendid deal for those looking for a social connection. 


This is what you do: Always order omakase (chef's special). I don't really care for uni nor octopus so I 86 that ishhh. These guys cater to your needs, just tell them your preferences, likes, dislikes, allergies or whatever! As you wait, you can request their nachos, order Sake - Nigori is yum! Wakame salad always on deck!


You can be basic & order from the menu - their options are impressive & delicious! 

Didn't really want to write a review bc I don't want you crowding my FAVORITE PLACE TO EAT SUSHI. But sharing is caring & I care if you've had a bad sushi experience! Indulge, relax, drink & smile! 

* Fantastic Sushi 
* Awesome Friendly Talented Chefs!!

Let Ruben know that Tom & Melissa sent you! He'll take care of you! 

You won't be disappointed, try it for yourself!
author: Enjoying Each Momen T.

description:
Last visit to Ace was a solidly disappointing service experience. We arrived on time for our waitlist check in. Many SF restaurants seat Yelp waitlist users well after the check in time, so that's not a big deal.

Thirty minutes into our wait they gave our table to a larger group that decided to expand. Then, an hour into our wait they showed us to a table of four that had only three seats. This table was next to an empty table of 10+, and they wouldn't take a seat from it. Wow. The hostess just couldn't figure out that the right thing to do is give us the seat. So I stood for a solid five minutes before her colleague finally took a chair from the larger table.

The sushi was awesome. We ordered a sashimi platter and various rolls. The waitress was also fantastic. The hostess...
author: Shaun J.

description:
With 4 nights in SF my group of girlfriends were choosy of where to eat. SO GLAD we were recommend to go to Ace! Fun lively ambiance (playlist was hip hop bbq vibes) and 5 star food. The owner Kenny is truly amazing, going above and beyond to show our group a good time.

Honestly every dish we ordered was fantastic. Get the truffle edamame (and dip everything in the leftover sauce). We really loved the tuna Tataki, the crab handroll, and the Jagger roll. The hamachi lime roll was the ideal hit of freshness too, balancing out the richer roll. 

The sake infused margarita had great flavour and wasn't too sake-y. Served with a cute bamboo straw! And you should get a carafe of the Kikusui sake ($30), which splits perfectly into a round of 4 large shots / small sippers. Trust me...you'll leave happy!
author: Jennifer C.

description: The sushi here is a bit eclectic and different from the typical sushi place. We sat at the bar and the service was a bit weird - we ordered directly from the chef's but no one came around to check on us, refill water, etc. The sushi is a bit pricier than typical places and they have a lot of ingredients and sauces in them (not just regular roles). The nigiri was awesome and they gave us a free mochi for dessert which was really nice.
author: Alyssa B.

description:
Solid place for happy hour sushi/sashimi. If I was rating for HH specifically, this place would be a 5 without a doubt. 

Happy hour runs on Monday through Saturday 5:30-6:30 PM so make sure to come before it gets crowded for bingo at 6:30 PM. The menu has deals for days. There's 50% off sashimi! You can get 8 pieces for $11 and 20 pieces for $20 which is a steal. They also have a select amount of $6 rolls and plates. 

We had the seasonal 20 piece sashimi which came out fast and was super filling. I highly recommend the Hamachi Kama ($7), the grilled yellowtail collar with ponzu which was such a steal.

Ace Wasabi has a fun bingo activity that happens at the end of HH if you can stick around. Fun vibes, good deals, what more can you ask for?
author: Chelsea W.

description: Best sushi happy hour in the city I think, and it gets busy but not so packed you can't get a seat. Large "seasonal" sashimi platter, hamachi Kama, chicken karaage (to share for 2) and I'm a happy camper. The crispy salmon was kinda burnt this time but I remember it being better. I also liked the eggplant (garden?) roll before too. They have a quick game of bingo right after hh too if you need another reason to go! Their house wines are Spanish and at least the white I tried was decent. Great service every time.
author: Vivian H.

description:
First timers and had an awesome Birthday meal. The Salmon Belly was to die for(worth the $10 nigiri price)!. The happy hour is busy and worth getting in early for. Salmon, avocado roll was awesome and the tuna sashimi was delectable. Also had both the Shrimp tempura with vegetables plate and crispy Brussels sprouts and would order again. 
Will be back for sure!!
author: Kate O.

description:
Probably one of the best sushi restaurant I have had in the bay in a while! I came on a Saturday around 5:15pm and saw that it opened at 5:30p so my girlfriend and I walked around the nearby stores to wait til it opened. Once we got to Ace at 5:35p, the restaurant was almost full! Come a bit earlier to grab a seat for Happy Hour! We ordered the 21 piece sashimi ($21), tater tots($6), albacore avocado roll ($6), and crispy salmon roll ($6) off the happy hour menu. The sashimi is as fresh as it could get, some pieces literally melted in your mouth and they were nice and fatty pieces too. The tater tots was really good as it is different than your traditional tater tot, they make it from mashed potato. My favorite roll off the happy hour menu was the albacore avocado roll. That roll had fresh albacore that had a slight hint of spice which made the roll great. The crispy salmon,on the other hand, wasn't my favorite. For me, this restaurant is great since it has the happy hour menu (which i'll be coming back for), but the other items were slightly overpriced for me.
There is bingo Mon-Sat at 6:30pm which is a nice interaction which the guest, but only one game is played per day. Overall, I had a really good experience and look forward to coming back next time!
author: Jonathan S.

description:
I've never played Bingo at a sushi restaurant before -- interesting experience. I've also never shown up 3 minutes after a restaurant opened to discover that almost half of the seating area was already full. Ace Wasabi seems to be quite loved in the area.

Ace Wasabi is basically one of those fusion party sushi joints -- lots of experimenting with classics, plus there's a "bar bar" in addition to a sushi bar. We showed up for Happy Hour, which is 5:30pm-6:30pm on Saturdays. There was a line spilling out of the door to sit down, but we managed to snag a table in the back area. Happy Hour patrons get to play a round of Bingo at 6:30pm, too. Winner gets a $20 gift card for next time, or a hat. We didn't win, but we were so close!

Here's what we got:

- Seasonal Sashimi: 20 pieces for $21, only one order per table. Comes with salmon, albacore, yellowtail, tuna, seabass and butterfish. The fish were fresh and delicious. Butterfish isn't common in my parts, and I savored it. Good for two to share.

- Sake Kirota Roll: 5 thick pieces for $15. Salmon, crab, tobiko (black fish roe), avocado and ginger all wrapped in daikon (white radish). No rice, comes drizzled in ponzu sauce. I've never had a roll wrapped in daikon -- not bad. I liked this roll.  

- Sake Avocado Roll: $6 for 6 pieces. Your average salmon and avocado cut roll, with sesame seeds on the outside.

Service was decent, though our server seemed a bit forgetful. She was sweet, but one of our rolls was missing and we had to remind her about it. The tables on either side of us were missing dishes, too.

Be warned -- they play loud rap and R&B, not rock-n-roll. There's also a .025% "SF Mandates" surcharge added to the bill.
author: Kathy Z.

description:
Fun vibe, fusion sushi. They have a great HH menu, including sashimi platters, rolls, small plates and bottles of wine for half off. Really good deal, especially in the Marina!

The place is pretty popular and everyone seems to come here for their HH specials. They take reservations for parties of 5 or more. Otherwise, you're going to have to arrive as walk-ins. We lucked out and snagged seats at the bar. The guys at the sushi bar were so nice and offered us some dishes on the house :)

I'm not sure if it's because it's HH, but the pieces were on the smaller side. Another thing that they do here is Bingo. At 6:30, they start calling out the numbers and the winner receives a gift certificate to the restaurant. Maybe one of these days I'll be a lucky winner..
author: Helen C.

description:
Sat at the sushi bar , amazing fresh sushi with very good and friendly staff that are always very willing to help, recommend and just smile at you . 
Great food and drinks .
author: Andrea T.

description:
Yikes, no.

While Ace Wasabi is technically very good at turning out delicious sushi and has an awesome drink menu, my party and I were really turned off by the vibe when we came. Think people who have gotten way too drunk and started dancing in the dining room. I mean, I know it's a clubby kind of sushiya, but I was so uncomfortable through that entire dinner. We came aware that there was a bar aspect to Ace Wasabi, but there was no rock-n-roll -- mostly R&B and rap.

We split three rolls: the sake kirota, shinjuku, and Victoria's Secret. Additionally, we ordered a small plate/appetizer of Japanese croquettes. Because I wasn't driving, I also got the hard cider on their menu, which was crisp, clear, and refreshing.

Sushi here is excellent; I think they have inventive rolls that are less commonly seen on other American sushi menus. Everything tasted fresh, and I was surprised by how tasty some rolls featuring ingredients I typically don't touch were. Props to the sushi chefs for that.

One of the disappointing things that happened that night was that the croquettes, which we intended to be our appetizer, were entirely forgotten about until they had almost brought the check to us. We had to ask for them, and by that point, I almost wanted to leave it off the check because I wanted to get out of there.

I wouldn't come back. I think this was a learning experience for me that I prefer my sushiyas quieter and with less booze.
author: Gwen W.

description:
O-M-G sooooo good!! Highly recommend sitting at the sushi bar snd getting chef's special! 
The best fresh fish experience ..
author: Natalya I.

description:
Great atmosphere and service. Food was excellent. Will be going back when I travel back to SF 
.
author: Ginger M.

description:
Came here on a Sunday, to my surprise they were busy and there was still a 20-30 minute wait. The wife and went on a walk down chestnut street and returned about 20 minutes later which was perfect because they were ready to seat us. 

Service: 5 stars - everyone was very nice and courteous. The hostess was nice and thanked us for being patient with waiting, the waitress was pleasant and attentive checking in on us several times throughout our meal.

Food: 3 stars - while I can't say the food was terrible I also can't say the food was really. Overall it was just ok.  For the price point that we spent ($120 without alcohol) I would expected a little bit better quality of dining. We had several appetizers, one that stood out to me was the shishito peppers. While the app tasted good but the portion was incredibly small for the 13 dollar price point. 

Decor/ambiance: 3 stars - Music playing in the background offered a good vibe, the pictures on the wall were fitting for the establishment and while the people at the neighboring table that were chanting and yelling after every sake bomb they took were rather loud we still managed to enjoy a low key meal.

Overall while I can't say I can't wait to go back to Ace I also can't say I would never come there again. I would more likely come to have some sake and maybe an app as opposed to coming here to have a complete dinner.
author: Dmitriy G.

description: The sushi was good but you can find plenty of other good / better sushi joints throughout the city. The draw about this place is more the fun vibe for larger groups.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Heartbroken!

Ace wasabi has a great vibe, great fish, and perfect service, so I was crushed by what happened my last visit.

Blue fin otoro was on the menu Sunday.  I didn't order it and I wouldn't let anyone in my party order it either.  Instead I asked our server if that really was blue fin tuna, an endangered fish.  She didn't know, but went to ask.  She returned, her face slightly ashen; she reported that it was blue fin tuna, and that she had googled it and yes, it was critically endangered.  Horrified, she said she would speak to the owner, who wasn't in that evening. I thanked her and told her about Monterey Bay Aquarium's seafood watch list wallet card or app, which helps conscientious diners, markets and restaurants make good sustainable decisions.

Ace, please do the right thing and keep to more plentiful sustainable fish on your menu.
author: Like I.

description: We had a great time at Ace with Will as our waiter, chef, and server. The place is packed and we didn't expect to have such an enjoyable time at the sushi bar but we did.  The food was delicious with the chicken breast karaage done right, rolls that were unique, and even the absence of artificial crab was a highly noticeable. Prices were very reasonable, portions were filling, excellent customer service. Well done.
author: Johnson N.

description:
Sushi bingo!!

You can find me at Ace Wasabi's either for bingo happy hour (yes, bingo happy hour. Monday's - Saturday's from 5:30 to 6:30) or for a late night dinner before going out in the Marina. Any time other than those, I'll probably be somewhere else for my sushi fix, but you can count me in for bingo or sushi pre-game. 

The best happy hour deal is 50% sashimi. 20 pieces for $21 - SUCH A STEAL. Come early if you want the $6 hamachi kama's because they'll always sell out during happy hour. I've tried all of their happy hour rolls, pretty basic, but good. The charred calamari tentacle appetizer is really good!!

Definitely not the most authentic, but if you're looking for a fun place to eat (bingo!! and rap playlist!!) then this is your place.
author: Laverne N.

description:
Amazing experience and service! 
Make sure to seat next ask to be seated by the bar.
Great staff / awesome sushi men
author: Mike J.

description: I love this place. Happy hour sushi bingo is incredible value and great fun too. Highly recommend the sashimi plate and the chicken karaage is delicious too!
author: Leonie P.

description:
My wife and I are on a never-ending quest for perfect bites of sushi. A night of good sushi is a wonderful night already, but sushi plus the thrill of free bingo enters another level of excitement. All prices below are happy hour prices.


We arrived right when happy hour started. It was mid-week so it didn't fill up instantly, but it was bustling loudly about an half hour into it. I try to order a reflection of how the restaurant presents itself. Ace Wasabi presents itself as a fusion sushi establishment that still know what good quality sashimi is. Challenge accepted.


Seasonal sashimi sampler: Half price during happy hour, 20 pieces for $21. They didn't go over-the-top trying to impress us with rare and odd cuts of fish, but everything they presented was done well. Every slice was cut appropriately in reference to grain direction and minimizing excessive connective tissue/stringy sensation. Their variations of cuts of hamachi, ahi, and salmon were professionally done and worth much more than the happy hour price. A smooth start to the meal.


Japanese Tonkatsu "Tater Tots": $5 I love taking the chance to try fusion foods. These little morsels of mashed potatoes with tonkatsu-style breading and frying were a display of how Ace Wasabi knows how to have balanced fun. Perfect ratio of breading to mashed potato, consistent texture and color, along with a sweet-spicy sauce to round out the experience. Bravo to them for knowing how to show restraint and subtlety in a fried dish.


Bori Bori Tuna (crispy rice with spicy tuna): $12 Nothing to make a huge deal about, but plentiful with the tuna, warm and crispy rice base, and a unique style of a chunkier spicy tuna make this worth at least one try.


Crunchy Spicy Tuna Roll: $6 A favorite happy hour selection among many reviews. Excellent ratio of rice to filling and fresh cucumber and lettuce make this a refreshing roll. I also want to give some praise to the nice snap and aroma of the seaweed outside that made for a high-quality roll.


Giant (charred) Calamari: $11 Just like it sounds, a big ol' slab of squid fresh off the grill. I love grill/char flavor and I like some fresh calamari. If you like those things, definitely worth a try.


Back in Black Roll: $17 Legitimately one of my favorite sushi rolls in all of California. It had a rich and full seafood taste. The real crab with the smooth scallop gave just enough texture to appreciate the combination. Melt-in-your-mouth salmon on top with strikingly shiny black tobiko. And they didn't over sauce it! Every bite hits several senses at once and makes you appreciate the thought they put into their rolls.


And of course BINGO! At the end of happy hour (630), everyone gets a free bingo card with a chance to win a gift certificate to the restaurant. I didn't win, but appreciated how organized the whole concept was and it was a blast for those couple of minute. A necessary part of our first experience.


The last thing I'll say it sit at the sushi bar if this is your first time. All of the sushi chefs were professional, personable, and willing to answer any questions about the menu. They accommodate well to special requests, and know how to time your food for a relaxed but not overly slowed experience.


Alright Ace Wasabi, here's your 5 stars. We'll be seeing you again soon.
author: Dave H.

description: Having been to most highly rated sushi spots in SF, I always find myself coming back here. Will and the Sushi Bar guys are LEGIT and know how to roll it up. The music is good, the saki is flowing, and the rolls are DOPE. Don't take reservations so be prepared to wait a little but it's honestly so worth it!!!!! Will and his buddies are the BESTN
author: Katie T.

description:
Ace Wasabi is unassuming from the outside. Always thought it would be a standard, cheap sushi spot but it's definitely trendy and has a good ambiance. 

Arrived at about 8pm on a Wednesday and didn't have to wait for a table. We first split the 8 piece toro mixed sashimi plate. Website says it's $33 but it was actually around $40. The fish was good but not great by any means. We also split the rocket man roll. It was good and crunchy, but pretty plain and not anything special. 

The service was also just okay. Our food took such a long time to come out and our waitress didn't provide us with any updates. We had another table of 3 next to us order after and get their food first which was frustrating. 

There are so many good sushi spots in the city and while Ace Wasabi was good and in a convenient location for us, we will probably opt for other options in the area in the future.
author: Jessie K.

description:
Would the Japanese appreciate this place? No.

Would the sashimi "conissoures" appreciate this place? No. 

Would someone strolling through the marina wanting a sushi roll fix appreciate this? Hella. 

Can you get some chardonnay that does not go with sushi at all here and get a little sloshed? Definitely. 

Overall, the rolls are good. The fish is fresh. The price is reasonable. It is a solid spot that is pretty popping in the evenings.
author: Nikita K.

description: OMG!OMG!OMg!!!  thats the only word that I think off about this place ! The fish is soooo fresh just like they are swimming in ur mouth lol ! And the service is incredible !!! Make me feel like I am home! I love the chefs here .they are so hilarious and friendly !!!! Just feels like talking with an old friend !!! Definitely coming back for everything !!!!
author: HB T.

description: 10/10!!! We came here at a typical busy Friday night and I would have to say it was worth the wait! And I have nothing but good things to say about this place. Good sushi and OMG. This awesome guy named Will at the sushi bar and his crew is the very best!!! Come in and see for yourself why. Highly recommend this place and would absolutely come back again!!! Thank you!
author: Alexis D.

description:
Great food great service. Sat at the counter, walked by on a random Friday evening and couldn't resist the name! Luckily was seated quickly, but crowds were quickly coming in. Come in early if you want to catch their fantastic happy hour (5:30-6:30 M-Sa). Everything we ordered was delicious:
-Baked crab hand roll
-Hokkaido roll
-Tuna tataki
-Sashimi
-Bluefin Toro
Our chef Will was super hospitable and made it a memorable experience. 'Will' definitely be back again! :D
author: Kenny H.

description: Will at the sushi bar is the absolute best. If you get the opportunity, sit there versus one of the tables. You will get excellent service and be able to watch him make your order right in front of you. The fish is amazingly fresh and delicious, and rivals any sushi bar in SF. Highly recommend.
author: Nick B.

description:
Oh my gosh! Had the best time here tonight! We met the owner Ken who bought us shots and made my first experience here a BLAST! He has done a lot to keep everything modern and up to date with the tech standards of SF ;) 

Just added a new payment transaction option where u take a pic of the QR code and it will upload the receipt to everyone phone so u can pick out what u ordered to pay... no more dealing with Venmo! 

The sushi was amazing!!! we ordered the rocket man, ozzy, and back in black. All three were amazing (I'm more of a tempura-spicy kine person).  
If you are a sashimi kind of person the mixed plate is perfect. They also have a killer miso soup!
author: Sara M.

description: Awesome sushi.  The sushi bar is the place to sit. The guys are on it and entertaining.
author: Jim G.

description: Honestly my favorite neighborhood sushi! Never disappoints for dine in or take out. Fun atmosphere and nice employees. Sometimes it takes a minute for the hostess to greet you, but never really bothers me. Have also tried about half their menu at this point and have yet to find something I didn't like!
author: Katina K.

description:
Solidly mediocre sushi. I found the rice to be a bit on the tough side... pretty grainy. Great rice kind of makes or breaks sushi in my opinion, especially nigiri, and Ace Wasabi's didn't have that nailed. I also got a few big punches of wasabi in the sake nigiri (like, assault to the face), and some pieces seemed to have none at all. Might've just been an off night, considering all the great reviews.

The fish seemed to be of good quality though, so don't fret about that!
author: Megan B.

description:
I came here on a weeknight and it was pretty packed. We were a group of 3 but we were able to be seated pretty quick. 

We ordered a lot but all of them were amazing!! I love those rolls, they were very different from the other sushi places I have been to. It was fresh, it was delicious. It's been awhile since I had it, so I don't remember all the details but here are the ones we order: 

2 PAC
Rocket Man
Victoria's Secret
Marley's mango lobster (this one was not as good as the others but still amazing!) 
Appetizer: short ribs 

There is no parking around this place. But that's true for almost all SF restaurants. The price was a bit higher than other places but I think it's well justified. I will definitely come back to this place! I will recommend this place to my friends.
author: Ashley H.

description: My 2 friends and I got the "Bring it On" sampler, and it was tasty AF. Throw in some Unagi and Uni pieces of sushi, and you got yourself one delicious (and pretty expensive) dinner! Aside from the delicious food, the servers are all chill and the music is awesome! If you haven't given this place a try, I highly recommend it.
author: Mikey L.

description: Loved the sushi and my experience here! Typically sitting at the bar is meh but this time we had great conversation with the sushi chef. Got the omakase sampler, so fresh and amazing! Even my husband who doesn't normally enjoy sashimi THAT much really enjoyed it. The rolls are great too- what I like about them is that there's not too much rice and no fish. We went HAM and got the "Bring It On Sampler" for just the two of us  and it was delicious!!
author: Nanette W.

description:
Excellent service by the sushi bar team - esp Will and Kim!!! 

Great food, fun atmosphere, and great staff. Love this neighborhood spot! We love to order the hamachi kama and the 20pc sashimi plate. Looking forward to trying the spider roll next time.
author: Crystal K.

description: High priced & not impressed with the sushi quality. Very unhealthy sushi options for a sushi place!
author: Syrah A.

description: Amazing sushi, definitely some of the best I've ever had! A bit pricey but worth it. Highly recommend the Crunchy Ace Wasabi and Rocket Man rolls.
author: Quincy W.

description:
Ace is one of my favorite sushi joints in the city. Excellent vibe and unbeatable service. Definitely sit at the sushi bar, my boys are killin it!!

Definitely a great recommendation for a casual date night with amazing sushi.

Sashimi is always on point, Maui roll with the macadamia nuts, and shunjuku are my favorite
author: Sean G.

description:
My son wanted to get Sushi in San Francisco. 
I looked up places and Ace Wasabi looked good.
Well it wasn't good it was GREAT!
We sat at the bar and ask the Chef to make us something Wow he did a great job. He made us a Rocketman roll and 2Pac roll FANTASTIC! I told him about my son wanting to experience sushi and he made us a special treat with Snow Crab, it was a one of a kind food bomb excellent! 
Chef Will took care of us!
author: Kos C.

description:
Came for the bingo and was pleasantly surprised by how delicious all the food was! Parmesan edamame? Yes please!

The atmosphere is fun and lively, but seating was pretty limited. Going for bingo? Sit at the bar and if someone sitting there wins the entire bar gets a free drink!
author: Staci L.

description:
Great place for sashimi, fresh premium and ready to eat. 

Atmosphere is great and servers are awesome.

If you're flying solo or don't mind the bar. Both the bar and sushi bar are both great selections!
author: Nathaniel F.

description: Ahh I'm in love with this place!! Not only because I won sushi bingo but also because the food is really good. :) My coworkers and I popped by here at 5.30pm after work for Ace's happy hour. We did make a reservation but the place was dead so you don't really need to (we came on a Wednesday night). Anyways, we ordered two bottles of wine, beer, a ton of appetizers & sushi/sashimi and the bill was only $122 for the 5 of us. Insanely good! If you want an epic happy hour with awesome food and the chance to win $20 at bingo, come here.
author: Mira B.

description: Love love love this place!!! It can get busy, but the bar is open seating so I frequently sit w my good friend, sushi chef (and food God) Kim. My go-to's are the shinjuku roll, crab hand roll & the salmon tacos. SO yum. Hands down the best sushi in the entire Bay Area!!!
author: Jacky Z.

description: This place has delicious sushi. I think the owner might had owned Tokyo Go Go, and I'm sad it's gone. I felt that they were better than Blowfish but they ain't around no more, so I guess I'm wrong. Cocktails and sushi time!
author: Moneey P.

description:
Walked in on a Saturday evening and was able to snag 2 seats at the sushi bar with no wait at all. While sitting at a table would have been more intimate, there are very few tables and they're usually accommodating larger parties and can get pretty squished. Choosing the sushi bar was a perfect choice also because we had front row seats to the sushi chefs and the kitchen grill. 

My favorite dish was from the grill; the short ribs were amazing! Appropriately greasy, flavorful, and not too fatty with tons of really thin cut meat on every bone. The serving size was surprisingly big considering it was a small plate. 

I particularly appreciated my experience because the sushi chef we had was really nice. He was super attentive and was always checking in on us. He even treated me and the duo sitting next to us to a complimentary roll. It was fun to watch him cut the sashimi and carefully craft the plates. 

Also, considering the price of Japanese food in SF, I was really pleasantly surprised when we didn't rack up a ridiculous bill. Would definitely come again!
author: Kathy T.

description: I go to ace ALL THE TIME. This place is amazing. It's got an amazing happy hour and they play bingo every night. It's the perfect date night, cause it's in the best location to walk around after or go to a bar.
author: Aimee L.

description:
Absolutely love this place. Will, Kim, and Peter are the absolute best sushi chefs in SF. They know what they're doing and are extremely personable. Every time I go here my experience gets better and better. #WillKim&Peter!

- Cet
author: Cetty C.

description: Waited quite a bit longer than we were originally told, but loved the food and the atmosphere once we got seated. Had the Brussels sprouts, gyoza, and the sushi sampler. Server was extremely friendly and food was delicious.
author: Daniella J.

description:
I rarely write reviews. But I felt like I had share with you this restaurant's secret weapon: Will. 

Will mans the second sushi bar at Ace Wasabi. And if you're lucky enough to sit in front of him, ask for omakase. He will not disappoint. 

He will guild you on a delicious sushi adventure, and may even share a sake cheers with you! 

Is you love sushi and having fun (find me someone who doesn't!), grab a seat in front on Will at Ace Wasabi.
author: Hillary N.

description:
One of my favorite sushi restaurants in the city. The food is mind blowing-ly good! I don't think there was a dish that I did not like. You HAVE TO TRY the mochi they serve. It's from Mochi Doki, a NYC chain (that I love and there's no where else in the West Coast you can get them except here- trust me, I've checked). 

The restaurant itself is so lively and cool. It definitely has a trendy vibe although still remaining authentic. 

Although the restaurant can get super busy, I recommend calling in advance or else you might have to wait a while. Although, not to discourage anyone from waiting since it really is worth the wait.
author: M T.

description:
It's not about the food at this spot. It's about the scene. If you're looking for good sushi this is not for you. It's a waste of money for sure. Go across the street to cafe plant organic. At least you'll get some nutrition.
Overwhelmed staff and chaotic when I went here. Not good and such tiny portions!
author: E. R.

description: Sat at the bar on a Monday night. Fantastic service and menu for Happy Hour (5:30 p.m. - 6:30 p.m, Mon - Sat). Had the 20 pc sashimi and the Hamachi Kama. Presentation and taste was excellent! Highly recommend if you're in the Marina-Cow Hollow area.
author: Tommy L.

description:
y'all thought i was jk but irly need to go back n get the "sushi knife haircut". so named bc i asked barbro where he gets his fade & he waved around his chef knife like "i use this!"

E for effort on barbro mentally taking my 5-dish starting order... then asking what the 1st item was again... then ultimately leaving out the last item. lol it's all good not trippin.

this place is fun. obv not for soosh purists, but pure fun. :p beezys.

(^_^) Bori Bori $11 (http://bit.ly/2gmrtLK)
just ffffin get it

(^_^) Grilled Beef Short Ribs $14 (http://bit.ly/2hm9qD3)
dem japanese pickles doe

(^_^) Amaebi $8 (http://bit.ly/2gEbUN0)
get some head (http://bit.ly/2hirWAp)

(-_^) Lobster Gyoza $14 (http://bit.ly/2hm99Ac)
dip in the chicken aioli

(-_-) Fried Chicken Fingers $9 (http://bit.ly/2h84hSM)
nah y'all. dryyy.

(?_?) Charred Calamari Tentacles $7
idk this is the one that didn't come #twss

love how mexican employees were speaking japanese and asian employees were speaking spanish. cool af.

some customer's birthday the night i went; special plate brought out w singing.

this place is just good times all around.
author: Dan B.

description: What else can I say, Ace Wasabi is the best sushi restaurant in San Francisco and Ken (the owner) has been doing it for over 20 years offering a high quality product without a crazy price tag. I usually go for the happy hour, which is one of the best in the city with 50% off Sashimi platters plus other amazing deals and bingo. It's a really fun environment with a great staff, creative art, and of course Rock-N-Roll. Lots of bad sushi in SF in boring environments, which is why this is the only place for me.
author: Russ Z.

description: Got 2 rolls at happy hour. Good place to go if you want cheap wine at happy hour with friends. Bad place to go if you want decent sushi. Got the rock n roll and California roll and, as someone who gets sushi on a weekly basis and was excited about the 4 star reviews for this place, it was just...ok. California roll was bland (even for the most basic roll), and the rock n roll had eel with a ton of little bones in it. With the amount of good sushi places in the Bay Area, this place is not worth returning to
author: Heather R.

description: I am always busy here... countless times. We love this place so much. In addition to the decor and ambiance, one of my favorite sushi chefs work here!!  He is a super nice, knowledgeable chef. I've never seen a chef with such variety. Every dish he made was superb. Five star plus!  Come and try this place. You won't regret.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday night at 8pm and there was no wait for three people. Pretty dark lit place but has good service. 

Sushi rolls were reasonably priced had the usual you'd expect plus specialty house rolls that were more expensive. All in all good quality of food and good service.
author: Yoo J.

description:
Favorite spot for sushi in SF. I've sat at the bar, sushi bar, and dining. Every experience is 5 star. Chefs go above and beyond. Most recently when my wife and I went, our order included an 8pc nigiri - it was a chefs choice. TRY IT! Favorite was the shiro maguro. 

tl;dr bring your date, sit at the sushi bar, enjoy...
author: Cody B.

description:
This is a really cool spot -it seems to be a cross between the neighborhood bar and the neighborhood go to bar.

The sushi was good, the drinks cold, and the price just right.

This is a busy and chill spot - so don't feel like you need to dress up.
Also - this place is lively - so don't come here on a date and expect it to be quiet. 

I'll be back for sure
author: Renzo C.

description: Came in around 6 for some $6 sushi rolls then stayed for Bingo! Everyone gets a free bingo card and you can win a $20 gift certificate! We went on a Monday at it was packed though so maybe come earlier to make sure you get a seat!
author: John T.

description:
Came here for my birthday dinner and it was a great spot for that type of occasion. I had ~14 people, made my reservation about a month in advance, and they accommodated me with no problem. The first phone call they did say that I would have to have my ENTIRE party there before we could be seated (uh...ever try to get 14 people to show up at the exact same time? Yea not gonna happen!), but the subsequent few times I called they said that wasn't an issue anymore.

We were seated in the back room which looked to also be a few other birthday parties. The atmosphere back there is super fun - sake bombs, music, & pretty loud. The sushi selection was actually pretty diverse, which I enjoyed. We got edamame (spicy & non spicy), and fried chicken to share. I got the hokkaido role, which was actually very tasty! I didn't expect this type of party-sushi-restaurant to also have really great sushi, but the rolls that I tried and ordered were pretty damn good.

They sang happy birthday to me with a little candle in an ice cream mochi, which I thought was a cute touch. Overall great experience for the group :)
author: Betty M.

description:
One of my favorite sushi restaurant around 
Kind of loud but great food to say the least 
Prices are fair . Parking is tough but it's in a nice neighborhood. The drinks are amazing. I love when they have bingo night . Last time I won $100 and got a free dinner . The have my favorite uni !
author: Ellen K.

description:
This is probably my favorite sushi spot in the city. It is lively, hip, delicious, and most of all unique. Both the food and drinks are pretty fantastic. Try the smoke bomb if you like sake bombs. We got some otoro, ami ebi, and a couple of rolls. Also don't forget about mochi ice cream. 

Service was rock solid. Even though it was bustling they were able to seat us quickly. We decided to sit at the sushi bar as it is fun to watch Will and Peter make your sushi before your eyes. They are a fun bunch with their main goal to create works of art and entertain. 

I would recommend to anyone looking for sushi
author: Matthew G.

description:
3.5 STARS

I joined a bunch of friends for what they were calling a man shower. Basically, one last night of drinking and having fun before he became a baby daddy. I believe someone made a reservation for 8 people at Ace Wasabi's Rock 'n' Roll Sushi on Friday, August 2nd at 8pm.

*Hamachi lime roll: yellowtail, jalapeno, lime, cilantro, tobiko ($8) ×3
*Crunchy sake roll: crispy potato bits rolled w/soy bean paper, salmon, thin slices of lemon ($14) ×3
*Marley's mango lobster roll: maine lobster, mango, cilantro, macadamia nuts w/spicy aioli ($14) ×3
*Spider roll: crispy soft shell crab, avocado, lettuce ($11)
*Lobster gyoza potstickers: maine lobster, scallions ($14)
*Blistered shishito peppers: lemon, sea salt ($6) ×2
*Hamachi kama: grilled yellowtail collar w/ponzu ($12)
*Uni: sea urchin, mendocino ($10 nigiri) ×2
*Mixed sashimi: 20 slices of today's fresh fish selected by the chef ($42) ×2

I didn't eat much of the food except for the shishito peppers, uni nigiri, and the mixed sashimi. I love shishito peppers, but they were super under salted. A little disappointing. The uni nigiri was okay. Sweet, creamy, and they piled the uni on top. After we got the uni though, we realized we should have added a quail egg to give it that extra richness. I didn't really like the sushi rice in the nigiri. It was a little mushy. I'm not exactly sure what was in the sashimi plate, but I tried one of each kind. We got four slices each of five different varieties of fish. They were all pretty fresh. I know we got hamachi, sake, and maguro. Not sure what the other two were.

Of course, we had to drink! They boys wanted nigori, so we stuck to the Sayuri (300 ml): floral and creamy ($15) ×7 and Sapporo: 21 oz ($10) ×4. Make sure to shake each bottle of nigori as it got thicker and thicker, the more we got into the bottle. I'm not a huge fan of this sake as I prefer crisp, dry sakes, but it was easy to drink.

I loved the music here. They were playing 90s hip hop and r&b, which I adore. The music is bumping and the atmosphere is boisterous, so this is definitely not a place for a quiet intimate date. But for a fun night of drinking and eating, Ace will definitely do. Saw a bunch of people doing sake bombs around us.

Fun place with average sushi. Rounding up to four stars because of the great music!
author: Elena N.

description: This place is fun!!  We sat at the back sushi bar and peter, will and yabin were awesome. They had great sushi recommendations and were super friendly. We even did a sake shot or two with them. Great prices and the food was fresh and tasty. A place like this needs to be visited multiple times. We will be back!!!
author: Michael G.

description: Wow... I mean wow. I went to Ace last night and sat at the Sushi bar. Will was the absolute best! He made me one piece of sushi at a time and each piece was absolutely amazing. That is the way to go. On top of the great food we had a blast yuck'n it up and drinking sake. Ace is definitely worth trying.
author: Dick M.

description: One of the best sushi I have had! My GF and I came here for happy hour and sat at the bar. The sushi bar chefs were awesome and super friendly. We got a few items off the HH menu and the "Three Amigos" off the regular menu. Everything was very good. The tempura was bomb. At 630 they do bingo which was a fun surprise too. I'll be definitely coming back.
author: Aaron S.

description:
Ace wasabi is my absolute favorite restaurant in the marina.  The sushi is always incredibly fresh and so tasty.  If you're looking for a good date night (or even a regular spot) I would recommend sitting at the sushi counter in the back.  The sushi chefs are so friendly and make for a really fun interactive experience. 

Additionally, the music is always so fun
author: Rachel B.

description:
Never really make it to SF, but this place is a gem. The combination of food, drinks, jams and company made it a dream come true.  The lighting is dim and as soon as you walk in you hear the music bumpin' like it was 2005. They were playing Nelly "Hot In Herre" when I walked in and I swear the sprinklers started going off! I was also wearing a fire fit so who knows, maybe I set it off. The music wasn't too loud like a club going up on a Tuesday or too quiet like when my grandma works at the library, it was just right. 
Sat down and ordered a couple nice cold brews for me and my friend that I hadn't seen in 5 years. The brews were colder than Mt. Kilimanjaro and quenched our thirst because we're young professionals and we deserved it. We ordered the Chili edamame to get the tastebuds ready for a voyage of the deep blue sea. She likes here sushi fried so I ordered a Spider roll and added cream cheese. Cream cheese makes everything better so I was definitely okay with that. We also ordered the sake avocado roll and the hamachi lime roll. Those rolls were spectacular!
I highly recommend this place! I'm not sure who's playlist was playing that day, but that person should either be a DJ or get a raise.
author: Jose G.

description: Loved it! Every roll i ate tasted amazing and unique. Definitely will come back for more!
author: Liki N.

description: Worth every dollar. Came in on a Sunday night after work. And let me tell you they never disappoint. I recommend sitting at the sushi bar the conversation with the chefs is great and sometimes they like to drop a treat on you.
author: Michael P.

description: Fantastic neighborhood restaurant. Good quality sushi. Fun atmosphere. Want the best sushi deal in town? Come for a the bingo happy hour-$6 rolls generous $11 sashimi plate. Sit at the counter and meet Reuben, the head sushi chef when we were there. Made the night more fun and delivered killer sushi. The 10 minute round of bingo was surprisingly fun fast and kitch. Highly recommend! Also the prices for the non-happy hour offerings were really really reasonable too.
author: Shannon B.

description:
Seriously the BEST sushi place in SF. 

Friendly and prompt staff, fresh sushi, and great drinks. 

Always worth the visit when I'm in the city. 

Shout out to the CREW for the great food and the great time.
author: Kevin W.

description: Has a pretty weird experience here which is why I'm only giving it three stars. My coworker and I decided we wanted sushi and heard really good things about this place. We arrived shortly after they opened and it was already packed. We put our names in and was told it would be about a 20 minute wait. We told the hostess we were gonna go over to the bar. About forty minutes later we were still waiting so I proceeded to check on what was taking so long. The hostess said that because we went to the bar she didn't think we wanted a table anymore. I was like why would you assume that without asking. She then tried seating us at the sushi bar which was so crowded you couldn't move.  I told her we wanted an actual table. She eventually got us in a table in the back with the rowdiest group of college students who were singing on the top of their lungs. I'll be honest, I had a long day at work and really was just annoyed at this point. The only saving grace was how good the sushi was. It tasted very fresh and the Brussels sprouts appetizer was pretty amazing. Our waitress was a little weird and sort of hovered over us at one point but she wasn't bad. I would give them another try because the food was so good.
author: Heather S.

description: We're SUPER picky with our sushi joints and we were visiting from Phoenix. This place sold us for these treasonable: they offered at least 1 rice-free roll option (Sake Kirota), they offered a happy hour with half off sashimi and rolls Mon-Sat, offered high-end sashimi fish options and had really UNIQUE specialty rolls. We tried to 2Pac which was excellent, the 20-piece sashimi (excellent) the blue tuna belly nigiri (amazing), and a standard eel and avocado roll. Megan was our server and she was above-and-beyond with attending to our needs and engaging in fun conversations. Would we come back again? Absolutely. This was one of the best eateries we attended in San Francisco, and its hip, trendy, low-key, unpretentious, and really fresh and original. We. Loved. It!
author: Annalise B.

description: My favorite sushi spot in SF! Love their creative rolls, service is always great, and bingo happy hour is fun if you can make it in time! It's also great for large groups, they don't mind if you get a little rowdy.
author: Nat A.

description:
Will is the BEST sushi chef!
Please sit at the sushi counter and let him guide the experience. You will not regret the evening.
author: Victoria C.

description: This place looked super awesome and fun but sadly I was let down. We got a table and so many people were crowded around the table next to ours that two of us had to crawl under the table to get to our seats- was honestly a bit odd. We also ordered a group of four of the house rolls and none of them really blew us away. SAD. But actually was sad, you would think if they were four of the best rolls that they would be the bomb! Finally we ordered a tater tot like appetizer and it came out last, after we had finished all of our food and had paid the bill. They took the app off the bill but honestly- with the time it took, we could have grown our own potatoes and whipped up our own tots. Would recommend other sushi options!
author: Julia D.

description: Great omakase experience here! Fun spot and good atmosphere on Fridays, particularly for groups.
author: Matt B.

description:
If you're looking for a good place to eat sushi, this is the place to be! 

Parking: Kind of hard to find. You might need to park a couple neighborhoods down.

Environment: Lighting is dim and everyone is loud since there is a lot of drinking going on. I for one being a part of the loudness with my sake bombs.

Food: Amazing! My group of 5 people shared Sampler platter, Victoria Secret, Mango Lobster roll, and fried calamari.
I don't really recommend the Mango Lobster roll just because it wasn't enough what they gave us and the walnut was a weird combination to it.

Service: The sweetest people. They were always quick and on top of everything. We were even served free complimentary sake for my friend's birthday!
author: Casey Y.

description: Ace is my new sushi spot, I love the quality of food and service is top notch. I was in great hands all thanks to Will, Gus, and Natalie - will be coming back!
author: Arian A.

description: Will the sushi chef is awesome! And the owner Ken is there on the weekends, super nice! Love this place and will be coming back whenever we want sushi!
author: Trevor S.

description: Great sushi and awesome happy hour prices! We sat at the sushi bar and had great service. The baked crab hand roll was our favorite, but the rock and roll and sake avocado rolls were also delicious.
author: Angie P.

description: Such a fun Japanese restaurant. Great selection to choose from, the sashimi was extremely fresh. I had the most memorable enjoyable roll I've ever had in my life. Mango, lobster and macadamia nuts. It was superb. Highly recommend a night out here!
author: David P.

description: Usually a go to place for casual sushi but the quality is very unreliable. Today for example, the sushi had scales all over it and was very sloppy. Some days it's great, others it's terrible.
author: Mallorie M.

description: Big shoutout to Kim, the chef at the bar for his hospitality! He was really chatty and even provided a free dish of fish for me and my date . I love the environment as well. You could choose the sushi bar, regular tables, or high tables. I recommend the sushi bar so you can meet Kim. We went during happy hour when the sashimi was half off, so make sure you go during then if you want to save! The quality of the food was great and I enjoyed all their rolls.
author: John C.

description: Perfect but expensive price , clean and tasty but it will be nice if they modify the prices
author: Ali A.

description:
An amazing experience eating here. The fish provided for all of their sushi and sashimi was top notch, and each piece is so well made. Their happy hour is also a bonus,  with great prices and selection of choices. Definitely a place to visit if you're looking for good ambience, fresh fish, and a delicious experience overall!

P.S. - they have Bingo during happy hour, which is a fun experience!
author: Chow L.

description: Staff is super nice! Love the food and the atmosphere. Omakase 8 pcs is definitely a must try. Toro is sooooo buttery. Would come back for sure
author: Doreen D.

description:
I came here yesterday with a total group of 2 and was not impressed with the experience.

We easily spent over $100 for two people and the quality of the sushi was not worth the amount we paid. $20+ for a roll is absurd and it's even more absurd when it's sub par. Not to mention, i've never had to wait more than 40 minutes for food to be delivered to our table, especially when it's raw, uncooked sashimi served on rice?

Not sure why this place has great ratings, but if you want to spend a lot and get nothing special then check it out.
author: Zaher A.

description: Off the main strip of Chestnut on Steiner is a popular Japanese restaurant. Not cheap as 3 items (tempura and 2 rolls) totaled $45. Food was good but nothing to die for. The tempura batter was thick not the panko that would make it lighter and more tasty. The 2 rolls were of good size and had good taste. The fish was fresh which made the rolls worthwhile. The water that was served was refreshing and worth drinking more than a standard drink. Would I go back, not sure.
author: David H.

description:
Such a warm, inviting experience at Ace Wasabi's! My party of three were welcomed by such a sweet hostess and our waitress, Makayla was awesome! She sat us at the sushi bar and we had such a unique experience. We ordered 5 sushi rolls for the three of us and chili edamame (SO GOOD). In between our sushi rolls--compliments of our fantastic chef Sam- we were given grilled fish ribs which were so tender and tasty. And then when we thought we were done, we received poke tostadas which were so fresh with mango and topped with sesame seeds. Would highly recommend this place to anyone in the area.

10/10 would go back. Great service, very attentive and meticulous chefs and food is reasonably priced (especially for sushi).
author: Ashley R.

description: Wow so glad I decided to travel here. I enjoyed every bit of my meal. I had the Hamachi lime roll, 2pac, Hoikkado, Sake Kirato, the riddle sprouts and tater tots. So many flavors and all stood on their own! The margarita was strong and delicious. Shout out to the owner of Ace Wasabi! There was a situation, he handled and came back with saki shots and said, "Can I please give you a hat?" I will definitely be back to visit and enjoy the great food and atmosphere. Don't let the rock n roll fool you I heard Drake, Alina Baraz Nick Minaj and more while here. Can't wait to come back!! I love the super techy experience when we walked in with no reservation (only can open table 5 or more people) and the hostess took my phone number and twenty minutes later I received a text saying my table was ready.
author: Farah D.

description:
This is an amazing place for sushi. Sit at the bar and talk to Will, Sam and Peter and they'll take good care of you. They are amazing at what they do. 

It's not your traditional sushi place where you have a limited selection of sushis. It's a place where you have fun and sushi.
author: Mayank M.

description: Came here for happy hour on a Saturday evening with my roommate and it was absolutely delicious. We sat at the bar and the service was excellent - all of thanks to Will! Would recommend to all my friends and will definitely be coming back soon!
author: Isabel A.

description:
This place is fine if you're in the right mood and you're looking for the right thing.  

First, it's a little more expensive than it should be, but that's probably because of the neighborhood (everything is expensive here).  

Second, it's a roll place, meaning they specialize more in fancy rolls than simple quality rice and fish.  Which I guess makes sense since they have Roll in their name.

Third, they take the "Rock" in their name just as seriously.  Not only are their unique posters of rock stars and music legends with pieces of sushi photoshopped in, but they're also blasting music the entire time and give a very clubby atmosphere. 

Like I said, good if you're in the mood for it, not if you're expecting a more traditional sushi environment.
author: Denis S.

description: This is my favorite sushi place in San Francisco. The Ozzy roll is my personal favorite. Overall, this place has great service and amazing food.
author: Kyra L.

description: Loved this restaurant! We sat by the sushi bar and Will took care of us! such an amazing sushi Chef! Him and his crew where unbelievable. We loved it and had an amazing time, sake bombs and the best sushi!
author: Maca G.

description: I almost don't want to leave this review because I don't want anyone taking up room at my favorite sushi bar in the city!!! Holy moly this is the best omakase I've ever had and all chefs have such attention to detail to make sure you truly salvage every bite! Small apps are amazing, bingo is amazing, seriously this is a place for a large crew to drink and have some sushi, but also a date night to impress with your nigiri. This is hands down a hidden gem in the marina and makes you want to come back for more!
author: Morgan P.

description: This is my favorite sushi bar in SF. The sushi chefs are so nice, i enjoy talking with them.  The fish is so fresh, my favorite are uni, sweet shrimp , sake toro. And the price is reasonable. I sure u will have a great night there.
author: Yan L.

description:
Today was my second time at this restaurant but I loved it even more because of the great service! My server was Sophie I think, and she made sure we we're very taken good care of. 
The food was great especially the hokkaido role it was one of our favorites.
We would especially recommend to eat this one.
If you are a Drinker and would like to drink while enjoying theirs great roles, I would also recommend getting on of their cider bombs. I'm not too sure of the name but it was recommended by the server.
I greatly appreciate service at a restaurant and it is definitely what our server delivered. 
I also recommend to get their fried calamari!
We didn't know what kind of appetizer to get and I'm so happy we got that, it was really good. 
I would definitely come back to the restaurant it had really good service. It is a great thing a restaurant should always have !
author: Minerva L.

description:
We got seated at the sushi bar (preference) and gorged ourselves on some of the best sushi we've had in a while. It wasn't ridiculously expensive either. Pro Tip - If you plan on having a few rolls, start with a protein (the charred octopus is a steal) and in the middle of your meal, get the spicy chili edamame (huge plate of it for cheap). This will keep your total down and limit your rice intake. 

Friendly sushi bar service complete with a special end-of-the-meal mini roll that was out of this world. Somehow we got out of there for under $100 and had beer and sake too. Will definitely be back for BINGO Happy Hour next time to save even MORE moolah. Only downside is you might be surrounded by some Marina bros and it can get hot if you are sitting at the sushi bar b/c their grill is directly behind the chefs.
author: Sarah B.

description: Amazing bar service (Natalie was awesome)!! Place gets pretty busy, excellent food (Rocket man was on point). Drinks are on the expensive side.
author: Joseph C.

description:
Great neighborhood sushi spot! Always fun to sit at the bar and let the chefs prepare you something unique. Always trying new things here! 

If you're not as adventurous, the basics are still delicious and for a reasonable price in this area. Highly recommend!
author: Avi L.

description: Awesome place with great sushi! The ambience is so trendy and hip. Amazing service from all the staff especially Melody, Will, and Peter (I recommend sitting at the sushi bar)!! This is my go-to sushi place in San Francisco.
author: Kat H.

description: Great place for happy hour! Came in around 6:15pm on a Friday night and was seated immediately. We got some wine, apps, and rolls and played happy hour bingo. Would love to come back again!
author: Hillary V.

description: My favorite go-to sushi spot in the Marina! Great service and amazing sushi. Will at the sushi bar is the homie!!
author: Kelley E.

description: The food is SO good and prices are incredibly reasonable. The staff is always friendly and nice. It's one of my all time favorite sushi places in the city. They also have great wines and sake on their menu
author: Sophia A.

description:
We went in without reservations and got seats for four at the sushi bar at 6pm. Service was great. The three sushi chefs were all really friendly and fun to talk with.  We like seeing them create their sushi dishes.
We got the grilled short ribs & calamari, scallops, & various dishes of sushi which all were delicious.  Service was quick & efficient.  Really fresh sushi & would go back and try different dishes.
author: Nan O.

description: My go-to sushi spot in the Marina. I've been here with parents, friends, and dates- it's always the best experience! Very fresh sashimi (my favs: Unagi and Walu). Also tasty trendy rolls. Must try the Sake Kale. Shout out to the guys behind the sushi bar- Will, Yubin and Peter. They make the dining experience A+. Also for dessert they have mochi flavors I've never seen anywhere else! Yum salted caramel!
author: Delaney L.

description: The quality of the fish was just not good. Ok let's get apps and rolls, see what happens. Nope not better! We could not finish our dinner, it was that mediocre. Service was fine though, but I wish they would have realized and said something given how we barely at half of all 5 dishes we ordered
author: Anna B.

description:
WHAT?!! This place is EVERYTHING! Incredible staff that genuinely loves their job due to the incredible management.That's a five star worthy in itself!!

BUT, let's talk food! 3 Amigo Roll and Rainbow Roll is what you need. Hamachi Lime and Sake Avocado were also Amazing! Be good to yourself, eat amazing sushi!

Shout out to Ken for making our experience more than amazing!
author: Kaile T.

description: Can I just eat all day here??? Awesome staff, they're so chill and helpful, it makes you really relaxed and able to enjoy the atmosphere of this place. The food is amazing. The wagyu beef potstickers were delicious and the sushi rolls were delicious and filling. They had an awesome happy hour menu, but I think the coolest thing was bingo during happy hour, which sadly I had to leave right before. I'll continue to visit, but if your looking for a chill hangout with laidback vibes, definitely check this place out.
author: Daniel P.

description: This was our second time here, and I definitely like eating at the sushi bar than the table. We came during happy hour with just 15 minutes to spare! The 20 piece seasonal sashimi is the best deal EVER during happy hour. Plus bingo starts at 6:30! Haven't won *yet* but we'll keep coming back to test our luck!
author: Amanda L.

description: Delicious sushi with great people....Is an understatement! Ambiance is fun and hip! Will the sushi chef is AWESOME and his specialities are amazing! One of my favorite places and I love Sushi!!
author: Gillian K.

description:
It's no Kusakabe, but I still give it 5 stars for its atmosphere, service and location.

Ace has been around since the mid-90s, and it's a great staple in the Marina. The crowd is exactly what you'd expect it to be - young professionals in their 20s and 30s either out on a date night, birthday celebration or just getting quick bites and sake bombs or cocktails before heading out to bars. The vibe is hip despite its cheesy-ish "Hard Rock Cafe" type theme.

I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but if I'm in the neighborhood, it's worth checking out!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
It's been a really long time since I've had Sushi.  An oddly long time.   I moved up to East Bay from Santa Barbara where the sushi is amazing.  Im so happy this was my first adventure back in the saddle in many long sushi-less months. 

I love the atmosphere at Ace.  It's got a local neighborhood vibe that is refreshing given how many touristy restaurants there are in SF.  Their music? On point.  Our service was great.  The food is reasonably priced.  This is the kind of place you can go to with a group of friends or on a date and you'll be guaranteed to have a good time, unless you don't like sushi or are boring...

We ordered the edamame and short ribs to start.  The edamame were perfectly steamed and not overly salty.  The short ribs were mouthwatering good; tender with a lot of flavor.  We ordered the 12- piece mixed sashimi, the Ozzy and the Victoria's Secret Rolls.  The sashimi was great and sliced in perfect portions.  The rolls were both made into perfect bite sized pieces that packed just enough heat and plenty of flavor. 

My sushi senses have been re-awakened and I'm going to need a few more trips to Ace, you know, just to be sure.  Rumor has it that there are some amazing Happy Hour offerings coming down the pipeline so stay tuned!
author: Sarah B.

description:
Rockin' sushi rolls!

Inventive sushi inspired after famous rock 'n' rollers. The sushi chefs are incredibly talented, fast, and very attentive even when the restaurant is packed. 

I came on date night. We ordered 'Scorpions' and 'Three Amigos.' Absolutely delicious! Definitely try Scorpions; this roll is unique to Ace Wasabi. Gourmet at a reasonable price. 

Since the restaurant was busy, I had to remind the waitress about our drinks. Hence the 4 out of 5 stars. However, our attentive sushi chef gave us free nigiri as we waited. Totally awesome! I'm hoping to visit again and update the rating to 5 stars, anticipating better service on a normal night. 

This is definitely THE place to check out if you're visiting the Marina!

FYI:

SCORPIONS - tempura rock shrimp, sea scallop, caramelized pecans topped w/ mango, avocado. 

THREE AMIGOS - tuna, yellowtail, eel, cucumber, avocado, wasabi tobiko w/soy aioli.
author: Joanna S.

description: This is the worst sushi place I've been to. We got the truffle edamame and they were so under cooked that they were crunchy. Then the rolls were falling apart on the plate. If you want to go here just save your money and go to super duper or Mel's Diner! Ace sushi? More like Fail Sushi!
author: Angie L.

description: Best sushi spot in the marina, by far! Great atmosphere, delicious sushi and friendly staff. We sat at the sushi bar and had an awesome experience, the food comes up quick. Overall you can't beat it.
author: Sarah G.

description:
When I approached the restaurant, the atmosphere takes you to a rustic feel of old restaurants you would find in Asaka Japan. The food was incredible! Best Toro I've had in my life and I've eaten at some very exquisite sushi bars around the world. 

Our chef, Will, was an incredible chef and was an incredible sport. I would highly recommend this place to others.
author: Truc N.

description: Ace Wasabi --- the sushi gem of chestnut street! Visit with Will at the sushi bar and you're sure to have an amazing meal, and a great experience -- this man can kills it in the kitchen! Don't pass by this place without eating, you'll thank me later
author: Aaron W.

description: This is one of my most favorite local spots. Will at the sushi bar is now a friend. The entire staff always takes great care of you and the fish/food is incredible. Great date spot and staple for any occasion. Highly recommend!!
author: Nick B.

description:
This place is the BEST sushi spot in San Francisco. Hands down! First off... the best and most entertaining sushi chefs in the world Sam and Will are here. You NEED to sit at the sushi bar and talk to these two. Not only do they make the best sushi in the city but you will be laughing the whole time with them. 

Everything you get here is good. I got 2 orders of the omasake nigiri and some cuts of sashimi. As well as the lobster gyoza and the dragon roll, recommended by chef Sam. All were A+ in taste and presentation. 

If you want the best experience and best sushi in California, you need to come here!!!!
author: Matthew T.

description: Amazing meal with Will and Newman at the counter! Leave it in their hands and they will create a spectacular meal!
author: Jessica W.

description: This place is awesome!  Great happy hour experience, one of the best deals in town.  Sushi chefs are friendly and take great care of you.  Fish was fresh.
author: Jay H.

description:
Great vibes and great sushi. We came in close to closing time, but the staff treated us nicely and even gave us an extra roll as they were closing up shop. That consideration went miles for us, as they very well could have rushed us out (I've worked in restaurants before - very frustrating when customers stick around that close to closing!).

If you're in the area, this is the place to go.

You've GOTTA try the Flying Kamikaze roll. Fantastic spicy tuna!
author: Ryan C.

description: Sat up at the bar and had a really great time. You can snag a great meal if you get in early for happy hour and make sure to be there for the one round of bingo!
author: Lauren S.

description:
The first time I visited Ace Wasabi's I was blown away by their happy hour deals. HAPPY HOUR HERE IS A MUST! $6 rolls and 50% off sashimi - are you kidding? If you want the full experience sit in front of the sushi bar as the chefs hand craft the sushi right in front of you. The service is super friendly and recommendations are always on point. 

Off the Happy Hour menu I'd recommend the Sake Avocado, Rock & Roll, Tempura Shrimp and as much sashimi as you can eat. 

My absolute favorites are the Tuna Poke Tostadas, the Maui (don't knock the macademia nuts til you try it - amazing crunch), Shinjuku and the Three Amigos (both have all the works, doesn't get much better than this).  

Since my first visit I've been back countless times with big and small groups and they are always accommodating. Take-out is also quick and easy! Ace Wasabi's is now my go-to sushi spot in SF - will be back for more!
author: Kelly M.

description: 20 piece sashimi was as good as it looks! Sushi was so fresh and a great deal during happy hour (5-6:30p 50% off).. Then we got the hook up from Will at the back bar with the most delicious caramel mochi   Definitely coming back!
author: Monique B.

description: Fresh and well-prepared sushi. More importantly, the service at the bar (Yuben and Will) is top notch. Always attentive, friendly, and accommodating. Highly recommended!
author: Christine Y.

description: This place is amazing! Love the ambiance and the sushi! The space is a little crowded and more tight at night but it has its charm. The employees are accommodating and nice. Sushi rolls are all music themed.
author: Amrita P.

description: Wow food was unreal, but more importantly Andrea and Sophie aka "Soph" made the night. Our wait staff was not only timely and polite but joined in the party with our lively crew. 10/10 would eat and sake again
author: Connor L.

description: This sushi restaurant is by far the best I have ever eaten in my life!!!!!!! I live in Los Angeles and my experience here was way better than any sushi I have eaten. Sam the chef welcomed us and was very friendly. He is an expert at what he does and deserves a raise! The owner was friendly as well. He talks to you like he knows you and is very welcoming. The place is very chill low light with great music in the background. Check this place out!!! You will not regret it.
author: David L.

description: We love it here! When I first moved to the city my father took me here as a celebratory meal (where the sweet staff treated us to sake shots) - I figured I wouldn't be able to eat sushi very often living here on my own - but we actually go to happy hour all the time! We love sitting at the bar, they always take care of us! The sushi is good quality- we try to opt for chefs choice when we can. We will be back, again, and again!
author: Carolyn R.

description: What a disappointment! I came in with my sister and it was a total letdown, especially the service. We have both worked in the food service industry for 10 plus years and was the first time we haven't given a 20% or more since we can remember. After waiting forty minutes and being almost through the meal I had to cancel my glass of wine after our server assured us he was checking on it a few times. He forget to bring our miso which he seemed really annoyed about when I asked him to take it off the bill. The food was all 2 star as well, except for the Brussels sprouts which were great. I'm actually real confused about all these good reviews. Maybe we went at the end of the ordering week so got the old fish and our server was just having a bad day. Whatever the case, lots of sushi in sf and restaurants in the marina. This is not one I would ever recommend.
author: brittany g.

description: For us, Ace Wasabi completely and consistently lives up its well-deserved hype. We are restauranteurs in the neighborhood and frequent this restaurant often - every time we leave so satisfied and so happy. The food quality is always prime, the service always friendly (easy going yet professional - a tough balance! - shoutout to Maddie :)) and the atmosphere always super positive. I love that they take traditional dishes and kick them up a few notches with inventive ingredients, combinations or styles that make us want to keep coming back again and again. Even something as simple as miso soup which you've had a million times at different places and it is always the same -- they somehow manage to make a super special one. The owner Ken is so kindhearted and a total hoot - not only do we love coming to Ace Wasabi, we feel good coming to Ken's place because of this. Thanks from your neighbors and see you next time!
author: Ellie S.

description: Came here for my birthday two weeks ago. I  made a reservation for 15 at 7:30 a month in advance. When we showed up, we had to wait 20 minutes to all get seated because there was a group of 4 sipping their drinks. Then the waiter spilled beer all over me. She was really apologetic and kept making sure I was fine which was nice. It was still a fun night, but considering we spent almost $700, I was expecting much better service.
author: Sara T.

description:
I'm in San Francisco quite a bit for work and always try to find time to stop by for Happy Hour which starts promptly at 5:30pm when they open. There are great happy hour deals on sushi & drinks, and if you sit in the bar and stick around until 6:30pm you get to play a free round of bingo for a $20 gift card!

I've had such a great experience during Happy Hour that I would come back later and sit in the dining room, but there's really no need if you can get there in time for the deals.
author: Catherine C.

description: Will and Peter served us up some delicious sushi at Ace Wasabi! Our first visit we had Will as our sushi chef and the experience was so divine that we came back two nights later! Peter took great care of us the second time around. Each night they treated us to some of their house specialities and dolled up our sushi orders with the expertise of a sushi chef in Japan. We are officially "regulars" at the sushi bar and are already eager to try some more items off the menu (and their secret menu!) on our next visit! Thank you, Ace Wasabi, for bringing a little piece of authentic Japan action to the Marina!
author: Rio R.

description: Not a big yelp reviewer, but this place deserves my effort. Their creativity and quality is unmatched, I would come here on a nightly basis if I had the time. Chef Will is both charismatic and talented. Best advice: go sit at the sushi bar and let him make you what he wants to serve. 5/5 stars without question.
author: Jack H.

description: We love happy hour here! We sat at the sushi bar where we had amazing service and very friendly sushi chefs. We can't wait to come back for wine and sushi rolls! The regular menu looks great as well but we only tried the happy hour menu on this visit.
author: Samantha S.

description:
1. We had to wait ~20 minutes after our reservation time for our table to be ready. 

2. The waitress spilled beer all over the back of the birthday girl. The waitress was really apologetic afterwards and I understand accidents happen, but really?! On the birthday girl? :(
author: Janice J.

description:
Our server Megan knows the menu really well and made some great recommendations, my favorite was the Tupac roll, tempura shrimp, spicy tuna topped with fresh salmon. YUM. 

Great ambiance in the restaurant, cool place to hang out. 

Will definitely be back for the fresh fish, great service, and of course, sake. :)
author: Mally S.

description: I loved it!! Great sushi rolls and sashimi. The service is excellent. It is worth the wait. The happy hour is very adorable. I will come back.
author: Silmarie N. M.

description: Great sushi. Good music. Sat at the sushi bar, the chefs were very friendly. Definitely recommend this place
author: Evan W.

description:
Unique experience @ the Sushi Bar.... guys were great and food was delicious.

Coming back soon!!
author: Miguel O.

description: The best motha f**kin sushi! The sushi chefs were amazing to hang out with as well. Great food and great customer service at the sushi bar! Will the chef is absolutely delightful. We had such an awesome experience!
author: Dani O.

description:
Ace Wasabi. It's got something for everyone. It's a rowdy Bigno-playing happy hour loving American bar in the front, a classy conversation-conducive dining spot in the back room, and a traditional sushi bar in the middle. Diverse decorations all around--a disco ball, images of famous celebrities eating sushi, posters of AC/DC and Guns N' Roses, and a "Keep Calm and Sake Bomb" poster just for fun. Smiling staff to match the fun ambiance. I began rooting for this place before my first bite. As my March Madness bracket can attest, just because you root for a team, it doesn't mean they win.

I visited Ace Wasabi for happy hour, between 5:30-6:30 pm and got the $6 dollar sushi rolls--the Spicy Tuna and Eel Rolls. I ordered at about 6:00 pm and didn't get my meal until 6:30 pm,  but I was okay with that; I was having a great time taking in the ambiance and playing bingo. Then the food arrived. I was immediately disappointed--the rolls lacked vibrancy and the overcooked rice barely covered the seaweed underneath. The construction around each piece gave way a bit between my chopsticks. By the time the first piece hit my mouth, it dissolved into an indistinguishable combination of lukewarm flavors, with a chewy seaweed finish. At least the Kiran beer was refreshing and did the job washing it all away.

Ace Wasabi. It's got something for everyone...unfortunately, good sushi isn't one of those things.
author: Behnam S.

description: Wonderful experience the waiting staff was incredibly friendly and provided timely service. The sushi chefs were incredibly friendly also and even cracked a few jokes with us as we ate. To top it off the food was fantastic we had the fried chicken karage and the chicken was quite flavorful. The hokkaido roll was flavorful and also a treat for the eyes. Until we meet again Ace Wasabi!
author: James C.

description: Not a SF local.. asked around for a great sushi spot and was not disappointed. Surprisingly enough there wasn't a wait when we got in and our waitress Sophie was amazing. Very attentive and made sure our glasses we're never empty. She was never too far away if we needed something. She recommended the poke tostada and it was quite possibly the best thing I've ever had. Thank you Sophie for your great recommendations, your attentive service, and your friendly smile! Can't wait to come back!!
author: Ashley C.

description: Came here on a Saturday night and got seated right away. Tried the Rock & Roll, U2 and Brussel sprouts. Also had the green tea cheesecake. It was all amazing. Will behind the sushi bar is super cool too!
author: Osman K.

description: Great Sashimi and friendly chefs at the sushi bar. Rolls are solid and it's a lively atmosphere.
author: Ben J.

description: Ace Wasabi never disappoints, been coming here for years not sure what took me so long to write a review.....If you are looking for good sushi in a fun environment this is your place!
author: Allison S.

description: Sat at the sushi bar last night and every bite was delicious! Toro, hamachi, salmon belly! Great place to hang with friends.! Will definitely be back soon!
author: Victoria S.

description:
The last time I had come here had been in the first dot-com bubble, spending post-party-weekend  Sundays scarfing-down multiple orders of their succulently-creamy Philadelphia rolls, scheming with my buddy on bachelor partying strategies. 
Fast forward 12 years to last Friday night where I had my vegan family of five plus my nephew and his fiancee.
