We walk-in and it was the normal Marina young-Anglo-yuppie crowd and felt a bit out-of-place with such a large party with 3 kids under 8.  But as soon as we walked-in the server was ALL SMILES and they immediately situated us, for our own sanity, in the back, out of the way of the dim sushi bar room that had a very fun party bar social energy to it.  As we walked back to our table, the other employees greeted us with welcoming energy greetings.  My entire clan was able to catch their nightly bingo game - the kids LOVED it. We ordered their avocado cucumber rolls and they were amazing.  And since we hit bingo happy hour, we got a special deal on their Garden Roll (Crispy asparagus with garlic eggplant, avocado and scallion.)  I appreciate how they are willing to accommodate vegans.  They had some other cucumber vegan roll.  Not bad for a sushi place - at least they are aware of our growing population.  (My nephew who is not a vegan loved the place too!)
author: Khash C.

description:
This was my first time at Ace's (not sure how I missed this gem earlier, living only few blocks away) and Will at the sushi counter was super friendly and gave us an extra chef's special dish complimentary! His suggestions were exactly what we were looking for. Excellent mix of fun and deliciousness. Will, if you are reading this...keep up the great work! Looking forward to returning! 
- Your friendly neighborhood patron.
author: Tauhid R.

description: Awesome place.  Sushi and sashimi were amazing.  Sit at the sushi bar if you can.  Will, Joe and Sam will take care of you.   One of the best sushi places I've been in US.
author: JustIn O.

description: Cool atmosphere and good service. We had the spare ribs. The roll was a party in your mouth and was a whimsical blend of flavors and textures. Large selection of sake. Great experience. Reasonable price.
author: Thomas H.

description: I'm from Seattle where sushi is plentiful and delicious. This place is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. Sam, Will, and Peter really took care of us. We sat at the sushi bar and asked their opinions on their favorites. I also got a nigiri sampler dish picked and prepared by Sam, who told me to try it with no soy sauce! Out of this world fresh. Crazy amounts of flavor! Easily my favorite sushi place I have ever eaten at!
author: Andrew C.

description:
I showed up at Ace Wasabi for a last minute Tuesday dinner and was seriously blown away by the level of service and attentiveness by chefs, Will and Yobin. The Salmon and yellowtail sashimi were both so fresh. Chefs Will and Yobin threw in a few free specialty rolls. Ace Wasabi is by far the top sushi experience the Marina has to offer. Showed up at 7:15 and was out by 7:55 full of delicious fish.

Will def come back to Ace Wasabi often. Place is lit!
author: Trevor G.

description: I really love this place , always fun and delicious. It's a good local spot in marina.
author: Mewmew P.

description:
Amazing time at the sushi bar.  Sam, Will and Peter take care of you.  Trust them and you won't leave disappointed (or hungry).  Can't wait to come back!

Btw have come back several times with kids and they are totally welcome!
author: Eric L.

description: Will and Sam at the bar are so awesome! They are very friendly and attentive they genuinely want you to enjoy your sushi bar experience. They make you feel like old friends. Thank you so much I was only in town with my friend Crystal for a few days and they really made it a wonderful dinning experience.
author: Paxton P.

description:
What can I say... "Stellar service" is an understatement! There's a 1:1 ratio of generosity to charm. Taste? Best sushi in the bay. Hands down. If you're looking for the best seat in the house, look no further than the sushi bar where you will be dazzled by the culinary artistry of Will and Sam (already on a first name basis!) Love this place. But in all seriousness, I highly recommend!
P.S. Is Ken The Man or the manager? Taste and see
author: Katherine L.

description: The restaurant is great with a very modern feel. The food itself was very good and traditional in style. I am giving a 4 rating, however, because their take out service did not meet expectations. I was told it would take 40 minutes and I did not receive my food for an hour and a half. Other than that, I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Mark J.

description:
Fun atmosphere and good sushi!

Faves:
Bori Bori (crispy rice spicy tuna)
Brussels sprouts
Victoria's Secret roll

Came here for a birthday and they were great! My husband isn't a big dessert fan, so they put a candle in a sushi roll, turned down the lights, and we all sang. Super cute.

Only complaint- the sushi seemed to take quite a while. It may have just been a busy night, but it seemed like we waited foreverrrrr to get the food. Still worth it, though!
author: G P.

description: It's a fun environment but it was overpriced and sushi was just ok.  If we come back it is going to be for happy hour.
author: Rachel B.

description:
After a very long day of adventures in SF my energy was low & my need for food was high. My bestie Chris suggested we go to Ace wasabi! Which was simply amazing. 

We sat at the sushi bar and had the U2, 2Pac, cold sake & big ole beers! The sushi chef WILL made our night!! He knew our tastes for sushi & made us some "on the house" specialties - the experience was amazing, service was top notch & food was melt in your mouth. Go here. Now. Also if Will ever leaves - the beautiful energy at the sushi bar may too....
author: Amber N.

description: Freshest sashimi in the Marina, great ambience and music, and highly recommend the Matua sauv blanc paired with the sushi!
author: Diana G.

description:
I have the absolute best time whenever I come here!

Tonight we went for my boyfriend's birthday, and they succeeded again in providing just the most personal and lovely and fun service!

The food was great, and the waiter provided the best recommendations. I think he was newer as I haven't seen him before.

Ken at the bar also is always the best. He always ends up greeting us at the bar while we wait for our party to arrive and we have so much fun with him at the bar!

Anyways, I love this place. The food is good. The alcohol is great. We always have the best time.
author: Becca H.

description: This place was great. Loved the uni, best in a long time and sushi chef's kept delivering awesome sushi. Thanks guys.
author: Ken K.

description:
Ace Wasabi is AWESOME. It's one of our favorite places to eat out in SF, and we always bring visitors/guests here! Not only is the sushi amazing and fresh, the vibe is great and the staff are really helpful and nice. 

We love coming here for Happy Hour (which is Monday - Saturday!) to get half-priced wine and $6 rolls, and play Bingo at the end. It's an ideal happy hour spot - great music and fun atmosphere - with some delicious and unique sushi rolls to top it off.

If you haven't been to Ace Wasabi yet, do yourself a favor and go!
author: Rachel N.

description:
Great food, great service, trendy, amazing ambiance = happy customer. 

This is a perfect place for good sushi AND a good night out with friends. This place is loud, so if you want to have a quiet dinner, this is not for you. But if you want to laugh, talk to friends, not be heard by other tables and enjoy the dark atmosphere. This is it.
author: Monique T.

description: Friendly service. The sushi is pretty good but the lime cilantro roll with yellow tail was acrid. It tasted like lime peel and acid. We had to send it back. The tuna was fine. It did have a little ammonia after taste. Perhaps on the edge of fresh. Salmon roll with lemon not on the menu is quite the best but no longer on the menu. Why take it off when it's the best you make? Beer was fresh. Hallelujah.
author: Tertiary D.

description:
We came in on a Thursday and we sat at the sushi bar, peter and will helped us and were both AMAZING!! Would recommend to a friend of course. We love this place!! 
-Libby and Dave
author: Libby Luna K.

description: Happy Hour was awesome! 115$ 3 beers, 1 Wine, 20 pieces of Sashimi, 3 miso soups, edamame, roasted Brussel Sprouts and 5 rolls. Made 4 guest very happy. Good, quality sushi and awesome customer service. If you go for sushi in the area, I highly recommend this establishment.
author: Alma J.

description: Amazing to say the least! We came a "happy hour bingo" and the sushi was incredibly fresh. Would definitely recommend sitting at the sushi bar, they know what they're doing!
author: Lindsay K.

description: When the entire staff is having so much fun and loving what they do... everything else is superb! Delicious, creative, clean, satisfaction guaranteed.
author: Ecole L.

description: Ace Wasabis is amazing! We had the Rocket Man and Flying Kamikazee Roll and they were some of the best rolls we've ever had. The Nigiri was amazing too! Will and Peter at the sushi bar and Natalie at the Sake bar are amazing! Excellent customer service, excellent food, and excellent music! Next time we are in SF we'll be back!!
author: Courtney D.

description: Easily the best sushi restaurant we've ever eaten at. We sat at the sushi bar and Will was incredible. His "chef's choices" were on point and absolutely delicious. We couldn't stop talking about how flavorful and mouthwatering everything was. This is a must go to spot and should be on the top of everyone's list when looking for sushi in San Francisco. 11/10 restaurant and experience!
author: Veronica R.

description: Repeatedly consistent, amazing food!! I come every time I am in the city. Fresh sushi, amazing staff! Also: SUSHI BINGO!!
author: Christine M.

description:
Though we moved away from SF almost two years ago, my wife and I were regulars for a long time. We recently came back to visit Will and the experience was excellent. Some turnover in the kitchen has paved the way for Will to lend some of his creativity to the menu (and items he comes up with off menu). The fish was fresh, expertly cut and prepared to perfection. 

Some important tips to remember when dining at Ace: Do whatever you can to sit at the sushi bar - it's an experience that changes the way you view and enjoy the restaurant. The kitchen staff has a great rapport and they will integrate you into their banter if you show an interest. They can take it as well as they dish it out. When possible, sit in front of Will and let him drive. Though he does an excellent job with items both new and old on the menu, if you tell him to get creative or pick what you eat, you'll be taking a freight train to flavor country (don't let him let you get away without trying the baked crab hand roll). Even if he appears quiet at first, he loves to interact with people and entertain.
author: Noah G.

description: The place is a little loud, but other than that, the sushi is great and the service is friendly. I'd go again and recommend to my friends.
author: Mali E.

description: Awesome! Great service! Came here after work for the first time and the chef at the sushi bar hooked it up! Friendly and fun service from him!
author: Zoila P.

description: High quality of food and great customer service! We sat at the sushi bar and ordered pretty much whatever the chef recommended - our meal was phenomenal! We absolutely love the blue fun tuna and the sashimi plate! Highly recommend this place. Our chef Sam is super awesome!
author: Phoebe T.

description: We have been coming here since we were single for over 15 years... Now, coming back with our children who have now acquired the palate for sushi!  Love the sushi bar team who make the best sushi hands down!
author: thu b.

description: Delish! Sit at sushi bar and ask Chef what's good! Blue Fin Tuna was amazing tonight!
author: Christina C.

description: Wow. Just, wow. Ace wasabi is quite the spot. Came for a Tuesday night random sushi craving and was not disappointed. Our sushi chef Will was excellent, highly recommend him. Guaranteed to enjoy every dish. BEST SUSHI IN THE CITY!!!!!!
author: Virginia S.

description: First time coming here and just won bingo and a $20 gift card. The food is amazing. Ken the owner greets everyone at their table. An incredible place and highly chef recommended! A must in the marina.
author: Ajay S.

description: Sat at the sushi bar and was the best experience! The guys behind the bar (Sam!) are awesome. Will definitely be going back.
author: Paige B.

description: SO GOOD! We sat at the sushi bar and our sushi chef was super friendly. He made us tasters and took time to tell us all about the fish we were eating. We are moving to this area soon and happen to luck out and find our new local go to sushi spot. Fresh fish, delicious creations and wonderful service. Thank you Ace Wasabi's!!!!
author: Kayla M.

description: I've been here 25+ times over 9 years and the fish has always been good but to be honest, it's getting better each time over the last year. The creative menu and fresh fish are the best in the neighborhood undoubtedly, and easily high on the list city-wide. Will, at the sushi bar, knows how to select just what you're in the mood for and only serves the best. The atmosphere is fun, happy hour is a deal, and as said, the sushi bar is the best seat in the house.  J+J
author: j s.

description: The happy hour here is Bomb!!! They have 50% off sashimi and wine by the bottle... I had no idea they offered this deal and I feel it's my personal duty to spread the word because it was that great! Chef Will at the counter was super friendly and even gave us an extra special dish complimentary! Excellent food, excellent service, excellent price! Oh and did I mention they have bingo too! Can't wait to go back!!
author: Annie L.

description:
They say you don't know what you got til it's gone... And it's true. Not to say I never knew how amazing Ace Wasabi's is but especially after moving to Seattle I have days when all I want is a crunchy sake, sake kirota, ozzy, rocket man, or mango lobster roll. Sometimes I dream about the baked crab hand roll. They only use REAL CRAB people!!! 

Other highlights:
Albacore toro
Tataki
Fresh Uni w/quail egg
Shibui
Butterfish nachos 
Ginger Tofu
Chronic hand roll 
Chicken Fingers (*trust me it's like crack)
Spider roll (*honest to god I've never seen anyone use whole huge perfectly fried soft shell crab in spider rolls aside from here!!!)

And it's not just the reasonably priced quality food, or the bingo, or the smoke bombs (delicious crisp cider and a shot of creamy unfiltered nigori), or the excellently curated sake menu (I recommend the Kokumi, Yoshinogawa, Onikoroshi, or denshin yuki.. The Hannya is also a unique spicy plum sake), or the amazing selection of Hitachino Nest beers (drink this over Sapporo and thank me later. it's actually from Japan)  .. But it's the energy of the owner Ken, sushi chefs, staff and patrons that have been coming in for years that make this classic marina gem a neighborhood favorite.

I love this place and a huge piece of my heart will always be there. I've built lasting friendships and memories at this place. The owner has a big heart and truly cares about everyone here. He listens to feedback from staff and patrons and applies it to his business. He's also very accommodating. Whether you want to throw a company party (Google has had one of the marketing teams throw a holiday party in the back), engagement party, bachelorette or shower.. It's all been done with lots of fun!

The sushi bar is another experience. Tell Chef David or Les that you're reading my review and let them know you heard how awesome they are from me. These guys are hilarious and will show you a good time. Ask Will to make you his rocket man roll and you won't regret it. 

Or maybe sit at the sake bar. Get to know some of the regulars and be up front for the weekday Bingo and Happy Hour action! 

Bottom line: Ace Wasabi's is not just quality sushi but it's an experience for all ages. And you best believe that anytime I'm in town I make sure to stop in at Ace for my sushi and sake fix!!

TA$HA money signing out!
author: Natassia S.

description: My fiancé and I have visited Ace Wasabi's on several occasions and find it hard to wanna venture into any other sushi bar in San Francisco. Every single meal has been absolutely delicious and extremely fresh.  The staff is super friendly, and as an added bonus, you can look to the right and see Jimi Hendrix, along with other cool rock art, while you drink your sake and beer! We cannot say how much we love them... sit at the bar and have dinner here!! : )
author: Human Animation Lab S.

description:
My go to sushi place in the marina. The sushi chefs are super accommodating n fish is also super fresh.  I love the crab baked role, try it!!
Their nachos with Butterfish is delish n it's more like a big piece of juicy Butterfish with avacado, salsa like jalapeño on a nacho.  Try it!! We created the rest of our hand rolls n they made it thr way we like our sushi :) 
Awesome sake n service as well
author: ThuZ W.

description: Probably my favorite sushi place in the city (so far). It can definitely get busy but there has always been a spot at the sushi bar, where you get the best casual dining experience, in my opinion. I've always gotten something special on the house, but I would definitely frequent this place even without the freebies. Be sure to look out for Will, the awesome and hilarious sushi chef. Favorite rolls - tupac and rainbow roll
author: Daniel C.

description:
The sushi chef is super cool.  He makes great recommendations, and will advise you what is fresh or not.  Loved the toro, uni, grilled squid, hamachi kama, soft shell crab. 
Omakase at the sushi bar is a must try!
author: Edward N.

description: One of the best sushi restaurants out there in the marina and the best services!!! They have the most warming welcomes and makes you feel like it's Home just entering in. Everyone is friendly!!! One of my favorite rolls is the shinjuku roll!! Omg EVERYONE has to come here to eat and the sushi chefs are just amazing and fun to be with while enjoying your dinner engaging in wonderful conversations and watching the greatest making sushi!! Go by and try it out!!!
author: Lonnol B.

description:
The food is okay. Just be in mind if you ever need to talk the manager it is going to be complicated, the manager was rude and not helpful and not professional. So, they were almost closing, and besides me and my boyfriend there was only another couple and the staff. We payed the check and left the restaurant. After 5 minutes, literally 5 MINUTES, I saw that I forgot my phone on the table. We were walking, we were 2 blocks AWAY, at greenwich/steiner and I returned but in that gap of time I already called them to let them know I forgot my phone. But the phone wasn't there anymore. The manager didn't want to help, so I asked them, since there were only me, my bf and the other couple there plus staff if he could check the video cameras. He said that he couldn't, that I should call them in the next day. And so I did. Whenever I tried to call them, they didn't want to help me. Also the owner wasn't helpful. I know they are not responsible for any lost item, but they could really helped me checking the video camera.  Since the cameras are for security purpose right?! 

Never coming back and I'm spreading the word to all my friends.
author: Miranda A.

description: If I could give more than 5 stars, I would! Usually this place is so busy, so we aren't able to get a table- but we walked in around 7:30 on a Thursday as a party of two and were able to snag spots at the sushi bar. Will, one of the chefs, was unbelievable and surprised us with every dish - so glad we let him pick for us. Well worth the price and definitely worth the wait if you encounter one. Great music too.
author: Kelton M.

description: The food gets better and better.  The restaurant has always been good but have particularly enjoyed it even more over the past year or two.  The sushi is super fresh, the rolls are great and the chefs are super nice, especially Will and always in a good mood. Try the 2pac roll.  Enjoy.
author: Peter E.

description:
The most incredible sushi experience I have had.  The chefs are amazing artists. Must try.  

I've had sushi in Tokyo that did not come close to this place.

Bravo!!
author: Ben C.

description:
This is my favorite sushi spot in the Marina. As a local I have tried most of the sushi spots in the area and after multiple great experiences at Ace, I am a regular. The sushi rolls are great and reasonably priced (very cheap if you go during Happy Hour). The guys behind the sushi bar really know what they are doing, and have served me some of the best sashimi I have ever had. The hamachi and salmon toro are to die for. The tuna poke is another one of me favorite dishes.

Great food, fun atmosphere, and reasonable prices. See you again soon Ace!
author: Nico T.

description: Best service ever bomb rolls and good prices. Be sure to sit at the sushi bar for a great time!
author: Ibbie M.

description: This is by far my favorite sushi spot in San Francisco. Every time I come here the fish is fresh and delicious. The sushi bar is the best seat in the house with Will and Peter providing excellent service.
author: Jesse W.

description: Sit at the sushi bar! Food comes out faster and you get free entertainment from the chefs (shout out to Will!). Rocketman roll is really good, partially because the tuna is so fresh. Get the tuna sashimi if want to taste heaven. Good priced for the size of rolls you get. Also the restaurant has a great atmosphere with the best music :)
author: Emily L.

description: One of my favorite sushi spots in the city. Literally the best sashimi I have ever had. Try it during the 5:30pm-7:00pm happy hour and play bingo while your at it. Also try to get a seat at the sushi bar!!!
author: Amit D.

description:
This place is BOMB. The sushi bar is where it's at. If you treat them right, Will and crew will absolutely hook it up with all kinds of treats and specialties. 

Enjoy!
author: Evan H.

description: Have been coming here at least one every other week for a few years. Great environment. Excellent music. Great sushi. Will and Sam in the kitchen are energetic guys who will help make you forget a bad week. Rocket man is my favorite roll.
author: Andrew B.

description:
Came here with a group of 8 people on a Tuesday evening, and we were given the long table in the back room.  There was a variety of items ordered, including miso soup, edamame, various sushi rolls, sashimi, and vegetable tempura (we pretty much ordered the menu).

Pros:
+ The rolls were creative combinations - I got the Crunch Ace Wasabi ($7) which was fresh crab, eel, macadamia nuts, and wasabi tobiko, and the Three Amigos ($10) which was tuna, yellowtail, eel, cucumber, avocado, wasab tobiko w/ soy aioli.  Both were interesting tastes that I hadn't experienced before.
+ The tempura was cooked well, not overdone
+ All the fish was fresh and had great individual flavor; all the crab they offer is a nice change of pace from other places
+ Prices are reasonable for the area of the city and portion size

Cons:
- The sashimi plate took an inordinate amount of time to come out (7 people got their food within 10-15 minutes - the sashimi plate took about 30).  Of course you can't expect all the food (especially sushi) to come out at the same time, but it was getting a little ridiculous as everyone else had nearly finished by then
- Edamame was cooked alright but really over-sauced
- Rice/filling ratio was a little high - they do offer a quinoa-based substitute for an extra charge, which I would try next time


3.5 stars on the side of 4.
author: Ben K.

description: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS SUSHI SPOT. Sittinh at the bar was so much fun, got to interact with the chefs amd see how its all done. Definitely comimg back,  overall a great place
author: Bryan T.

description: Carli is he best bartender I've ever had in the marina. Her attention to detail is unrivaled! If you wanna have a good time, go to ace wasabi!
author: Jason P.

description: I just moved to San Francisco from Santa Monica and think I've settled on my new go-to sushi spot. Ace Wasabi is reasonably priced (for the city) but more importantly, incredibly fresh. I've been to my share of mediocre sushi/seafood restaurants and Ace Wasabi's quality definitely stands out. My boyfriend and I usually get a sashimi plate to share and then the crunchy spicy tuna roll and another specialty roll. Besides the good food, they also have a great atmosphere and play bingo Monday-Saturday at 6:30pm :) I always love a bit of entertainment with my meal.
author: Chelsea M.

description: We walked into this restaurant at 8pm and were told we would be seated in thirty mins. An hour later shes  still uncertain about what time they will be seating us. In this hour that we are waiting people come in after us without reservations and get seated before us. I my opinion... Horrible customer service.
author: Allana S.

description: Sat at the sushi bar and Will took care of us! The fish was so fresh and the rolls were exceptional! Will surprised us with a few and was critical to making the experience amazing! We will be back!
author: Adam B.

description:
Literally the best sushi I've had in the city by far. Incredible place, amazing vibes, a must go!
Sit at the bar and ask for Will, he's an absolute legend! 6 Stars.
author: Josh R.

description: I know it's been said before, but have to say it again- Will is the man! The BF and I sat down at the sushi bar for our second time only, and Will remembered us! Have to love that type of hospitality. The vibe is great here, Will takes care of you like a friend, food is fantastic. If this sums it all up- the couple sitting next to us at the sushi bar (visiting from Virginia) told us that they had came to Ace Wasabi for ALL FOUR of their dinners in SF, that's how much they loved it! Thanks Will and team!
author: Elaine B.
Justin P.

description: Tried this place for the first time, really enjoyed it.  My husband and I enjoyed the sushi roll sampler ( 4 of their most popular rolls.) It was delicious.  Also had some chicken garrake and Korean short ribs.  All the food was good! Fun atmosphere, only downside was I felt like our waitress wasn't the greatest. Not super attentive and seemed like she hates her job.  It's not a huge place, so depending on the time you go, you might need to prepare for a wait.  If you have a party over 4 take the time to make a reservation.  Definitely worth a try.
author: Ariana H.

description:
Outstanding food and the service was top notch!! Strongly recommend it :)
Recommend victoria secret, rocket man and 2 PAC
author: Sergio M.

description:
1 star is plenty. No idea what happened to this place but we used to love coming here. We ordered beer, green tea, and a few rolls to start with. We got the rolls and still didn't have drinks? Odd, I asked another waitress for drinks. Finally got them after asking again. Why is it so hard to get a drink? Then like normal people, when your drunk runs out, you would like another.... Well I guess the server was too busy to consider it. I asked again... Then I asked a random busboy... Then we just went to the bar and got drinks on our own. When I brought this up to our server she told me the busboys are in charge of drinks and they're getting ready to close. What the hell kind of response is that? I'm paying the exact same amount as someone coming in 3 hours ago... So if I come in early I'll get better service? 

Shame on you ace wasabi. Plus your portions are shrinking. 

There are a million other places for sushi, don't waste a night on this place.
author: Dd V.

description:
Wow! Where to begin. As an avid Sushi aficionado, not only is the fish some of the best in the city if not the best, the staff, music, local San Franciscan vibe and people make this my consistent go to. Ken, the owner will make you feel like family in the perfect casual yet professional manner we all appreciate. Erica and Marley are amazing!!! Kai plays some of the best music around to ensure the whole place is smiling. Simply, Ace Wasabi's has been around in the city for 20 years and the staff and fish prove why on a daily basis. Go check it out for yourself! Period. 

Thanks Erica, Marley, Kai, Ken and everyone else. See you next Tuesday!

Seth
author: Seth C.

description: Delicious sushi.. but what makes it is the service! If you get Megan you are lucky! Best service I have had in San Fransisco!
author: Chelsea S.

description: I come here regularly and am never disappointed. Great ambience, awesome sushi bar in the back, great beer and wine -- and easily the best sushi spot in the marina. Also, the music is on point.
author: Ian L.

description:
We have been coming here for years.
Ace Wasabi is a very fun hip happening spot and has the most fantastic and fresh sushi in the Marina District-S.F. TORO, TORO, TORO yummy
author: Vanita L.

description:
Smoke bomb and rocket man omg they have a sushi roll named after 2pac. Best sushi ever. Small rolls but the environment makes it 100% the best I ever had :)
P.s. The bartender rocks so much she helped me decide on what to get and I swear this is the best sushi place in the land of the u.s.a!!!!
author: H C.

description: This place is always delicious and also so so fun. Love coming here for the Bingo happy hour and also for birthdays. Make sure to look out for Will at the sushi bar... he's a stud sushi chef and has great recommendations!
author: Courtney S.

description:
Have been looking for some quality sushi at a good price for a while since I moved up to the Bay Area.  And honestly, wouldn't have come here had my friend not decided on this place for our Saturday night dinner.  But I was definitely pleased with how things turned out.

Started with the edamame sanpura.  Definitely more of a fan of the garlic butter edamame then the seat salt and chile lime versions, but they're all pretty good.  Can't complain about it as an appetizer.

The albacore tataki is flat-out amazing.  Even at this very moment, I'm still having a craving for it.  Perfectly seared, fish quality as super fresh, and the garlic ponzu sauce that it was marinated in matched the fish perfectly.  An automatic choice every time.  It would be an absolute travesty if you came here and didn't order this.

As far as rolls, had the 49er, Tiger, and Dragon.  Although slightly more expensive than I'm used to (I found the motherlode in San Diego), it's definitely worth it because the fish was super fresh and the quality of the rolls was top notch.  Hell, even the rice was made well.

Props on the service, as the waitress was extremely friendly and was very helpful in figuring out how to split a 14 person tab.  Definitely worth coming back to.
author: Alexander Y.

description:
AMAZING service! Had to change our reservation time, the restaurant didn't get the memo (used OpenTable) so they didn't have a table ready. However, they got a table ready for us on a busy Friday night and because we waited 5 minutes, gave us free Sake! Then we sat down and got even more free sake! And then after we ate the amazing food (I'd recommend the Rocket Man roll - delicious), we got another round of free sake! Their staff was amazing and I can't wait to go back! 

Other Recommendations:
Ozzy roll 
Lobster gyoza
Chili garlic edamame 
Crispy Brussel sprouts
author: Christina D.

description:
Had the sushi bar experience you've always wanted. The chef's were helpful and knew all about which fish to choose. First time trying uni too and definitely a good spot for it. 

Came early before right before happy hour and had no problem getting in.
author: Drew F.

description: Came for a casual dinner with a friend. Food and experience was AMAZING. Sat at the sushi bar - chefs Yobin and Will were very friendly and welcoming. Highly recommend the toro and any specials they suggest. Delicious green tea cheesecake!
author: Yana S.

description:
a big thanks to "will" sushi chef at the sushi bar for always taking caring of us.

awesome place to come when you want some quality sushi plus super friendly staff 

customer service? can you say excellent!!!

good quality food! my go to spot for sushi.

shout out to ken the owner for running such a good restaurant!
author: John B.

description:
Great Happy Hour, kid friendly, attentive service. 

I am here with my kid a lot; the food and service are consistently good. 

Bingo is a fun touch, the tv is on local sports, and the soundtrack is fun rock/pop.
author: J.M. B.

description: The quality of the sushi here is just ok. In a city with so many sushi restaurants, I would go somewhere else if you're looking for super fresh fish. However, this place has a really fun ambiance for a night out with friends (and plenty of sake), and that keeps me coming back!
author: Roberta V.

description: The sushi here is AMAZING! So fresh and tastes delicious. I got the Rocket Man roll & would get it over and over again!
author: Kaitlin M.

description: I love Ace, been going for years (ever since they opened), sushi is always fantastic.  I love Ken (the owner).  My biggest request for this restaurant is that they pipe the music into the backroom.  You can't hear the great music back there.  AND, if a couple comes in, please avoid putting us in the backroom with the families with kids.  We're trying to get away from our kids for the night, relax, enjoy some adult time, great music and great food.  We don't want to sit with families with kids.  If I want to be with kids I'll bring my own.  Still love you and your food Ken!!!!
author: Lynn A.

description: Love this sushi place!  I've come here a few times after work on Friday and it is always full.  They played 90s music the few times I was in - or the football/baseball games were on at the bar.  The sushi rolls are great! Lots of selection.  The drinks were good as well.  It does get a little loud, but not too bad to where you can't hear those at your table.
author: Renee F.

description: Came here for dinner and had the best time sitting at the sushi bar with Will. He kept us entertained, was responsive, and even made us a special roll that was better than anything I've ever tasted.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Very underwhelming :( 
I had been dying to come here for happy hr and finally got off work early enough to squeeze in before 7pm.

My friend and I ordered from the happy hr menu mainly, aside from my one $8/$9? drink from the main menu. My friend got her ($5-happy hr) glass of Rose within minutes and my drink didn't come for...10-15 minutes? My sweet friend walked all the way to the back to the restaurant to ask about my drink and the female waitress said she would get it for us asap. Another 5-10 minutes, nothing :( We finally got her attention again and she just nonchalantly said " oh sorry I just forgot"...uhm......ok....

Chicken tenders off the happy hr menu - under seasoned, dipping sauce was way too mayo-y to bring out other flavors. Asked for a different spicy sauce. Serrano chili sauce? that was great!

Salmon- $5 highlight of the meal because it was a huge portion of salmon, seasoned alright and hot.

All the rolls we got were messy *see photos* and sort of a joke. 2/3 rice and 1/3 filling. If I had to pay full price for this I would have sent the rolls back. Not sure if it was because of the happy hr..that the quality was off? I do see high reviews for this place so maybe that was it....

My friend bet me that our waitress/server wouldn't put the drink on the tab and I told her she totally would because she clearly had no idea that she had forgotten about a drink twice. dun dun dun, she most definitely put it on the tab :( boooo. From other reviews it seems as though the service has gone downhill and waiting a long while for food is not out of the ordinary for this restaurant. 

$46 total, which is not horribly expensive, but I would rather pay extra for quality fish, sushi and good service. Make sure to keep your receipts here...handful of reviews have posted about fraud..

The female server we had was not necessarily rude or unpleasant, but very absent minded and just laughed off everything. Which sort of was more annoying than anything     -_-...if a customer has flagged you down 3-5x for something, don't just laugh! At least "ACT" apologetic. 

I probably won't come back, what a shame! :(
author: Selina W.

description: The food was great with a fun atmosphere!  The service here is outstanding!  They really went out of their way to make sure that we were attended to, and also was able to track down a receipt for me which I appreciate so much!  I sincerely look forward to eating here again!
author: Jason H.

description: I live in the marina and come to Ace Wasabi all the time! Love their Bingo Happy Hour where they give $20 gift cards when you win. The chefs are so nice and fun and offer some treats that aren't even on the menu. Sit at the sushi bar and you won't be disappointed - not that the main floor seating is disappointing! They also play great music, lots of good 90s throwbacks.
author: Leah M.

description: Fun place with great sushi. If you're with a party of two, I recommend sitting at the sushi bar. They have a great variety of rolls, and you can substitute items with others (example, I don't like avocado so they offered tobiko instead). Get there early and try to get a spot at the bar while you wait for your table (because you WILL wait..). I've been here a few times and each time they were pretty scattered and disorganized when seating us - not knowing who was before who and telling us tables would be opening in 5 minutes when that actually meant 15. I would recommend Ace, but try to get there early
author: Kelsey B.

description: It seems like everybody in SF serves up killer sushi (and lousy parking): Ace Wasabi is as good as any I've had in the city. But the thing that makes this place REALLY different--and the reason I come back whenever I'm in town--is the staff, all the way from the friendly hostess at the front door to the server in the back--where we like to sit near the sushi bar. I don't remember our server's name, but he acted like he really cared we had everything we needed and just wanted to keep us comfortable. I know we stayed too long, but he never ignored us or made us feel like he needed to turn the table. SF can get pretty...you know, but not this guy or this place. I highly recommend it for good sushi in a really chill setting that offers the BEST of the Bay.
author: M.B. M.

description: The place was packed, but we were able to sit right away at the bar.  We got a round of free drinks thanks to the bingo winner, and another round on the bartender. Overall the atmosphere was very upbeat at fun, sushi was great, and the service was perfect! Definitely coming back here!
author: Elise M.

description: Came here on a weeknight before an early showing at the Marina Theatre around the corner. Initially my friend and I felt silly about arriving right when it opened at 5:30 PM (actually we entered at 5:29) but this turned out to not be such a bad decision after all, as multiple groups started showing up right after us and before long the place was packed. The happy hour is definitely the way to go - 50% off sashimi platters plus a good selection of rolls, appetizers and drinks for ~$6ish each. We ended up sharing the sweet potato croquettes (yummy, super hot), the garden roll (a little bland flavor wise but with a nice crunch), the salmon skin roll (pretty good!), and the 20-piece sashimi. Overall the service was pretty good (although it took 10 min for us to flag down multiple people to get our check at the end, and we were in a rush to get to our movie, too). Unfortunately we missed the bingo which starts at 6:30 PM.... we will definitely be back! This would be a great place for a fun date or catching up with friends.
author: J L.

description:
Amazing and unique rolls and appetizers. The bacon cheeseburger gyoza are SO worth trying. The Brussels sprouts are tasty, wish I had that recipe. Sushi was fresh, I had the sake nigiri and it was the smoothest, butteriest salmon I've ever had.

Service was great, they had no problem with us taking our time. It got a little loud when it started getting busier but what are you gonna do? It's a rock n roll place!

Will definitely try to go back when I'm in SF next.
author: Wendy M.

description: The sushi here is bomb... would highly recommend sitting at the sushi bar - not only were the rolls delicious but the staff treated us very well. The head sushi chef at the bar is super entertaining!
author: Amanda B.

description: Killer spicy tuna roll and poke! Got take out from here while visiting family in the marina. Sushi was fresh and had the perfect amount of spice! Will be back as I have heard they have a killer happy hour!
author: Abby G.

description: I went here on Thursday, Dec. 22 and I really enjoyed the food! I love the avacado rolls, the salmon with the rice underneath, and the tasty mezzo soup! It definitely rules out amongst other sushi places in town! I suppose you guys should check this place out some time soon!
author: Asher D.

description: Ace Wasabi has been my ALL-TIME FAVORITE restaurant ever since I moved to San Francisco! It was true love at first taste, and my experience with this place has been superb every single time! MY sushi chef (yes, Mine... My Preciousss!!) is of course WILL. I must admit, he is a major reason for my somewhat excessive Ace fetish, and I happily let him go omakase with whatever he wants. He is genius, and he kicks some serious sushi ass with his delicious creations and continuous creativity. The owner Ken is an absolute sweetheart, and he is the epitome of fantastic customer service (thank you for always taking such great care of me), plus you can tell that he is a super cool and caring boss. I would give more stars, but Yelp won't let me.
author: Yuan N.

description:
We came here for a birthday. While they have a fun atmosphere and great location, the food is very average. They have pretty creative and inventive sushi rolls, but the execution isn't great and the fish isn't top notch.

It is a fun place to go for birthdays and sake bombing though!
author: Jackie G.

description: Ace wasabi is my favorite sushi in the city hands down! Fun atmosphere, fresh fish, great rolls, anddddd I am super picky!  5+ stars from me, I promise you won't regret giving them a shot!
author: Brandon T.

description: Amazing from start to finish. Sit at the Suisse bar in the back if possible. Peter and Sam rock. Uni with quail egg was by amazing.
author: Brian B.

description: The best sushi place in San Francisco! We've been coming here for twenty years, because the food is always fresh and amazing, the staff are wonderful, and the bingo nights make for a fantastic dining experience!
author: Mimi L.

description: We ate at the sushi bar last night and the kitchen staff was amazing!!! The sushi was the freshest,  along with the most creative and tasty that I have had in quite some time.  I highly recommend Ace Wasabi if you are visiting San Francisco, you will not be disappointed! They do have a regular bar and seating, but if I were you, I would dine at the sushi bar.
author: Krista K.

description: Loved the food. Staff is badass.  The happy hour is great and lasts until 7.  Throw in bingo and it doesn't get much better
author: Chris C.

description:
Ace was definitely not bad. As a self-proclaim sushi snob, I scoped out the reviews, made sure I could get something chirashi-esque, did a quick perusal for hand rolls, and was settled. (No escolar to be found, but I've heard that shit is dangerous to eat and may be outlawed in some states: http://blog.medellitin.com/2008/12/escolar-world-most-dangerous-fish.html)
Cool website, and vive is somewhat rock in roll. Both of our servers had septum piercings.

I got the chef's seasonal sashimi tasting menu--24 pieces of fishy goodness. I would have liked a miso to start or a side of rice though. 
I also ordered the Smashing Pumpkins--a crispy spicy tuna with pumkpin bits, served in a handroll.

 I had high hopes, but the roll wasn't saucy enough for my liking.

The fish quality overall was fine; I just would have liked more combo options and a little more flavor. Service was attentive, vibe was fun, and I might come back.
author: Allison R.

description:
My brother in law brought me here for my birthday dinner and we had a fantastic dinner.

We started with a seared albacore tataki appetizer that was delicious and butterfish nachos.

Following that we had several plates of very fresh sashimi and 14 pieces of uni nigiri that are served gunkan style. They have two varieties of fresh sea urchin available. Both were extremely clean and fresh tasting. Uni can be hit or miss but it is definitely good to have at Ace's. The uni portions were very generous as well with two pieces of sea urchin on each piece of nigiri. 

We also ordered a couple rolls. I would highly recommend the "rocket man" which has crab, tempura shrimp, torched hamachi, and a bit of jalapeño for a spicy bite. 

The attention to detail here continues to even the sushi accoutrements. They have an undyed pickled ginger (not the artificial pink stuff with preservatives and too much sugar) and they have authentic fresh grated wasabi. If you have only had the lumpy green wasabi that is reconstituted from powder I'll give you a couple notes. Fresh wasabi isn't always as spicy as the powdered stuff (where they often add non-wasabi horseradish as a filler) but it is more flavorful. The fresh wasabi has a noticeable grated texture vs the bland uniformness of reconstituted powder and is best if you put a little directly on your sushi or sashimi before consuming (although I won't fault anyone for mixing it in their soy sauce if that's your preference).

We had several carafes of warm sake to wash down our food and the owners of the restaurant also brought out a round of house shots for my birthday. 

Anyhow, I was impressed with dinner here. A lot of very solid items on the menu and wonderful service.
author: Adisak P.

description: One of my favorite places in the city to hv sushi food is great, waitress are super friendly and the owner Ken is an awesome dude, sushi chefs are fun as well, William is one of them and he knows whats he is doin and he is super duper chil dude
author: Tony V.

description: Great value! Not overpriced like many sushi bars can be. Sushi is very good quality. Sitting at sushi bar is fun as the sushi chefs are fun and make what you want. Totally flexible. Great spot!
author: Dale A.

description:
Easily the worst dining experience I've had in years. Our waitress blamed the  lack of food and drink on the "new" kitchen staff, I call bullshit. It took 30 minutes to get our 5 beers, the miso soup was so salty I had to dilute it with water, they forgot to bring out 2 dishes, and the server could not have been more uninterested to be there. 

I understand that working in the food service industry isn't easy, but this experience was amazing bad. I'm not sure why people keep eating here.
author: Joe F.

description: We eat sushi a LOT, and not california roll type sushi. The fish here is excellent but do yourself a favor and sit at the sushi bar if you are into nigiri/sashimi, and like to try new things. Will and his team rival Sushi Ran if you let them be creative artists. Let them tell you "what's good" that day, and let them prepare it with their own twist and house soy, then do NOT dip it in your own soy. Just delicious. Highly recommend all the toros and whatever else Will and his team say is good!
author: Jen M.

description: This place is one of the best sushi spots in SF. Great food employees and food of course. Will the sushi chef is great always recommends the best and is super cool. The staff is always friendly especially Julian always funny and the ladies are oh so sweet.
author: Masunu H.

description: I recently ordered Ace Wasabi on a delivery app, and was extremely disappointed in the quality of the fish that I received.  There was way too much that was chewy/inedible.  This restaurant used to have sucks fresh fish...guess it's gone downhill since I was last there.
author: Michelle C.

description: Came here one evening, we are from out of town and wanted to try a good sushi place. Well walking in we were disappointed because they told us all they had was two seats at the sushi bar. I sensed that the sushi chef got that we were disappointed a bit. He greeted us kindly and took our order, said his name was Will. Now my husband likes nigiri so he started ordering a bunch, also asking if there were any specials, Will then told him, let me give you the best I have, we went with it, as we weren't on a budget or anything. BEST DECISION EVER!! Will whipped up these delicious rolls for me and treated us with some of the best nigiri we have ever had. He made these incredible rice paper wraps that were the best thing I've ever ate in my life. I would recommend this spot next to Will at the sushi bar  to anyone. He kept them coming until we were full and even gave us a delicious dessert. Well done Will! You made our visit 5star!!
author: Sabi G.

description:
The best special sushi ever! 
This place totally overcame our expectations. 
The sushi was amazing, a great combintion or flavours and textures specially the Rocket Man, mind blower. 
The service was very friendly and the place is cool with nice music, also perfect for a few drinks!
author: Sonia C.

description: This place is just fantastic. Great food, amazing drinks and the service can't be beat. Many thanks to the super hospitable owner (Ken) and his wife (Noo) who do such a fabulous job running this place for the past couple of decades. The Marina often gives a very bro-Y vibe but you feel right at home here at Ace Wasabi. Highly recommend!
author: Victor M.

description: This place is great! I always order in from this place and the sushi is always up to par. I'm a regular customer (order probably about once a week). The baked crab hand rolls are THE BEST!
author: Marina D.

description: Great atmosphere. Really fresh fish. Sushi bar is amazing. Awesome sushi chefs. Would come back again.
author: Jimmy L.

description: We love this place!   The sushi is always fresh and the service is top notch!   Thanks to Will and Ken..
author: Seth T.

description: Yum! Will took very good care of us. His sashimi was made with magic. Everything was delicious! Can't wait to come back!!
author: Paul C.

description: Popular spot, make sure to call in for reservations on the weekends. Expect hard to find parking...well worth the patience.
author: Jonas C.

description: Will is the BOMB. You tell him what you like and he reads your mind. Everything was amazing! They were understaffed when we went and kept apologizing. But honestly you couldn't tell because the service and food was AMAZING. The fish was so fresh. You walk in and can't tell they are even serving fish. Highly recommend!
author: Lindsey M.

description: My bestie was in from SoCal and we decided to find a place to eat in my hood. We decided on sushi and this place was amazing!!!  We sat at the sushi bar and Will was THE BEST. He helped us with our order and made our experience incredible.  The fish was super fresh. We had 20 pc sashimi and rolls made by Will. We will definitely be back.
author: Yvette B.

description: This place was awesome!!! Sam and Will, our sushi chefs, were so much fun and really made our experience amazing! The food was great, the staff was amazing and it was just a super fun vibe!
author: Evelyn T.

description: Will and Luis are awesome! Great guys and even better rolls. Tuna Tostadas were legit!
author: Austen M.

description:
absolutely Love it.

Delicious food. Awesome and friendly chefs. Little too loud for worth it.
author: Lili M.

description: I love this place. I usually sit at the sushi bar because the sushi chefs are so friendly! Will was one of the first sushi chefs I met. He was awesome and let me try one of the ahi tuna tostadas (there's 3 in one order and I didn't want the full appetizer). Everything I had there was delicious and the fish was very fresh. I love the Sake Kirota and order it almost every time. I've definitely become a regular!
author: Tashanay S.

description: My friends and I sat at the sushi bar during the 5:30pm happy hour. The sushi was great and the prices hard to beat (we paid a little over $100 for four people and had plenty to eat and drink). Since this was our first time here, the sushi chef greeted us with a few complimentary sushi rolls, including a spicy baked crab roll which was just delicious. Overall a great experience!
author: Martin B.

description: Great sushi, great location, friendly and amazing staff. Hungry walk in, happy walk out!
author: Jade D.

description: BEST SUSHI IN THE MARINA! Great service - we love Will, he always takes care of us. The fish is fresh & the rolls are unique & yummy.
author: Crystal A.

description: Great food, even better atmosphere. I highly recommend the rocketman roll, the seared hibachi on top is delicious. Head to the sushi bar and ask Will for a recommendation - he's got phenomenal taste.
author: Brent D.

description: Had a wonderful experience here with my boyfriend.  Right when we walked in we were greeted with a friendly hostess who seated us at the sushi bar.  The sushi chef was the coolest guy ever. He was very funny and friendly and took care of us. It almost felt like we were vip. The whole restaurant had this causal and modern vibe. The food was amazing with fish that tasted so fresh. Our favorite roll that we got was the shinjuku. We'll be coming again when we come back to San Francisco.
author: Katrina T.

description:
Had a frustrating experience across the street at Siawalks - wasted $22; waited 30 minutes for take-out; walked away with no food.

Walked across the street to Ace Wasabi's and had fresh sushi within 3 minutes!  They were a welcome alternative.
author: Mike B.

description: Best sushi spot for a mix of fun and quality sushi. If you sit at the sushi bar, Will hooks it up with toro and hand rolls for days. Guy is a legend.
author: Dominique S.

description:
This was my second time here at Ace. We came on happy hour ( with a game of bingo included)
We sat at the sushi bar were Will treated us like long time customers. Best sushi bargain in town. With drinks and full bellies it cost us $32.....
See you next week Will
author: Anthony M.

description:
I love the layout of Ace Wasabi - tables in the front (for parties 2-4), bar in the middle (for the odd ball out and about by himself in the Marina?), and large tables in the back for groups who want to do sake bombs before appetizers. 

We were undoubtedly a group of 14 in the back (but no sake bombs).  Thought the food was great (both sushi food and non-sushi food) and the wines were great too. 

HUGE detractor: service.  We didn't get our appetizers until AN HOUR after sitting down.  Granted we were a big group and granted this was on a friday night, but the speed of service was ridiculous. It also took a long time for us to get our bottles of wine!

Wouldn't return again with a group. If i wanted sake bombs and large group sushi, I will just go to mas sake. Maybe the bar area or front of restaurant is better.
author: Alice Z.

description: Great place, delicious food, wonderful and fun chefs! My favorite spot in the Marina!
author: Chun Y.

description:
I have been lurking on Yelp since the beginning of Yelp-time without leaving a review, but the time has finally come. This review is for the sushi bar in the back, specifically with Will. While a sushi snob might be reluctant to enjoy the experience at Ace, you would be judging a book by its cover. I frequently sit down in front of Will and ask for an omakase style nigiri/sashimi meal. Will does not disappoint in fish selection, variety, style, and skill. That's not to say that he doesn't do a great job with your standard-fare American-style rolls (I'm looking at you California/spicy tuna roll orderer, but you do you), but if you're looking for a higher-end omakase experience in an affordable and informal environment, the sushi bar at Ace (and Will!) is a fantastic go-to option. Just sit down and ask him to do his thing.

Try to go before the sake-bombing crowd piles in toward the later side (especially toward the end of the week) and the noise level will be acceptable.
author: Adam S.

description:
If I could give this place 10 stars I would!!!! Me and my boyfriend come here all the time. I absolutely love this place. Always treated GREAT!  SERVICE IS GREAT! Friendly staff working.all the time. I never have to ask for anything except what I want to order. Water always filled, beer always re filled!   Shout out to NATASHA! SHE IS A GREAT WAITRESS! Great customer service.  Food is always fresh and tasty. I have never left this restaurant unhappy. 

Overall this restaurant is a cool chill place I enjoy coming here to fill my sushi cravings.
author: Ammonette G.

description: Their happy hour menu is pretty good. They play 1 game of bingo every night during the week, which is fun. The staff is really great, and the atmosphere is nice. To get to the most important part though, the sushi is mediocre. There are much better places to go in the neighborhood.
author: Kimberly T.

description: Best Japanese experience : great food, drinks, music and people! Got to love this place!!!
author: Renata D.

description:
My favourite restaurant in The Marina. Awesome food, great vibe and an all round great night out. Sit at the Sushi Bar and chat to the chefs. They're super nice. 

Get the Baked Crab Hand Roll & a Sapporo. It's worth your time.
author: Aaron B.

description: would've given 5 stars if it wasn't for the front of house service. SIT AT THE SUSHI BAR. the sushi chefs were amazing and had us dying laughing. they were super helpful and got us our food very fast as well as flagged down the lackluster waitresses to get our drinks after 3 different people taking our drink order. had the jagger and the Victoria's Secret. both delicious. id say if you want a very good experience here, stay around the sushi bar and interact exclusively with the sushi chefs and you'll be pleasantly surprised. stay away from the waitresses...
author: Brian B.

description: LOVE this place! Been coming here since I was in college (over a decade ago!) and it's always been solid! The staff was friendly and service was great-- especially our sushi chef, Will! We got the signature sampler, which consisted of 4 rolls, edamame, and tuna tostada. We even got chocolate mochi ice creams! :) yum! No wonder this place has been in business for over 21 years!
author: Michelle C.

description:
Surprisingly good Marina sushi spot! Not only does Ace play awesome classic rock music (get ready to embrace your inner oldie), but most importantly, serves up some delicious sushi.

I highly highly recommend the tuna poke tostada. Perhaps the best thing I have ever gotten at any sushi restaurant. The rice cracker was crispy and flavorful topped with delicious tuna, soy sauce, and avocado. I could literally eat 5 of these and may just do that the next time I come in.

We also got a few rolls which were also great, although everything paled in comparison to the tuna tostada which was the true star of the show.

Cool interior, AWESOME music, and great food. I will definitely be back.
author: Rachel L.

description: My favorite sushi spot in the city, and this means a lot coming from a local. Matt and Will (the sushi chefs) are the best--highly recommend sitting at the sushi bar and talking to them. Definitely order the Ozzy roll, the Shinjuku, and the cheeseburger gyoza!! Sashimi is also fresh and comes in thick slices. Have gone in both small and big groups, the place is great for all occasions (dates, sake bombs, etc). Have never had a bad experience here and will always be my go-to for sushi!!
author: Justine B.

description:
Ace wasabin' my socks off!

Came here FINALLY with some girlfriends and it was super fun! We sat with 6 right away but i heard it gets packed. 

Shared a few rolls (too much rice on the rolls so you'll be full with 1 or 2). Also ordered some bottles of Matua wine - a great wine for sushi!

I forgot what I had - but it was all great. Heard they have a fun happy hour bingo too!

Free sake shots for the winners!
author: Heather H.

description:
Had dinner with a group of people here last Friday. When I took a look at my bank statement on Tuesday, I found that they had charged me $30 more than what I had authorized on the receipt. Same thing happened to other members of our party from that night. Spoke to the owner and he said the charge would "just go away" within a day. Sure enough, it hasn't and I'm having to dispute it with my card company. 

Outright fraud here.
author: Roland B.

description: LOVE this place, favorite sushi place thus far. Fresh fish and great toppings, nothing too over the top, just right. Great atmosphere, if you're looking to do some sake bombs or watch people have fun and do them. Staff is very friendly, love them! Highly recommend it.
author: Kray P.

description:
Mike and Will are the best sushi chefs I've ever met in my life.  Trust me, I sit at many sushi bars.  They genuinely care about your experience and the quality of the food they serve.  Though it gets very busy on the weekend, waiting an hour to sit at their sushi bar is totally worth the wait.  I highly recommend this place and can't say enough good things about Mike and Will.

-Christi & Jeremy
author: Christi T.

description: Hands down best sushi I have EVER had. Recommended to us by a friend, we never would have found this hidden gem on our own, by the wait and amount of people inside it was safe to say the locals know best. Parking was difficult due to the mostly residential neighborhood, but prices were decent and the food was fantastic. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in the city.
author: Katie F.

description:
Sushi chefs are incredibly talented, and work with premium fish, real crab, and occasionally stock real wasabi for the sushi bar. This is hands down the best sushi in San Francisco. Strongly recommend.  

They have a great happy hour special.  The atmosphere is lively but don't be fooled. This is the place to be for great raw fish.
author: Steve Z.

description: Will's sushi is better than sex. If you've never been here sit at the bar and enjoy his amazing bites.
author: Paul G.

description: Excellent food. Awesome playlist. At first I wasn't sure about the service but they redeemed themselves in a delightful way.
author: Leila G.

description: This place is always amazing! The happy hour is great and they play one round of bingo at 6:30 most nights for a $20 bar tab. However for the best experience go to the sushi bar and hang with Will. You will not be disappointed.
author: Justin P.

description:
They host one game of Bingo promptly at 6:30, Monday through Friday.  My first time playing I had beginner's luck and won!  I was so stoked.  The prize is a $20 gift certificate.  

Their Ozzy roll is spicy and yummy! The Crunchy roll has macadamia nuts in it and is also really good, but my favorite is the Jagger roll.  Mmm, Jagger!  It's fried, which is bad, but it's just sooo goood.

I haven't actually had any drinks here because I've only been in on weekdays and don't drink during the week.  I appreciate their happy hour sushi list though, and am a huge fan of playing Bingo!

You must arrive before 6:30 though because that game starts right away.
author: Cuppy C.

description:
This is a great sushi place in a great neighborhood! 

Pros: very fresh sushi! A great menu. Very causal, low key and just chill atmosphere. 

Cons: none

Tips: get everything on the menu!
author: Kyle L.

description:
Meh.

Super average sushi place.  Absolutely nothing special.  Edamame was cold, dry and had zero salt or flavor (pretty sure it was still thawing out).  Rolls were fine but nothing better than food court sushi.  Prices here weren't horrible, but Id suggest springing for something better with all the other options in the marina.
author: Lindsey G.

description: The new dishes are very yummy. Just love the Seared Scallop, Seared Butterfish, and the Kazu Black Cod. The sushi is very fresh too. :) Beautiful presentation. Can't wait for more new dishes :)
author: Mina P.

description:
after the fact that I basically had to wait almost an hour for my food....it wasn't even good. MEDIOCRE AT BEST. I had one of the specialty rolls with fried shrimp, scallop, and pecans with mango and avocado on top...it was so bland, the biggest let-down. 

when we complained about the waiting time for the food, the manager gave our party shots on the house...but really? my time is worth more than a stupid free shot.

i would not come back.
author: Priscilla T.

description: Phenomenal - do the sushi bar and get Will.  He's as good as it gets!!!!  I'm in and out often from New York and I won't go anywhere else.
author: Mathew A.

description:
Cool - a great happy hour find!  I came here with my girlfriend a few days ago on a Thursday night.  On their busy days, you definitely want to make sure you get here by 5:30-6pm for happy hour.

We were pleasantly surprised with all of their happy hour deals.  You can get a roll and sake vase for $8!  Also, any one of their sushis are $5, which is pretty amazing.  What you'll find is that they will often times start giving you more rice on your sushi after your first few orders.  But honestly, you can't ever complain about a $5 sushi roll!

DO NOT order the non happy hour beer.  It's far more expensive than the $3 happy hour pints.  I ordered a 20oz Sapporo for $9 (ouch)!

As for their decor, they have posters of random pop culture bands.  They also have loud music playing.  It's a great party spot, and one of the best happy hours I've seen.
author: Andrew H.

description:
The service has really gone to shit here.
I think after waiting about an hour for our food to come its safe to say 
there is no way we are going back!
author: Yas G.

description:
When someone asks you what are you in the mood for?  Sushi of course...

This place was recommended by a friend since I was in the Marina area in SF.  I yelped it and saw that it had a good amount of reviews with a 3.5stars average.  That is fine with me since I was starving and in no mood to go anywhere else.

I started out with a cocktail.  You can't go wrong with that.  I ordered a peachy sparkling sake.  That was yummy.  We had a mango tuna salad to start.  The presentation as well as taste was interesting.  Wasn't my favorite but I had to mention it.   We ordered the kamikase rolls along with the rare steak rolls.  I didn't care for steak that nite but the kamikase rolls were very good.  I depth and texture that made the roll very tasty.  

I still wasn't satisfy so I had to order another roll to fulfill my sushi craving for the evening.  I ordered the rock n roll.  That was ok. 

Interesting place I might add.  The ambience is very unlike any sushi bars you have been to.  Not your traditional kind of sushi bar.  Services was great.  Our waiter was very nice and attentive.  We were even greeted by the owner who happened to sit be near our table.

So if you want a different kind of sushi bar, this is your place.  It is not the best sushi place to have your rolls or sashami but it well do.  I thought it was a little bit on the pricey side for ok sushi.  You be the judge.
author: Angela L.

description:
This place is nothing special. Its not bad either. 
Good service, good sushi, good sake. 
Just nothing great. 
So not memorable, I don't even remember what I ate here last month besides the seasoned edamame
author: Augusto M.

description:
I love, love this place.  They have the best albacore with ponzu sauce.  
It is by far one of the best sushi places in San Francisco.  The sushi chefs are happy to make recommendations based on your taste buds and create special rolls even if based on your specifications.  Excellent service even with the new personnel.  Ken knows how to take care of his people (employees and clients alike).
author: A D.

description:
The best sushi experience in San Francisco overall. This is your neighborhood sushi joint that rocks! They put a different and exciting spin on everyday sushi items, but they rock in showcasing new tastes with rock and roll inspired names. 

I lived in San Francisco for a little over 2 years and tried to make Ace's a weekly experience. This is the place I would bring friends when they came to visit. 

The front of bar seating area is the most fun, however they recently redesigned the back of the restaurant to be just as cool.
author: Jay V.

description: Ok sushi, nothing crazy special.  They have a few interesting rolls, and the fish was very fresh.  The vibe inside is kind of like a club though so it does get quite loud.
author: Sofya P.

description: Nothing but good things to say about this place. Incredible atmosphere and the food always delivers.
author: D S.

description: First time coming to this place. It was pretty crowded when we showed up but not surprising since it was a Friday night. They sat us (party of 4) within 5 minutes which was a good start. It was all downhill from there. It took over 5 minutes for the waitress to come by and acknowledge us. She then realized we did not have menus. It took her another 5 minutes to bring us menus. The food took about 40 minutes to come after ordering. The food was good so at least they have good chefs. However after eating we had to wait over 10 minutes to get the check. I even set the timer on my phone to show the waitress how long it took. What were the waitresses doing? Well one was on her phone texting and then taking a call outside. The other was talking to the bartender and drinking (on the job). We could have easily walked out of the restaurant but instead waited for our bill. We informed the waitress of our frustrations to which we got "I'm sorry about that."  Needless to say we will never go back and I highly recommend Saiwalk across the street. They have excellent customer service and will go above and beyond to accommodate you.
author: Heather B.

description:
Really disappointing experience here.

To be fair, the "inventive" stuff (which is a must if you're going for the 'rock n roll sushi in the Marina' restaurant feel) was actually pretty good.. the spicy hunan chili edamame and the yellowtail-jalapeno-mango nachos were tasty.

However, the core sushi stuff was really bad. We ordered a bunch of different rolls and nigiri pieces and none of them had any flavor or tasted fresh. 

Pass.
author: Alex V.

description:
There's no good sushi in the Marina except Zushi Puzzle kinda, but you hafta have a reservation to eat there.

So, I come here. The food is just OK/tolerable/if you really have to eat sushi in the marina, come here.

Food:
+Rocketman Roll- $15 each! whoa expensive, and mediocre
+Specialty Rolls- most of them are pretty average, somewhat filling

They play one game of Bingo M-F at around 6:30 which is fun to do while your'e waiting for your food.

Service:
Average. Last weekend, it took us 40 minutes to get our first order on the table, so we kinda died a little inside. Weekends are pretty packed and weekdays are really slow.

Ambience:
It's a pretty large restaurant with a lot of musicians poster/decor around. It's very trendy and young, so that aspect is great.

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
When I am in the Marina I start craving sushi. Specifically Ace Wasabi sushi. Alas we are usually there early in the day if at all and they are only open for dinner.

If I think ahead--- I figure out a way to bring hubby back to the Marina with an early reservation. I promise parking will be smooth (often a lie--but I have a few go to parking lots over there) and so my thinking ahead (so very hard for me when it comes to food) pays off with a rocking sushi dinner about once a month.

Favorites--

Tuna tartare--super fresh--simple and --did I say always super fresh

Miso soup with crab meat-- never had crab meat in miso before-- don't know if it is a new or traditional method but the more crab I eat the better!

We usually do some rolls but occasionally have done the nigiri and sashimi sampler. Have never been disappointed--every piece is savored. 

Hmm-- do I need to go to the Marina today?
author: Dani K.

description:
I love Ace Wasabi's! It is not your 'traditional' Japanese/sushi place, but they have creative/unique rolls to share, fresh fish, and delicious sake / smoke bombs (sake dropped in pear cider). The wait can be long sometimes, but the staff is very friendly & accomodating for larger parties. 

And you are allowed to drink with the workers too - even more fun!! This is a good place to go to if you want to get crunk & have a bite to eat at the same time!
author: Alysha K.

description:
Rock and roll.

Art, music and menu all play to the rock theme. Not my thing.

Sake Kirota roll with salmon, crab, tobiko, avocado, ginger and shiso (no rice) wrapped in daikon was definitely my thing. Fresh. Healthy. Perfect. 

Not as expensive as Rolling Stone tickets (http://blogs.sfweekly.com/shookdown/2013/05/rolling_stones_oracle_arena_oakland_review.php) but still a not cheap $10. Could have used more than six pieces.

Organic quinoa ($1.50) is available instead of rice in other rolls and the teriyaki sauce is homemade. Server kindly gave me a side to sample. Nice gesture. Nice sauce.

Rock on with financial caution. But do rock on.
author: Jason B.

description: Great ambience and service! The scorpions was delicious!
author: Ada G.

description:
So I originally gave Ace 5 stars which were well warranted two years ago.  I went back a couple weeks ago with a friend who "doesn't like sushi".  Well now he loves Sushi and we went back again yesterday.  

We were there at 5:00 pm on the nose.  We were first! Woo-hoo!  And a beautiful angel descended upon us and he said "Can I entice you to sit at the bar?"  Ahhhh yes you can.  And his name is ALEX (the bartender from heaven).

I have always loved Ace but this experience set a new standard for me thanks to Alex.  He taught me a thing or two about sake.  He has a genuine interest in it.  I ordered a sake bomb, you know the standard well sake with the regular Kirin beer.  Good yes, but then Alex shared with me his recipe for a smoking sake bomb.  It was sweet and full and delicious.  It was so good that I had to sip it and not slam it.  I had two more.  He also made one with plum wine!  Who new beer could be such a wonderful companion.  

We had the full order of Tuna Tataki of course and the Rainbow Roll and the Victoria Secret.  They were all amazing.  Alex was extremely attentive  even as the bar got full.  He always wiped down the counter, refilled our waters, gave us new napkins, and smiled.  

I can't wait to go back with my other friends on a Saturday night to sit at the bar.  

Thank you Ace for always being there when I want ya!
author: Jean C.

description: Great for groups! Sushi is a little on the expensive side but the rolls are substantial and there are plenty of appetizers to share. Let them know if it is a special occasion and they are more than happy to accommodate.
author: Madison D.

description: Best sushi in the marina. Will at the sushi bar is the man. The Rocket Man roll is incredible as is the yellow tail sashimi.
author: Alexis G.

description:
Fun and friendly staff at this neighborhood sushi bar! The veggie roll I had was great, as was the warm sake that I tried.

I'll be back since I'm now in this area!
author: Mansi A.

description:
Overall the food was just OK (pretty good...not amazing).

The staff was friendly and fairly timely.

I enjoyed how they play bingo there.
author: Captain B.

description: Sit at the sushi bar and meet the super friendly sushi chef named Will. The baked crab hand roll was bomb!
author: Trish C.

description: killer sushi  victorias secret was fire!!! thank you for the great service and even better dinner! i say sake... you say bomb...sakeeeee... bombbbb!!!!!
author: Caitlin W.

description:
Good food. Fun atmosphere. Better for crowds not for intimate serious dinners. Also, great cider sake bombs. 
My favorites are Rocket Man and the 2Pac sushi rolls and you must try the Chili Edamame.
author: Matt B.

description:
The majority of Japanese restaurants have sushi down. Throw some raw fish between white rice, cover in some terrible-for-you, but delicious sauce, and serve it beside ginger and wasabi. So despite the decent sushi, I was not impressed with this restaurant. 

I had called that morning and left a message requesting a reservation for six. After a few rounds of phone-tag with the host, we had it set: dinner for 6 at 8:30pm. Imagine my annoyance when our complete party showed up at 8:25pm and was forced to wait 25 minutes to be seated at a table for four. I made a reservation to prevent this exact occurrence! Lame.  

Other than their terrible reservation accountability, the place was pretty...cool. There is a bar that pretends to be full but only serves wine and sake, interesting decor of no-longer-cool bands like Green Day, and a system for separate checks that makes calculus look easy breezy. 

With Umami, Yuzu, and even Asa around the corner, save your reservation for someplace that enables full range of motion.
author: Zoey S.

description: Well first off the place itself is a hip and cool place!  But the food is what really sets it apart from everything.  I sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chef there took care of us.  He was really fun and prepared everything wonderfully.  Literally the best sushi I ever had I can't recommend this place enough!
author: Jared C.

description: Worst sushi I've ever eaten in my life. California roll was full of vinegar. Crab in Spider roll was overfried. The place is stuffy and stink. One star for the service.
author: Julia S.

description:
Pretty decent sushi, but do not sit in the back room if you actually want to interact with others in your party.  Because try as you might, it will be impossible.

Being surrounded by drunken Marina-types pounding back sake bombs as if they are reliving the highlights of their college years while eating sushi on an early Friday night, really does make for an eardrum popping, migraine-inducing meal.

Service is ultra slow too, though friendly.

Some advice:  sit in the front area (which at least seems slightly more tame) or head elsewhere if you're not feeling the scene.
author: Joanne G.

description: Out of all of the restaurants in the Marina, Ace Wasabi is by far my favorite!  The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming- I've come to know most of them by name.  The quality of their food is top notch and Will along with the rest of the sushi chefs always bring out the most amazing dishes.  I love going there for happy hour- amazing prices not to mention a restaurant wide bingo game at 6:30!
author: Kara K.

description: This is the best sushi place in the bay area. Will, the head sushi chef, is the best. He is why we come back time and time again. The fish is fresh, the music is good, there is no better place to go. Thank you Will!
author: David K.

description: Love coming here for happy hour before our softball games in the marina.... Can you say bingo?!? Score! And ken the owner is super cool and always stoked to see us come in!
