author: Vance O.

description: This place sucked majorly and I was sad to give them my money. The waitress was very pushy with the alcohol menu, the food texture and flavors were amiss and the tempura oil was old. Avoid. Meh.
author: Diana B.

description: Went for a late weeknight dinner and was pleasantly surprised by the sushi bar staff. Will and the other sushi chefs made an extra effort to make our first time at the restaurant a memorable one. They had great recommendations, were incredibly attentive and even gave us a few extra plates on the house. Beyond that, the quality of the fish was top notch. Will even showed us the beautiful bluefin tuna that had been flown in that morning. And he topped it all off with a special crab roll with Kani from Alaska. We will definitely be going back to the sushi bar to hang out with Will and company.
author: Austin O.

description: We had a lovely meal tonight at Ace Wasabi's. The happy hour is one of the best deals deals in town. Sit at the sushi bar. Hopefully, you get Will. He's the best. Very fresh, very tasty, very generous, very creative.. Get the sashimi.. Ask for "fish ribs." Great music and strong vibe. Best sushi in the Marina.
author: Andrew D.

description:
Haven't been here in years, but I remember loving this place! 
I'll update my review when I return and have more recent experience.
author: Mia X.

description: Outstanding sushi and a great atmosphere. Not as much rock and roll as I would have liked, but a lot of fun.
author: Michael M.

description: There are a lot of sushi places to choose in San Francisco, but Ace Wasabi is by far my favorite. The atmosphere has a more modern and cool feel and the food never disappoints. I recommend the Rocket Man, it's my favorite roll on the menu and a classic. I typically take friends and family when they come to visit!
author: Keith B.

description:
The Sake was great, everything else was pretty bad.

We waited a long time for menu's, a long time for water, a long time for edemame, and nearly 40 minutes waiting for 4 rolls to come out of the kitchen.

The fish tasted fresh, but the amazing sounding rolls were in fact bland, loosely rolled and very small.

The good news is that it was expensive too! I suppose I could be paid to eat here again, but thats about the only circumstance that I would return.
author: Roger E.

description: Great food and Greta service! We sat at the sushi bar and had an amazing time. It's a fun place for a Saturday night dinner
author: Lauren M.

description: We come here bi-weekly for sushi and happy hour. Love the service and the food! Must do: ask to sit in front of Will at the sushi bar! He always knows what's fresh and suggests amazing things you haven't tried before. Thanks, Will!
author: Erica H.

description: This is definitely the first place I suggest when I'm meeting up with pals for sushi. Hands down the most fun and lively atmosphere of anywhere I've found. Interestingly enough, the chicken fingers are the best I've EVER tasted. The tataki is a must. Ken is the coolest restaurant owner this side of Kansas. I've never been there, but I just have a really good gut feeling about it. Always a great date place, too. The bar is like a party. A fun party. With music. Maybe that's why they call it Rock n Roll Sushi! If you haven't sat down at Ace yet, they I say what are you waiting for? Really. Enjoy!
author: Tom D.

description: Really fresh fish,isn't that what sushi is all about? Eat at the counter, the guy's will keep the fish coming.
author: Carollee O.

description:
All I can say is, HAPPY HOUR HAPPY HOUR HAPPY HOUR.

For $7 you get a draft beer (they have cider), a shot of saki (cold) & your choice of a hand roll. We usually order a few appetizers with a group of friends and just go to town before 7.  It's a great time.  A fun atmosphere.

They also play BINGO during happy hour, for a chance to win a gift card.  How fun.  Personally, I wish they would give out free drinks instead, so we could play more than just one round.  Tough life. 

I highly recommend for a hang out spot between 5:30 & 7.
author: Sherri B.

description:
I noticed this place randomly across the street from the wine bar I was at, and my date indicated she had a preference for sushi. As the restaurant was fairly full, we sat at the bar and ate there.

We only ordered 3 types of sushi, but they prepared them very quickly and they were fresh and tasty. The bartender was very friendly and engaged us in conversation, and told us about the place.

I'll have to go back to get a better full experience.
author: Jordan C.

description: Ace Wasabi is hands down THE best sushi bar in the entire Bay Area.  Their fish is super fresh and the use the best ingredients.  They have a happy hour Mon-Sat when the prices are ridiculously inexpensive.  Where else can you get a beer, nigori shot and a California roll with real crab for $9?  Or half off a sashimi platter?  I love the poke tostadas, chicken fingers, ozzy roll, shrimp tempura, Korean short ribs and grilled calamari tentacles.  We eat here at least once a week and it's always consistently GREAT.  When we compare other sushi places to Ace Wasabi, Ace Wasabi always comes out on top.  The staff is friendly and attentive. Plus they have one bingo game every night where you can win a gift card. Trust me -- you won't be disappointed.
author: Country A.

description:
This is my go-to spot for sushi in the Marina District. Even though there are a handful of sushi restaurants within a couple block radius, this is definitely the place with the freshest fish! I frequent once every couple weeks, so I've had a chance to get to know the sushi chefs and staff. All of them are very friendly! 

I do want to share a few recommendations and tips:
* Sit at the sushi bar for a better experience and service. It's fun to interact with the sushi chefs, and on occasion, they will give you an amuse bouche - and this changes every time I've been there. Last night, I was given a seared ahi tuna amuse bouche which was amazing! The previous time - a tuna poke amuse bouche.
* Make reservations on busy nights. Since the restaurant is popular, I highly recommend making a reservation on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday evenings. 
* Order the Sashimi Tasting Plate (12 pieces for $19, and it's some of the freshest fish in the area) - salmon, halibut, yellowtail, and tuna.

Overall, it's always a fantastic experience! If I could afford it, I'd eat here nightly :)
author: Kevin C.

description: Quality, fresh sushi at a reasonable price. Get the tuna tataki. They also have butter fish, which can be hard to find and is amazing. I've been here probably over a dozen times over the years and it always gives me the sashimi fix I need. Great saki selection and they have a few beers on tap.
author: Christina N.

description:
Went here on a visit to SF based on a recommendation.  It was absolutely phenomenal.  We had the Ozzy, Tiger, Mango Lobster (girlfriend's favorite), and the Beastie Bacon roll.  Each and every one was unique and delicious.

To top it off, they had a Ginger Martini made with freshly muddle ginger that was so smooth you could barely tell it was a martini.  

Highly highly recommend that you stop by and try it.
author: David F.

description: What a fun and delicious experience!  Recommended to us by a local, this place is fantastic!  Not only is the sushi fresh and inventive, but the owner and sushi chef are personable, friendly and made the experience what it was... Outstanding!  Special thanks to Will for turning us Ace Wasabi 'Virgins' into professionals, we will be back!  Hopefully Sid will be there so we can thank him for buying our sweet sixteen her birthday dinner
author: Theresa P.

description: Had the nigiri sampler for dinner and the fish was extremely fresh.  The menu also featured various types of sushi and appetizers, as well as drinks. Interior was clean, and service was attentive. Came around 8ish on a Sunday night, and there was no wait, which was fantastic.  Overall, a pretty solid place for Japanese food.
author: Patty O.

description: Inspired menu with some incredibly inventive rolls! Busy- definitely make a reservation. Try to sit up front people watching is  great staff & good drinks.
author: Michelle Q.

description: Pretty delicious sushi and not too expensive. Marley's Mango Lobster roll was fantastic! Went on a Sunday night and the scene was not too crazy at all.
author: Carter B.

description: Great mix of interesting sushi rolls--- one has bacon!?  This place is fun and the food is very good.
author: Rolando R.

description:
Ace is my go to place for sushi whenever I am in the Bay area. The wait staff, sushi chefs and owner are friendly and welcome guests like family.
Reviews such as those below that are personal attacks rather than constructive reviews are basically a) a waste of time and space b) obviously written by a spoiled brat c) or perhaps a dummy in a group of dummies that can't own up to eating each other's food by mistake or d) so cheap they need to find excuses to get a free hand out  or e ) all of the above. Ace is a great place: so readers, judge based on the majority and not a little cry baby
author: J K.

description:
Both a friend and signed receipts for ~$40 good tip included on 4/26. Both of us were hit for $20-$30 more on our statements. Fraud. 
Straight to voicemail on their phone.
author: Randy M.

description: Great weekend night spot with delicious sushi creatures and traditional Japanese dishes. The place is always busy, loud with popping atmosphere and filled with youngsters taking their ladies on first date. The food is clean, the sushi master is funny and always friendly. They have a separate bar for drink lovers and for those who want to start out the night here. Last night I tried their Victoria's Secret Roll that was out of this world with their special house sauce and pepper in the center. Sometimes there's a long wait line for the bathrooms and badly drunk guys hitting on every girl that enters the place. Other than that, it is a good place to eat, drink, socialize and hang out.
author: Francesca L.

description:
the crowd is 30 and over, the place was a bit small and the food was just mediocre.

The rolls are not very creative and I've had much better at other places.

The Sashimi and fish quality I have to say is very good. We had the sashimi combo which consisted of Tuna, Salmon, Hirame and Hamachi.

We also had the aji sashimi. It was just okay in my opinion.

The tuna and salmon tartare was one of the highlights of the meal I would definitely order that.

The beer prices were good and It's cool atmosphere.  Maybe when i'm about 10 years older, I'll enjoy this place more.
author: Zu W.

description: I have been enjoying sushi at Ace Wasabi for a few years now and it is still one my favorite spots to eat in San Francisco.  Not only is the fish fresh and well prepared, but the atmosphere is fun, trendy and a great place to enjoy dinner and sake with friends.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Ace Wasabi is my 2nd favorite sushi spot in the Marina. Zushi Puzzle takes the cake for the more traditional approach, but this is an extremely close second due to the kind/quick service, unique & modern approach, selection of beverages, and lively atmosphere.  

One caveat: I have yet to sit at the sushi bar, so this is all based on previous trips where I dined at the bar or at a table. I must try the Chef's Omakase (for 2)I continuously re-order the same menu items - albacore tataki, gyoza, robata chicken skewers, the usual apps! My favorite rolls are: spicy jalapeno roll, hamachi lime, crunchy Ace Wasabi, 49er, Ozzy, Flying Kamikaze, and Three Amigos. You can also make custom requests, and the sushi chefs are pretty accommodating! My favorite is when they torch the toro and the yellowtail sashimi..... mmm! Great sake selections as well, and of course all the other traditional offerings that sushi restaurants have.

Energetic and rock-and-roll themed environment so definitely a good place to come with friends, but it is loud music, so keep that in mind if you are planning date night! Alex was my favorite bartender (and extremely popular among the locals) but he has since left for greener pastures. However, the smoke bomb cocktail (sake + pear cider) lives on!

Great place to start the night! Try calling ahead to put your name down so as to not incur a long wait. I definitely came here 2x/week for a reason! Will be back soon!
author: Tammy H.

description:
Things were off to a good start. We called that evening and were able to make a reservation for that night. Rolling up into the Marina and we find VIP free metered parking less than a block away. 

Ace Wasabi has a tiny store front. In fact, we ate at Izzy's a few months ago and I totally didn't know that Ace Wasabi was right there. 

The hostess checked us in and went back to her texting (she wasn't obnoxious but certainly didn't get any warm fuzzies from her). 

We were seated after about 5 minutes in the back and boy was it loud! There were tons of groups there having drinks, sake bombs and food. I would recommend this place for groups and definitely not for a first date. We could barely hear each other the whole night! People were talking in their "haha, I'm so funny, I want to share everything I say with the whole restaurant" voices but it was Friday night so no worries. 

We ordered about $55 worth of food with our Groupon, we got a wide assortment of stuff: salmon tuna tartar, calamari shrimp tempura appetizer, tiger roll, scorpion roll, and one of the daily special rolls. 

The salmon tuna tartar was pretty tasty, the calamri shrimp tempura was a little too chewy. My complaint with the rolls were that they all tasted the same! I couldn't tell which one had the pecan, which one was the spicy..they all had the same rice wrapped in seaweed with a little bit of fish and avocado taste...Oh, there's avocado in almost all their rolls. 
It wasn't bad but it definitely wasn't oh so good. 

Our waitress though did give us outstanding service. She was attentive but not overwhelming. She always refilled our waters and even changed our plates between our appetizers and sushi rolls! Now that is service! Oh and she had the cutest glittery Tom's shoes on too. Gotta love that. 

Would we come back? Yes, but only because we accidentally bought 2 groupons and need to use our other one! Bingo sounds fun, maybe we'll come for that!
author: Betty C.

description:
One of my friends is good friends with the people who work here. We were applauded as we passed by the bar to go to our table in the back corner. Holla!

The night started out with fresh sashimi and delicious sushi- sooo yummy. Then, came the Sake bombs and it didn't stop there... "Sake2Me!" Our awesome and totally hot waitresses & host hooked it up big time! We loveee these girls. Definitely will be back for more good times. FYI - the seared Albacore Tataki is freaking delicious. I don't think it can get fresher than that. I'm bringing my dad here next time we play golf in SF because he loves partying with me after a win, and he's a sashimi expert!

Oh yeah, please don't bring your babies here. It's not a nice environment for them. Arigato. ;)
author: Angellica Y.

description:
Though Ace Wasabi is not the best sushi in the hood, its uniqueness of rolls and combination of flavors keep me coming back.  Below are a few go-to items that I find myself ordering time and again: 

1. Seared Albacore Tataki
2. Ozzi Roll- crab, avocado and jalapenos
3. Crunchy Sake- lemon/salmon
4. Scorpion- mango/avocado
5. Hamachi Nigiri

That said, there has been some changes this year that have down-graded them a bit in my eyes.  With the departure of their head server, a steady flow of new faces seem appearing.  Service has diminished with fouled up orders and longer wait times.  

Not sure if their kitchen staff has changed, but food quality has not been the same in recent months.  I'm finding rolls not cut all the way through, chewy seaweed, and Hamachi that is tough and lacking its normal buttery goodness.  

Lastly, evidently they are now "Rock 'n' Roll" Sushi, adorning their restaurant in  photos and paraphernalia that is reminiscent of some Vegas freak show.  I always raise a suspicious eye when I find restaurants investing too much energy in a concept.  I want a restaurant to sell me high quality product, not try to distract me with some cheesy theme.  Glossy photos of guitars and a bare chested Jim Morrison is not going to compensate for plating inferior food.  Back to the basics people.
author: Todd N.

description:
Wow. I haven't been here in about a year and man the food is unbelievable now. I just had to leave a 5 star review because I was so blown away by it! We had the Elvis roll, hamachi lime roll, toro nigiri and Albacore tazaki (I think?). And then a desert roll with pineapple, strawberry and avocado. Skeptical? I was too! It was light and delicious and the perfect end to meal. Everything was fresh and like a explosion of flavor. I haven't been able to stop talking about it since last night. 

Side note: I'm a huge sushi snob and haven't had good sushi in a very long time...I almost always expect it to be bad or mediocre at best. Ace Wasabi is fantastic like 5 stars fantastic.
author: Kimberly B.

description:
Choose your own (sushi) adventure:

1) You live in the Marina or are stuck here somehow and cannot walk more than 1 block away from the Lombard/Steiner intersection, plus you've never had good Japanese food.

2) You have a car, a bus pass, or a lot of time and energy to walk elsewhere in the city, namely anywhere outside of the Marina district.

If you chose #1, you'd think this place is bomb-diggity for the yuppie/hip atmosphere, creative menu choices, and convenience.

If you chose #2, you'd think this place sucks.  Overpriced (seriously, $9 for 5 pieces of a roll?), underwhelming (my tuna makki was warm), definitely not the markings of a great sushi restaurant.

Overall, this place is meh.  SO much better sushi elsewhere, so I'd rather go a hop skip and jump away across the Presidio to the Richmond district, where prices and food are MUCH better.
author: Tori S.

description:
I recently went to this restaurant for Sake Bombs and a light dinner with a large group and the experience wound up being pretty bad.  

A large group of my friends and I were looking for a place to grab some sake and food at about 10pm on a Friday night when we stumbled upon this place.  We walked in and immediately told them we wanted Sake, Beer, and some Appetizers and inquired as to whether they could still seat us considering the hour.  The woman who greeted us at the door said that we were welcome to sit at the bar, but would need to order immediately since it was just about last call.  We had no problem with this stipulation, sat down, and ordered over $250 in drinks and food.  

Our drinks arrived in a timely manner, no issues there.  About 10 minutes after we sat down, however, the manager came into the sushi bar and started telling all the cooks, "no mas" as in don't take any more orders, so they could close down, I would not have had an issue with this except that we had just put in an order and that the manager was speaking spanish to a bunch of very clearly Asian men.  Luckily the cooks didn't listen to the manager and filled our order.  

We continued to drink and eat for roughly another 10 minutes until the manager came around and said that he would need for us to start wrapping it up so they could close.  I should note at this point that we were one of three parties still in the restaurant, were not disturbing anyone, and had just ordered a considerable amount of drinks plus food.  

As time progressed, the manager continued to bother us to hurry up, we paid, but politely stressed that while we were trying to pick up the pace, we did still have drinks left and planned to finish them (we really were hurrying as we could appreciate that we sat down late).  At this point, however, the manager began to get VERY rude.  

The manager told us that we would need to take our beer and sakes "to go" because HE wanted to go out that night too and needed to close.  In response we said that we could not take alcohol "to go" as California law does not allow open alcohol containers on public streets, and we weren't about to all get citations. The manager had become so rude and annoying that he then said we would need to take our drinks in "to go" containers, which we agreed to do (janky, I know, but at this point we just wanted to leave, didn't want to be wasteful, and had already paid the bill).   

The manager retrieved the "to go" soup containers, but without tops! We asked if he had tops for his soup containers, and he actually had the gal to tell us that no, they didn't have any.  Thank goodness the cooks saw the whole thing go down and gave us tops to our beer/soup containers.  

The whole situation was absurd, and to top it all off  I should note that the appetizers we did order were not very good.  I found the gyoza to be tasteless and a little soggy.

Needless to say that I will not be returning. Ever.
author: Alexandra H.

description:
Came last night and had recently started the primal diet, making it tough to eat out! 

They were very accommodating, in fact I now have a new favorite hand roll! The shrimp, macadamia nut, mango + avocado with no rice! SOOO yummy! 

We also did the 24 piece sashimi platter! Fabulous and since it was a Monday, the service was much better!
author: Kelly B.

description: Sashimi was like buttah. Sitting at the bar we were treated to a special crab roll (with real crab...not the imitation stuff) that was ridiculously great. Large portions of fresh fish, good prices, and excellent service!
author: Diane P.

description: Ace is the place!!! Bomb sushi, dank beverages and chill environment. The bar manager Jordan kills it and the service is out of this world.
author: Andrew L.

description: Fantastic happy hour and they play bingo at 6:30ish! The crab is REAL.  I mean how many times have you realized this is hard to find.  The rolls aren't huge so that's probably I won't give them 5 stars, but happy hour is great.  Good vibe.  Probably best vibe in a restaurant on our trip.
author: Mindee P.

description:
A lively atmosphere, including a sometimes rowdy bar (could be a good thing or a bad thing depending on your disposition), but decidedly mediocre sushi. 

I had my standby nigiris and thought the rice used was too moist. Also some of the cuts of fish were a little chewier than ideal. The spider roll was ok, no complaints. I didn't subject them to my saba and uni test, I had a feeling it would be a bad idea. The selection of nigiri was acceptable but not extensive.

Price seemed reasonable with a large group and some drinks all 'round it ended up being about $45 per person. 

Final word: if your friends drag you, don't worry... it's fine.
author: Jeremy S.

description: My boyfriend and I try never to repeat SF restaurants in an effort to try to eat at as many as humanly possible. Ace Wasabi is our ONE exception. We go to the HH hear nearly every week. $6 rolls (yes, the price was just raised a dollar but still a steal considering the quality and amount of fish) $5 wine (and it's GOOD). We love the Sake Avocado, Spicy Tuna and Garden Roll (fried asparagus inside, avocado and eggplant on top. I know, sounds gross. But it's seriously amazing). The main reason we keep going back is Will, a killer sushi chef who is a master of his craft and also super fun to hang out with at the sushi bar! He clearly takes a lot of pride in his work, the quality of which keeps us coming back over and over. He makes recommendations for special and unique fish that may have just come in that we wouldn't have tried or known about otherwise. Plus he's super funny :) My recommendation: Go to Ace Wasabi, sit at the bar and chat up Will. You won't be disappointed. Oh yeah, and Crab hand roll. mmmmmmmmmmm
author: theresa v.

description:
We were at the Sausalito Art & Wine Festival, friends from out of town wanted sushi in SF so I hit the iPhone and found numerous places.
They were staying near Fort Mason so I decided to drive to the Steiner / Chestnut area off Lombard since I read about Ace Sushi while on the Blue and Gold Fleet (a great way to get to the festival). Quaint neighborhood and lots of places to eat.
 When we arrived at Ace the wait was :45. I found parking right around the corner at a pay lot structure that uses the phone app so parking was a snap.
When we got back to Ace a few minutes later they had 4 chairs at the sushi bar for us.
The place was not as loud as I had expected as I would have asked for a table. They have a wide variety of salads, appetizers, sushi, rolls, sashimi, etc. Also a nice selection of sake (hot or cold, filtered or unfiltered).
We ate all we could including the spinach salad, calamari, tempura veggies and a bunch of rolls, unagi was also fresh. Sapporo and sake. The bill was about $100 for 4 of us which was perfect - we felt great.
I would go back to Ace Sushi / this area for sure.
author: Tom S.

description:
So here's how the conversation prior to me walking into Ace went:

S: we're going to head out to the Marina.  A's idea.
Me: A WOULD pick the Marina.
S: so it's this place called Ace Wasabi.
Me: Where?!
S: Ace Wasabi.  [Repeat 5 times because I'm hard of hearing].
Me: I'll just Yelp it and meet you guys there.

Parking: it's a skill that cannot be learned.  You just need luck and a whole lot of patience.  Or cash?

Service: friendly chefs, friendly hostess, super cool waiter.

Drinks: how can we say no to sake bombs when the second round is on them?  Just know when to stop.

Food:
Spicy green beans: awesome, and tasty.
Sushi: fresh, innovative, delicious and a visual delight to boot.

Atmosphere: with the rounds of sake bombs going at every other table, you can't expect anything less than rowdy.

Loves it!
author: Jenny L.

description: Sat at the bar & at the suggestion of the chef, we ate chefs choice & boy was it good. will definitely return...
author: A. B.

description:
My boyfriend and I stumbled upon Ace Wasabi's one night per the direction of a hostess at an incredibly loud and unpleasantly packed sushi restaurant in the marina (another review all together). 

With growling tummies & no expectations, we sat at the sushi bar - best decision EVER!  We were greeted by three hilariously friendly sushi chefs who's sense of humor & BANGING sushi have brought us back to the same seats nearly every Friday night for 3 months.

We LOVE The Three Amigos, Victoria's Secret, & the U2 rolls.  Be sure to try at least one of these!

Why you should visit Ace Wasabi's:
- Silly Sushi Bar
- Delicious Sushi
- Super Friendly & Fun Staff
author: Erica L.

description: Had an amazing time at Ace Wasabi! Great sushi and really great drinks. The best part was Jordan, what an amazing bartender! He is so attentive and really made our experience a great one.  We will be back soon, and will definitely be sitting at the bar.
author: Amanda M.

description:
This is one of my favorite sushi places in the city.

It has everything from unique sushi rolls, fresh fish, great miso soup(crab or traditional), good location and great service.


Items to try:

Crab Miso Soup
yellow tail sashimi
Spicy Jalpeni tuna rolls
49er roll
Ozzy Roll
Hamachi Lime Roll
Tiger
Crunchy Sake(by far the best time on the menu!)

Special Note: I love that the service is always great and friendly. I asked our server if they could cut the rolls thin and they were more than happy to accommodate.

Ask for their spicy mayo on the side

yum!
author: Whitney S.

description:
Went to Ace for the first time last night with a friend to catch up and chat.  When we walked in, we were quickly seated and the service was on point. 

We order wine and it was quickly brought out to us.  Then we ordered the lobster mango roll, the jalapeno tuna roll, a miso soup each, and the beef short ribs.  I loved the rolls and the miso soup was great because of the abundance of mushrooms, seaweed, and tofu.  Then we tried the short ribs....they were so fatty that my friend and I had trouble finding any meat on the ribs.  This is something that they should fix because good beef short ribs can be soooo good.

In any event, I would definitely go back and just stick to ordering their rolls.  They are really creative and take a turn from the regular rolls that are on the menu at every other sushi restaurant in town!
author: Bryte N.

description:
5 Stars for the food.   
3 Stars for service, or potential wait time. 
1 Star for lack of parking.

I rounded up because I'm generous, so Ace Wasabi's get a 4.  

I really enjoy eating here.  The food is spectacular, original, and you're not going to leave thinking, "eh, I've had better."  Instead, it'll be, "that was cool."

I've eaten here on several occasions, from birthday parties to random Friday night dinner sesh with galpals, and I always order the apps.  I personally think that's the best food.  The rolls are decent but nothing Morimoto couldn't whip out with his foot.  The place gets super loud so prepare to yell.  Once, my friends and I ate with a random couple near the bar because seating was so limited and disorganized.  Interesting conversation, to say the least.
author: Soo Jin K.

description:
Old King Cole was a merry old soul, and Ace Wasabi was delicious. 

So goes the old nursery rhyme--what words of wisdom! Though other reviewers here seems only quasi-impressed, I liked the way this resto rolled... or rock 'n' rolled I suppose. What did I eat, you want to know? Top secret info, but I'll tell you... just this once....

Was here for a light meal. Had:
- Chilled Sour & Spicy Cucumber Salad
- Hamachi Lime Roll

One word: Nom. A few more words... the cucumber salad was just slices of pickled/marinated cucumbers, but I thought they were DELICIOUS. So good, I bet even that plant from Little Shop of Horrors would have eaten them. Same goes for the Hamachi Lime Roll. Everything tasted really fresh, high quality, and scrumptulescent, and though I questioned how good jalapeno and cilantro would be in sushi, the combination was like peanut butter and chocolate, a.k.a wunderbar

The ambiance was kinda loungey, but that didn't bother me.

I also really liked our waiter. He was on-the-ball and was checked in on us with Goldlocks-ness, that's to say, not too much, not too little, but just right.

Conclusion? I am a pirate.
author: Hannah R.

description:
This is my new favorite place for sushi. Hubby and I had the Omakase for 2 since we were hungry and didn't want to think about ordering since it was our first time there. We actually go there quite early for dinner but the readily accommodated us. 
The servers were super friendly and welcoming and I think the owner was there too, greetting customers who were regulars. 
Just a few things the Tataki albacore tuna was tasty and fresh. Maui beef short ribs wonderful grill flavor, Lobster/macadamia and cilantro handroll is my favorite. So good!!
We're gonna go back for happy hour. Check it out the prices are very reasonable for fresh sashimi, delicious rolls and superb service.
author: J. C.

description:
Pros:
Solid sushi, especially given what you think it will be.  Get the jalapeno tataki sashimi (that is good almost anywhere), and the real standout item here is the mango lobster hand roll; impressive.  

Cons:
Fraternity atmosphere that you can't avoid because of the neighborhood.

Fun:
The manager came here from Japan and turned this place around a few years ago.
author: Mike G.

description: Came into town with g friends for the Nike Women's marathon and this place was highly recommended to us. Had a fantastic experience and yummy grub. The tataki (sp?) was amazing.... Super flavorful and melt in your mouth. Loved all the rolls and cucumber salad and nachos. Would love to come back next time I'm in SF. The gal who took care of us ( cute blond w nose ring) was very helpful in suggesting yumminess. Owner made us feel welcome and very special, got seated quickly, great establishment.... Highly recommend! Nike told me to tell you "just do it".
author: Deb M.

description:
Love Ace! Although I am partial to Mas Sake, Ace Wasabi always has really fresh fish and fun rolls and appetizers.

Love the albacore tataki, comes still sizzling from being seared with a yummy ponzu sauce. 

Try the lobster hand roll, super fresh lobster. Really tasty!

Not sure what other rolls I liked but I am pretty much into any type of traditional or non-tradtional sushi (bring on the deep-fried and the cream cheese). 

They have a good happy hour and bingo night on Tuesdays which is funnnn.
author: Sarah A.

description: I like Sushi Rolls. This place tries to put a new exciting twist on sushi. Inventive but it stopped tasting like sushi anymore. I wouldn't come back. Other people in here on a Saturday night were people who like to holler and scream and do jager bombs.  If you like that kind of fun then you should come. If you wanna come for honest sushi, then go somewhere else. At least, however, the service was pretty good and the servers were nice.
author: Luna R.

description:
Solid sushi place in the Marina with a great atmosphere. Prices are typical for the area (rolls range between $6-$13) with reasonably priced drinks. Make sure to try the Ozzy and U2 rolls. Rock shrimp appetizer is a must.

Great spot for a group dinner before a big night out.
author: Greg V.

description:
Leaves much to be desired. We had a party of 8 and got a seat pretty quickly since we arrived around 6:30 on a Sunday night.

We all ordered our own sushi, some shared, some ordered their own individual sushi rolls. They all came on two plates which would normally be fine if we had 4 people at a small table where we can reach to the other side but with 8 people there was no way we could get what we ordered without clumsily moving all the sushi we ordered onto the small little plates we were provided.

I ordered two rolls, none of them very authentic: 49er roll and the jalapeno tuna roll. The 49er roll was okay at best, fantastic compared to the jalapeno tuna roll, where basically all you could taste was the jalapenos. Considering our group's size and the 3% San Francisco health tax, I was looking at $20 for a crappy dinner. The only plus was that the people refilling our water did so pretty frequently. But sadly I can say with confidence I won't be coming back again unless dragged by friends.
author: Ellen C.

description:
Been back to Ace twice since the sake bomb incidents and I must give them kudos for an excellent meal and great service each time. Ken has managed to eep this top notch sushi bar rolling all these years. Congrats! No one can top your food! 
PS. For those wanting more of a sophisticated experience (aka also known as growing up), ask to be seated only in the front room, where those dreaded frat boy, sorority girl, I don
t want to grow up, party till I get sick, sake bombs are wonderfully absent.
author: Killing Me Softly ..

description:
I've been here twice. First time was for dinner. I remembered the grilled calamari so well that it led me to the 2nd visit. And it was the last game during World Series which SF Giants swept the field. That was a good night!

Happy hour is awesome here. The bartender is friendly and never forgets about our presence. Price is fair compared to other sushi spots in the Marina. The Tokyo Trio is a great choice if you want a little food with drinks.
author: Yi-Bing Z.

description: Favorite sushi spot in the Marina. Really fun atmosphere. Super fresh fish. Great rolls. The service isn't great when it is really crowded but it is still worth it.
author: Molly K.

description:
The food was decent but nothing I could rave about, maybe because the whole dinner I felt like I was on frat row ... all around us sake bombing happening after sake bombing, totally fine bc its the type of place I guess you should expect people doing some heavy drinking.

But I have to say for such a rowdy place the service was decent, I'm surprised the waitress hadn't lost her cool with us or anyone else in the place. 

if your looking to go out and have a fun night with friends, this would be a place I would recommend to start the night off at. It allows you to drink and be loud. 

Definitely most definitely do not come here with a date, not a romantic scene at all.
author: Sunny D.

description:
Came here with a friend for dinner and drinks a few nights ago, and really enjoyed it! It wasn't necessarily the best sushi I've ever had, but the atmosphere was great and the rolls were unique and delicious!

We sat at the sushi bar and enjoyed the company of the cute bartender. We were also able to meet the owner Ken, who was very friendly and fun to chat with. Oh, and we even got to play BINGO! Didn't win, but it was a nice fun touch.

Our meal began with the sashimi combo- delicious! I loved that the pieces of fish were large, and that it was served with fresh wasabi. Yum. We then each had the baked scallop-cucumber-wasabi tobiko hand roll off the happy hour menu- it was so delicious. Warm, spicy, and satisfying.
Next came the rolls- we tried the mango lobster (My favorite! Something you don't see everyday at sushi bars. I absolutely loved it), and the Victoria's Secret roll (not quite sure about the name- but it was awesome! Very complex- combines crunchy, soft, spicy, cilantro-y, delicious-y flavors). 

After several glasses of Chardonnay, we got a second wind and had yet another Vic-Sec roll and another scallop hand roll each. They were that good. 

Although the meal was pricy, it was well worth it. I'd definitely come back here.
author: Jaime K.

description:
Not to be pretentious or anything but our waiter was pronouncing everything wrong and had no idea what I was saying and correcting me.  

Their rolls are really fancy.  They definitely don't have plain rolls.  The only thing that's plain about this place is their nigiri. They put too much rice on it, but they do give generous portions of fish.  I was unfulfilled but they do have an impressive collection of sake.  

I do have to say that they have some bomb diggity sake bombs.  Our waiter brought us one with pear cider and an unfiltered sake.  It was sooooooooooo delicious. I'm going to add another star just for that.
author: Marisa R.

description: I enjoyed my meal at Ace Wasabi's but I cannot say it was the BEST sushi I have ever had. The veggie rolls were particularly tasty, but I thought the tempura roll was a little too fried. Maybe that is high maintenance of me, but I have tried "fried rolls" in various other sushi joints and they're not always this crispy! I also indulged in the chicken tenders and those were very good. I did notice that the menu had an array of Asian-Style dishes so even if there is someone in the group that isn't a huge of sushi, they would still have a lot of options to choose from. The ambiance was trendy and chic and the music was great. They utilized that iPhone app that allows patrons to choose the music from their phones...can't think of the name right now! Anyway, it was a good experience and I'll be back when I'm in the area and looking for a fun night out with a good group of friends.
author: Kelsey K.

description:
After my seventeen decades on the planet, I should have known better than to (a) go to the Marina and (b) walk into a place called "Rock and Roll Sushi," but my wife picked up a Groupon for this place and we decided it was time to use it just before it expired. 

Service was fine, and the selection was decent and food came out fresh. Only problem is, you have to eat your food in a place designed by somebody whose idea of rock and roll comes from watching The Hills and t-shirts available at the "awesome" section of Target while surrounded by typical Marina clientele - who seem more interested in arguing with the hostess about where they should be seated (gotta be seen, brah!) and then ignoring everybody at their table while they play with their iPhones. 

Let me put it this way: halfway through our meal, some dudebros came in totally decked out in douchegear: popped collars, hair spiked to the sky, sweatbands around their forearms, perfectly "distressed" jeans, etc. After debating where they wanted to sit for about five minutes (not kidding) one of the bro's said loudly, "this place is pretty rad, dude!" Yes, dude, pretty rad. 

Added to the whole thing the "rock and roll" soundtrack seems to consist mostly of crappy early-80's pop and mid-70's R&B, which would be fine if I wasn't also staring at a picture of Angus Young from AC/DC while I'm trying to eat a roll named after Ozzy Osbourne. 

I hate to totally slam the place, because our waitress was pretty good and the food wasn't bad. But general atmosphere counts for a lot, and it was just difficult to enjoy the meal because of the surroundings. 

So, I guess if you enjoy the Marina you'll love Ace Wasabi's. Unless they won't sit you somewhere that allows you to look totally awesome and "chillaxed," in which case you can just go back to the Most Popular Marina activity, complaining about how life is super-hard when you're young, rich and beautiful.
author: Drew H.

description: The owner is a super cool guy really down to earth. Usually drunk but hey he is fun. All the staff is great friendly and attentive. They are quick when they are not packed as it can get nuts on Friday nights. Sushi is good and different not all that sauce type of sushi just fresh stuff. Best sushi place in the Marina by far. Jordan is a cool bartender. Always will chat with you not matter how busy he is and always makes you feel at home.
author: C D.

description:
Came here on an early Saturday night.

Server was friendly, but not very good.  He was forgetful and not too attentive.

Miso - Came in a large bowl for miso and was very salty.  I didn't like it.

Three amigos roll - was not very good and was quite salty.

Salmon sashimi - it was fine.

Overall I have had much better with regards to service and food.
author: Stephen C.

description:
This is one of my favorite sushi bars in the city. If there is not a table available I can always get a beer quickly and be entertained by the good looking crowd and good music.  The fish is always tasty and fresh and particularly like the tuna tataki.  The prices are reasonable and the portions are good size also.

The people that work there are cool and always get drinks and food quickly when I get to my table.  Parking can be really tough so if I cant find a place quickly, I have resigned to just paying $10 to park in the lot around the corner.
author: James H.

description:
We stopped here for a late dinner and was surprised at how good the sushi was and how fresh the sashimi was. And of course don't forget the hawaiian style short ribs, tasty!

Great selection of sake and cool decor to boot.
author: MysticZ T.

description:
Pros: good food, nice staff, reasonably priced, fun music 
Cons: SUPER LOUD, sometimes douche guys
author: Michele V.

description: There is nothing that impresses me at this place. Sushi is not impressive or tasty. Neither are any of their food items. Just had dinner here and thought about how many better sushi places there are in this city. Just walked away feeling dissatisfied. Oh, but the bingo was fun!
author: S G.

description:
I LOVE Ace's - yum, yum!  When my bf treats for sushi - we go here.  The wait staff is super nice and even has switched up my wine for me when I didn't like what I originally ordered.  Their happy hour is a good deal where you get half off wine and beer and they even have a great deal on Mondays where they email you a coupon for a free roll.

This a great place for saki bombs and it is so much fun!!!  If you're not looking for a rock n' roll experience (if you've never been saki bombing then this means you), get there early - no waiting and super service!  All the complaints on Yelp about the service/wait time for food are because they are expecting perfect service at 10pm on a Saturday - that is simply not going to happen at any place in SF with good food that is still open at 10pm and Ace's is serving the party crowd.  So just think before you come here.  6pm on a Wednesday = chill atmosphere, seated right away, great service.  10pm on a Saturday = wait for a table, service will be slow and there will be drunk people - duh!

Some of my fav stuff on the menu includes: the crab salad, seared albacore tataki small plate, the spicy jalepeno tuna roll and the flying kamakazi roll.

Kudos to you Ace for being a fun place that still serves great food!
author: Carly P.

description:
This is definitely one of those places I would have never gone to unless it was for a Groupon. For one, it is out of the way in the Marina, where the honey and I rarely go. Secondly, there are like 1,000 sushi joints in San Francisco, so not sure I would have chose a place called "Ace Wasabi's Rock 'n' Roll Sushi". I have absolutely no idea what my sushi could be doing that makes it "rock n roll", I mean does it play an instrument or something? 

But Groupon ran a special, and I am cheap, so the boyfriend picked one up and we made a plan to go. I love sushi, and the reviews were alright, so I figured it would be okay. It was okay, but just okay. Don't get me wrong, the fish was on par with other sushi joints in this price range, but it was nothing special. They had some really inventive specialty rolls that appeal to the crowd that doesn't like nigiri. I personally prefer just sashimi or fish and rice. We did try some of their hand rolls, and the one with lobster and mango was good. I was actually impressed with the full lobster claw that was in my hand roll. 

They also have a tempura bar which serves two of our favorite veggies, squash and avocado. We had a few pieces of that as well and it was good. The overall atmosphere of the pace is a little weird, the furniture is a little on the cheap side, and the sushi bar was positioned in a weird place, but they definitely go with the rock n roll theme here on their walls and over the speakers. 

In the end, it was a decent meal, and having the Groupon made getting the bill a lot less painful, but I am not sure I will be going out of my way to come here. If I find myself in the Marina and am craving sushi or a light meal, I might stop in again to try another few pieces of nigiri and one of those lobster mango handrolls again.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
I've been here several times and while I wouldn't call this the best sushi I've ever had, it was good.  The rolls were creative and portions were great, there was plenty of fish and not a lot of rice in them, the sashimi was just average though, nothing wrong with it but it wasn't great.  

The place is always fun and loud but surprisingly for being in the Marina you can always get a seat or if there is a wait, it won't be that long.  The crowed is always good too, a mix of the locals and others but no one is overly snobby or overdressed.  During the week it seems to be more of a local hang out then place to be seen.
author: Inga W.

description: ALL TIME FAVORITE SUSHI PLACE!!! You must have the Smoke Bomb drink (flavored cider with a shot of sake) OMG! The servers are super fun the kitchen staff are a blast. If you want to come here on a quiet date stay the hell home. I saw a girl bitch and moan on her way out about never coming back because the group of girls in the back was too loud and the place was obnoxious. No lie, everyone turned around and was like then GO HOME! Thats why we love this place! The hostess was a little hurt by it but we cheered her up and said this is exactly why we come here. This place is loud and fun and its ALWAYS a blast! It's small and sometimes the wait is long but the sushi and apps and drinks are worth the wait.
author: Drea A.

description:
I came here one night with my boyfriend cuz I got a deal from groupon. We love sushi and this place was awesome. The atmosphere was fun and enjoyable (if you like the loud party places). the music wasn't that loud as some on the yelpers said but there were a lot of ppl coming back from the clubs or going to the clubs. Haha we actually showed up in sweats and sweaters. Looked like we were ready to go to bed. Haha. But it was okay. No one looked at us funny or anything.

The food was delicious. We ordered salmon and hamachi sashimi and it was soft and melts in your mouth. I'm not a big fan of raw fish cuz my stomach can't handle too much of it but that was delicious. We also ordered the spicy edamame peas (I forgot what it was called) that some yelpers recommended and it was soo good. I really liked it a lot cuz I always have the plain salted ones so this was something new. We also ordered some rolls like dragon roll, lobster roll, and a couple more.
author: Shirley Z.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

Great atmosphere. Even better when you sit by the bar, the sushi chefs are so fun to chat with.  Very affordable for being in the Marina.
author: Y L.

description:
I understand the appeal of the restaurant if you are looking to go to what could be considered a Marina "scene" - however, when I am out for sushi, a "scene" is the last thing I care about. I should have known from the start how the evening would pan out considering the heavy list of "rolls" rather than quality sushi. To me, if you have to cover up the fish with fried this and mayo that...it's probably not that great. Some rolls can be inspired, but here, they were merely cover ups for poor fish, poor food, and poor service. 

We sat at the sushi bar and were not impressed by the service that was supposed to be led by the man behind the counter. The fact that he hardly spoke English and could not answer our questions was not a good sign. When we got a "free" roll - we asked what it was - and were told "fish" - thank you for your enlightment.

At this point I decided I needed a drink if this experience was going to be saved at all. We ordered a shot of the soju with lychee and ended up being served an overly sweet lychee drink that I took two sips of and set aside (we did finally get the right drink order, but not before the meal was over).

The reason I know that I, who have an open mind and want to like the cuisine that I am paying for, strongly disliked everything about this place and the food in general: my boyfriend said I had to order something else since I had only picked at my meal (because I did not enjoy it at all) - you know what I chose? Tempura onion...aka Onion Rings.

You know it is a bad sushi place when all I can possibly want on the menu is onion rings.

I will not go back for the food - perhaps only for a drink if friends insist.
author: Katie S.

description:
Rating this place as a restaurant, 3 stars only.  Rating this place as a bar or drinking place, 5 stars.  Food is not impressive.  Feels like all you can eating buffet sushi.  
Sake selection is good.  Many selection.  Very noisy, very crowded.  Feels like a bar instead of a restaurant.
author: William F.

description:
Best sushi joint ever.
Great food, fun ambiance with rock n roll music and really cute waitresses!
Black cod and Tuna Tataki are to die for!
author: Marcel C.

description: Madison was very attentive. Jagger roll was more deep fried than the menu led us to believe, but the Veggie Futomaki was delicious. Large portions of food which was a wonderful surprise.
author: Jonathan K.

description:
I had a groupon and took my girlfriend. 

The food had a cali twist. The mango lobster macademia roll was kinda odd, im not going to lie. Even for a bizarre foodie like me. 

But overall everything was wonderful, especially the service and tuna-salmon tartare.
author: Jay P.

description:
Because food matters, Ace gets 4 stars from me. No doubt, the sushi here is really good. We ordered four different rolls: Flying Kamikaze, Dragon, Spider, and Crunchy Sake. The Flying Kamikaze, Dragon, and Spider were all DELICIOUS. Crunchy Sake was a little too sour and odd texture but still had an interesting flavor. We also had the crunchy calamari and rock shrimp small plate and edamame. All of which was fine, not really outstanding or anything.

I was a bit annoyed that we were stuck in the back in kidsville. I think I counted 10 children. There had to have been 5-6 families in the back area. We probably should have insisted on sitting in the front area. The furniture and interior made the place seem hip but the crowd was definitely families with kids. The restaurant also randomly had us all play Bingo which was weird at first but a little fun. I had mixed feelings about my experience to be honest.

Anyway, good sushi outweighs the weirdness. I don't know if I'd come back but maybe for a quick bite in the sushi bar would be my wisest move if I were to return.
author: Shali N.

description:
This would be my third time coming here, and I'm more impressed than ever. 
We always order the sear albacore tataki with ponzu sauce, followed by scorpion roll,  Hamachi jalapeno cilantro hand roll etc; I love the service and especially our Server Akiko, she was super nice and friendly and made us feel so special. I will definitely come back on Fridays because they play some really great 80's jam. 
Recommendation: If you plan to come here on Friday's and Saturday, be sure to call ahead of time before your arrival for seating, otherwise  you could be looking at 1hour or more if Walk in.
author: jessie l.

description: This place is good but not that good. I like it because the rolls are good and it's open late night, but more importantly it's convenient. When you live a 10 second walk away, all of a sudden the better sushi place 4 blocks away is too far and you settle for this. The rolls and sushi are good, they are fairly high quality and tasty. The service is okay, it takes a really long time for anything from a miso soup to edamame. The atmosphere is nice, but it's what's expected from a place called Ace Wasabi in the Marina. I would give this place 4 stars but the one thing I hate is the crowd. The people that usually come here are extremely loud and extremely douche. It is impossible to have a decent conversation when these Marina Animals are inside. The bathroom is pleasantly clean and I hear the happy hour is good. I like this place, but hate the crowd. Welcome to the Marina.
author: Alex Y.

description:
First off, the ambiance. I lovelovelove the rock n roll theme. We sat in the main dining room so I think it was probably easier to absorb the theme, what with the band posters everywhere and the music playing (the playlist was amazing - during the entire time I was there, about 2 hours, I only heard 1 song I disliked). The whole theme was very enjoyable for me. But if you're not a fan of classic rock, or if you're not a music fan at all, you will definitely not appreciate the theme, in fact while looking at the menu you may find yourself getting very confused and asking questions like "why is it called an Ozzy roll?"

Now on to the food. It was just three of us so we started with one small plate as an appetizer, the tempura spicy tuna wrapped in shiso leaf. It had a good flavor and surprisingly a decent texture as well. I was concerned with the deep fried leaf idea, and the fact that I wasn't sure what a shiso leaf was, but it ended up being quite delicious. Enjoyable as it was though, I probably wouldn't order it again, but only because I don't like when spicy tuna is deep fried since it starts to cook. After this we ordered 2 Ozzy rolls, 1 Tiger roll, 1 tempura Jagger roll, and 1 Flying Kamikaze roll. All of which the waitress said were the most popular rolls. All were delicious and I was very impressed by the quality and cut of the fish. Everything was fresh and tasty. No odd textures and no "fishy" taste. I look forward to returning so I can try their sashimi plate!

In my opinion, the specialty rolls are definitely the way to go. They're innovative and delicious, but you have to be willing to try something new. The Jagger roll for instance (it was one of the daily special rolls) was deep fried, had cream cheese, spicy tuna, and mango?! (there might have been another ingredient, but I can't recall right now). It was tasty but definitely something out of the ordinary. In fact, most of the rolls we ordered included some ingredient out of the ordinary. The Ozzy roll had fresh jalapeno, which gave it a very nice kick, and the Flying Kamikaze had fresh asparagus which added a lovely crunch for diversity in textures. There was also a roll with glazed pecans, but unfortunately we didn't try it, something for next time :)

Another thing I liked about this place was the wasabi, it was fresh and creamy. Though, we did have to ask for more because the portion they initially put on the plates was very minimal.

So aside from small amounts of wasabi, my only other complaints are that the service was somewhat slow and the music wasn't nearly loud enough. The more people in the dining room, the harder it became to hear the music, all you could hear was chattering. Which is fine, but it definitely took away from the ambiance.

Be sure to make reservations if you plan to go after 6. When we arrived around 5:45ish, the phone was ringing off the hook with people trying to make reservations. Not to mention the customers already there. By the time we left, the dining room was completely filled, as was the bar area, and there were people waiting outside.  

Overall, I really enjoyed this place. It is a little pricey, but that tends to be the way it is if you're actually getting good quality fish.
author: Claire L.

description:
Our neighborhood sushi spot that never disappoints... whether eating in or getting take out, we are always very pleased with the quality of the sushi, as well as the super creative rolls.  However... it is the staff that keeps us coming back!  We feel like family, are always greeted with smiles and never have to wait.

I will keep going back!
author: erika k.

description:
I like this place because of the atmosphere. It's definitely a more hip, fun sushi place (marina crowd without too many douches) and there's a good ambiance throughout the restaurant. 

We sat at the bar and the bartender was on top of everything. We ordered the flying kamikaze roll and u2 roll.. They were just okay, could have used a little more kick of something. We also had the spicy green beans appetizer (not too spicy so we asked for siracha sauce) and it helped a lot. 

Fairly priced, good service, good food.
author: Joy A.

description: Excellent sushi, soooo tender and so fresh, just melted in our mouths. Love the rearrangement of the room to allow a little more standing room in the main entry area.
author: P G.

description:
The best way to describe this place is Amateur Hour.  

From the obnoxiously loud kids doing sake bombs to the warm, poorly crafted nigiri & sushi rolls I could not have imagined a less desirable sushi dining experience.  If not for the Groupon that we used I would be even more appalled at having to pay for what was such a lousy meal.

I will certainly never go back and with all of the quality sushi restaurants in SF I would recommend going to any of them rather than going here.
author: Nick W.

description:
I am an avid sushi junkie, usually dining on my favorite raw fish selections about 3 or 4 times a week.  After having Ace Wasabi recommended to me by a friend I finally made my way over there last night.

The ambiance was great for the traditional Marina scene.  There was a great energy in the establishment and all of the staff seemed to be in great spirits, which always seems to radiate throughout.  All of the staff was very attentive and I was able to get my food very promptly.

The sushi was descent and they had a nice variety of house dishes that seemed unique to their establishment.

Overall I would say, definitely check it out if you're in the area!
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Ive been going to Ace Wasabi regulary since 2009. Sushi is always excellent here. Service is a 5 star as well.
Looking forward for my next visit to this marina gem!!
author: Heather P.

description:
I agree with what many have said: the food was fine... but you didn't come here for the food. I came here with a girlfriend for dinner on a Saturday. They were packed of course, but we were able to sit at the bar and be served there promptly. Must say, I was very impressed with the bartender. He kept a packed bar consistently served, and also served as a waiter for many of us eating at the bar. Our food came promptly and in a nice order- first edamame, which was as good as any (but it would be hard to screw up salted soybeans). Then came the sashimi platter. The salmon was melt in your mouth amazing, the tuna was just okay- a bit too of a chewy texture, and the hirame and hamachi were also good, but they should be for an $18 plate of fish.

We also had the three amigos roll, hirame lime roll, and seafood skewers. The skewers were delicious, and a nice contrast to the sushi. The rolls were okay- a little sloppily thrown together. They weren't bad, but nothing to rave about. I'd come back here because I like sushi and might want to go out in the neighborhood, but I would not come here for the sushi alone.
author: Chelsea T.

description:
We went there recently for a friend's birthday and the sushi was great!

We were seated in the back room which was way too loud. We could barely hear each other so we made it more of a eating business than a socializing one. 

The edemame was delicious, the red pepper did it for me. We also had the sashimi sampler and the fish was super fresh. We tried a few rolls and the Jalapeño Tuna was my personal favorite.  Looking forward to going back but will make sure to sit in the front room this time...
author: Nez B.

description:
Goodness gracious! When I was in college living my absolute glory days I vividly remember going to Ace Wasabi to get drunk on sake and stuffed on multiple spider rolls ... how times have changed.  I recently, as in tonight, went to Ace Wasabi to meet up with some old high school friends, 7 year reunion- hello!!! Well, let me tell you, the night turned into a real annoyance and I apparently became a "nuisance" to the crowd, well before the rest of our party got there, thank god, buuuut... I was quickly backed up by a great friend who also found our waitress to be a real treat! 

So, I put my name down and the ever so adorable brunette hostess tells me that "it might be a while" before we get a table. Sure, someone might say, or how long is the wait, is  another reasonable question.  Well, the reason it "might be a while" is because the table of some twenty something hipsters had took over a Marina gem and would go outside to take smoke breaks in the middle of their edamame breaks. So step one: NEVER PRETEND LIKE THE RESTAURANT IS YOUR HOME! After giving them the pissed off stare for multiple minutes we finally sat down. But well before we sat down the owner of the restaurant came out to my group and told us that there was a reservation to come in at 945 that had one of the few tables available, meaning that we would be rushed to eat and get out since it was currently 830 when he notified us of this.  So long story short, we get in and we immediately get hovered over by this space cadet blonde.  A: she has a stink face. B. she is sarcastic but NOT in a charming way. C. maybe she is not sarcastic, just a dummy. D. she gives my roll to my friend who is sitting diagonal from me E. i am waiting for my roll. F. she says "i'm confused... i thought i brought your roll already" G. she gave the roll to my friend, didn't tell me that my roll was on his plate and so he ate it. whops. but she also thought it was still on its way out to me H. she brings me a new roll

So at the end of the night, the owner, who is beyond drunk at this point, comes out to have a quick convo with us, takes the "extra" roll off of the bill and tells us that he apologizes for the waitress, that he will have a talk with her and then gives us each a pound, as in a fist pound. In the end, I give this place two stars because I have solid memories from college here and the food is actually very very tasty, the mango lobster being my absolute fav... but the service.. well, never get a blonde with a fake smile.
author: Alexa V.

description:
Service- friendly and fast
presentaton- not bad

quality- eh. Honestly not good. 

Yes another Groupon customer review. My bad for not looking into this further. I saw Steiner Street and thought of the other end of Steiner. 

Anyways, came here and the food was just ok. I've had better sushi elsewhere. The scorpion roll was our fave. Please skip on the 3 amigos. The fish is better by itself. The sauce is better by itself. Mixed together and it is a NASTY tasting combination.

Tuna tataki- you might want to skip this. I like sashimi but this is just to bland and weird for me.

Calamari- no taste whatsoever. Don't even dip it in the soy sauce that comes with it. You'll regret it. 

Sorry but I am never coming back. I was seriously praying that I wouldn't get sick. 

Parking is a huge pain.

Ate here some time ago for a friends birthday and we had a great time. Their sushi was good and I love that they have quinoa option instead of rice especially for a specific diet person. Will go back!
author: Sharon B.

description: one of my favorite sushi bars. Hip and trendy decor with the freshest seafood. get the hamachikama YUM!
author: Collin W.

description:
My friend used a Groupon here and we had a reservation on a Saturday night. It got packed pretty quickly. 

We ordered several rolls, including one that was Crunchy Sake, which sounded interesting..I mean who doesn't want to eat crispy potato bits? And then we got the Garden roll, AMAAZZING! We even ordered another, I didn't think it would be that great but it was definitely delicious. 

Not so great: the "sho chu" drinks..blushing geisha was not fruity as the waitress had said, and the vodka soda tasted like "soap" to my friend. No bueno. :[
author: Tina F.

description:
Is it possible to be as shit-tastic as Ace Wasabi's? 

Nope!

Went here with some friends (their idea) and it was a complete nightmare from start to finish. 

What went wrong?

People on pub crawls kept spilling into the restaurant. Classy!

The hostess was such an airhead (or was she high?) that she was completely confused about who was in our party, when we had arrived, where to stick us, etc.

Food was yucky. 

We didn't receive the majority of our food because the kitchen was so backed up. I know what you're thinking - sometimes kitchen's are swamped... Are they swamped to the point where you should wait 45+ minutes for sushi? I don't think so. 

Yuck. I hate trendy sushi spots like this. If the food isn't the draw and they still don't have their service figured out, why bother?
author: Alli J.

description:
I've seen some mixed reviews however I have to say I've had an amazing experience overall. Natasha and Akiyo (sp?) are truly amazing. We recently had dinner Friday evening an Molly was fantastic as well. 

Their server Jessica however leaves quite a bit to be desired. She prefers to do shots with her friends at the bar rather than wait on her customers. And yes, I've witnessed this on two occasions when she was our server. In fact I now ask ahead of time to have her NOT wait on us. 

The owner is extremely hospitable, he makes a point of greeting us every time we have dinner and he's there. The hostess, Madison, is equally gracious and very accommodating.
author: Nicole T.

description:
Wow....this place is awesome!! Their sushi is delicious and creative! The sake bomb are good...and cheap!!! I advise you to try the sake bomb with the pear cider. Its sweet but super tasty!
I cant remember the name of the roll that I had but it was so complex and amazing in flavor!! It had lobster, macadamia nut, cilantro, mango, and  tuna i believe....OMG each time you chew it a new flavor come out! Your eyes will bug out.
Wasn't expensive either. Had good servers as well.

You gotta try it!
author: RAy J.

description: Such a fun and friendly neighborhood place (if you sit at the bar).  Go during BINGO hour.  Try the tataki.
author: K P.

description: This place is great for yummy and interesting sushi rolls, ridiculously good garlic edamame, and watching middle-aged married Marina men hit on women half their age (as in, still in college).
author: Shirin M.

description:
One of the best sushi restaurant I've been to. The chefs are nice, easy-going and generous - they gave us several plates of free rolls! Thought the place is a bit small, but it's very cozy. The foods are excellent, which I never expect it comes with such a moderate price.

I strongly recommend this place.
author: Ivan S.

description:
I don't get what the hype is about. The food was good -- but there are a million sushi places in the city with "good" sushi; it's definitely not outstanding. 
The sake selection is good!

The one thing that annoys me about this place is the regulars who like to chat with you if you sit at the bar. I really like sitting at the bar at sushi places, but talking to drunken guys who have nothing interesting to say is just not always what I'm looking for...
author: Mira S.

description:
The bf and I had a craving for sushi one night and just our luck www.groupon.com was offering $55 dollars worth of food and drink for $25 from Ace Wasabi's. We got the groupon, and called to see if we could make reservations for that night and got in.

We normally don't order a ton of food unless we know we can finish it, but this time since we had a groupon, we needed to use it all up. So we ordered to our heart's content. The food and service were both good. Highly suggest sitting at the small sushi bar-- it's fun, and we even got a roll on the house! Out of all the things we tried that night our favorite was the Tiger roll. This roll was recommended by the sushi chef and seriously, it was soo good. Filled with spicy tuna and scallops, and topped with salmon and avocado. It was melt in your mouth goodness. It doesn't sound like much on the menu, but it's definitely worth ordering-- I highly recommend it!
author: Kimberly F.

description:
This restaurant spends more of its name's real estate trying to sound cool (Ace / Rock 'n Roll) or hot (Wasabi) than on its cuisine.  For once, I guess, one can judge the book by its cover.

Atmosphere was lively even at 10 PM on a holiday Monday.  We sat at the sushi bar and the chefs were talkative and fun.  Service was attentive and quick.

Sushi itself was a bit disappointing.  We found the salmon a bit rubbery.  Hamachi Lime Roll was more about the cilantro than anything else.  The tai was exceptional, however.  As they were cleaning up the bar, one of the chefs said that they freeze the fish at night to make it last longer which was a bit of a let down, although that might be more commonplace than I imagine.

Price was very reasonable for sushi but fair for what we got.

All in all, a fun place for a late night eat.
author: David A.

description:
All I'm going to say is 2 for 1 sake bombs ALL THE TIME!! Need I say more. Well.. I probably don't need to but I will elaborate. This place has a buy 1 round, get the 2nd round on the house policy for sake bombs. 1 sake bomb only costs $4.50 so it's a pretty damn good deal.

Other than that, the sushi is also fairly good. We got the sashimi platter and all the fish on it was fresh and cut well. Nice thick cuts that were really flavorful with a good fresh texture. The halibut was possibly some of the best halibut I've had but that's not saying much since I don't usually order halibut as sushi. Here's a breakdown of some of the other food:

Cucumber salad: Meh.. I wouldn't get it again. Came out looking like pickles and wasn't very impressive taste-wise.
Albacore tataki: HUGE plate of this stuff and pretty good.
Three Amigos roll: This was one of my favorite rolls. Lots of fish.
Hirame roll: I think this is what it was called. It had lemon, cilantro, jalapeno, and I think it had yellowtail but I could be wrong. It was really tasty and the lemon added this really nice, contrasting flavor. Very delicious.

Service was fairly good as well. The staff was very friendly and pretty easy to get ahold of when needed.
author: Lauren C.

description:
I have to admit I wasn't too excited when I found out we were eating here.  first thing that put me off was the only other asian person I saw was the waitress.  now how many good asian restaurants have you been to that didn't have any asians?

the hostess and waiter were really nice.  they were very attentive and helpful.  we ordered several sushi rolls and a sashimi combo.  I was pleasantly surprised at how good they were.  the fish was really fresh and the rolls were nicely made and packed with flavor.  

the only negative is the price.  there were 5 of us and we spent $35 each.  it was a little pricey but what do you expect eating in the marina.
author: Samson M.

description: Great different sushi dishes. The spicy edamame is awesome. Prices are very reasonable. Great little venue, and $5 smoke bombs? Definitely a spot to hit when in the marina district
author: Tom L.

description: Went here for my b day at the end of August. The waitress was very helpful being our 1st time there. Played some bingo, drank some beers and watched the Giants. Oh yea and ate a sushi. Atmosphere is definitely fun, sushi was better than most places...would def recommend this place to others looking for a bite and a beer
author: E.W. S.

description:
Ace Wasabi offered a variety of decently priced roll and a fun atmosphere with great music.. think the electro-pop variety (e.g., Stars, MGMT). 

The chili edamame were a nice spicy treat and we were satisfied with the roll selection. The Scorpion is a must try - mango, avocado, carmelized pecans, shrimp and scallops. Aka all things goodness. Honestly if they figure out a way to put bacon in a roll, I'd be in heaven!
author: Lan H.

description:
I came here a few years ago for a friend's birthday dinner, who had chosen the place because "it's good, and more importantly, there's no ugly people!"

I've been here several times since then, and it is good, and I'm pretty sure there aren't any ugly people here either. I no longer eat seafood, but I do remember the 49er roll being pretty tasty. Now I stick to the garden roll, which is probably the best vegetarian roll I've had, anywhere. Throw in some buy one get one free sake-bombing, and I'm a happy camper!
author: Christine K.

description: I love love love this place! Sit at the sushi bar, the chefs are awesome. Our chef and waittress were really attentive to us. Their smoke bombs (saki dropped in pear cider) is amazing! highly recommeded for date night (not a quite place, just fun atmosphere!)
author: Lina K.

description: Been coming here for 10+ years (I'm old) and they consistently put out great sushi in a fun environment.  Get the tuna tatatki appetizer and salmon belly nigiri
author: Matt H.

description:
Do you have to give a star? 
This place is terrible. 

The food was actually disgusting.  Our calamari didn't even taste of calamari, just of the three week old oil they used to fry the squid. 

The "world famous" tuna tataki tasted more like liquid smoke than it did like fish. 

All of the rolls that we ordered were smothered in jalapeños and ponzu sauce, so everything tasted exactly the same... like fiery lemons. 

And, the service was TERRIBLE. 
No one came to ask us if we liked our food the entire time we sat there (for an hour?).  And at the end of the meal when the waitress came to collect our plates, she didn't even mention the plate of untouched calamari.  Perhaps she thought that we preferred to save our appetizers for the end of the meal and just didn't have room? 

I do have fond memories of this place from a few years back... but either the restaurant has changed or my tolerance for bad food and service has.
author: lindsay f.

description:
I came here with a Groupon and I'm glad I did.  They are a bit pricey but I still enjoyed my meal even though they made us pay for the plain edamame.  Any respectable Japanese joint would give have given it to us for free.

So we started off with the edamame.  You can't really screw that up too bad but my bf did bite into a really gross brown mushy one that made him gag.  There was just one in the bunch.  Then we had the albacore tataki which I thought was delightful!  Mmm, I wish I had more.  I could have eaten the whole plate by myself.  Then we got the rainbow roll.  This was nothing to write home about.  It was poorly constructed and looked sloppy.  Next came the miso cod.  I'm always on the search for good miso cod, butterfish, sea bass and thumbs up to their miso cod.  The rice was a little dry, kinda like it was sitting in the fridge and they fried it up for this dish.  The shitaki mushrooms were also tasty.  Then we got the seafood skewers.  We barely touched those; we were full by then.  But we did go for one and it was dry.  They gave us some ponzu sauce and it totally needed it.  Overall, I was happy.  If I paid full price, (total came to a little over $60 w/out tax and tip), I would have been less happy.  

The waitress was nice, her smile seemed warm.  Other than that she was uneventful.  It did take her a while to take our order but it was busy.  I can't really comment on their decor since I sat facing the window.  I don't know if I would come back again.  Maybe if someone had a birthday meal there.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
*Sigh* another wonderful night out at my neighborhood sushi spot. Sat nights in Marina are always alive. Well, depends on what it is that you like to do of course. But,  I love it here. It was super loud at the front but we were seated at the back area and that was a bit more calm. Except for the damn drunk foursome 2 tables away from us. OMG I was just waiting for one of them to topple over on the table. Blondie was super drunk and everyone can hear the entire conversation. Haha lucky  for me :)

I wish I could give it 5 stars but service is high for me. And we were seated a few mins before the table next to us. Waitress took their drink order before ours and I had to call her over to place an order. Hmmmmnn.  Anyways, she was good after that.

Albacore Tataki- this was the highlight of the night!!
Calamari and Rock shrimp-crunchy goodness

Nigri:
Yellowtail, Smoke Salmon, Mackerel, Tuna Belly, Butterfish

U2 roll

New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc and some beer with a badass name.
author: Lola D.

description: Sushi isn't bad but also not amazing. The people are extremely friendly, and the manager is the man.
author: Rohan S.

description:
Came with a Groupon a couple nights back and was impressed with the overall meal.  Thought we were just gonna end up with sushi but it turns out we didn't order any!  The small plates are awesome--had the soba noodle salad and some calamari rings to start and then the tuna tataki and the miso cod.  All were excellent---and there was bingo!  

Good food, music and tasty drinks = awesome meal.  We were very happy overall and will definitely be back.
author: Tysen C.

description:
I'm a big fan of crazy sushi rolls (cilantro, candied walnuts, scallops, and mango... yes please!) and Ace Wasabi is happy to oblige.
