They've got a great selection of rolls but more importantly, the fish is always fresh.  I like to pair my crazy rolls with some sashimi and it's always buttery-delicious.  Go for the Tataki app and the Scorpion Roll with Hamachi sashimi on the side.

I've noticed that folks like to come to Ace for the atmosphere as much as they do the food.   On any given night, you'll find well-dressed yuppies flirting with each other at the bar as rock music pumps in the background.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
I have been here something like 100 times (no kidding) over the past 11 years so it is hard to be objective.  Obviously it's a fun place for a date, for catching up with friends, or just to sit at the bar and enjoy some sushi.  Speaking of sushi, the fish never disappoints - always fresh and good flavor.  The best dish (and value) is the Tataki appetizer.

My only recommendation - do not come here if you are looking for a quiet romantic dinner - it is loud during prime time.  Also not recommended if you don't like the Marina crowd - but of course you wouldn't be here if that was the case - doh!
author: Boris G.

description:
Saturday is one of those days when anything can happen.  And by anything, I mean play a little beer pong, sober up, have some sake, and end up feeling like you've been run over by a steamroller the next day.  The next day being Easter Sunday, when you stumble out of a new friend's house after sleeping on her couch, to catch a cab back to your car, where you smartly left it.  


Prior to that...

The soap star, the birthday boy, the italian, the runner and I came here after much internal dialogue with myself over what it was, exactly, that I wanted to do.  The runner thought she knew someone who worked here, but alas, that person had moved to Colorado.  Or Oregon.  I can't remember.  

We sit at the table near the window to get the ultimate people watching, and I swear the bartender checked me out.  Or saw how crap I looked.  One or the other.  The menu wasn't as extensive as I would have liked, although if you eat sushi, I suppose there's some nifty stuff on there.  The runner, who also doesn't eat fish (yay) suggested that we get the chicken finger things, which turned out to be delicious.  I also ordered the chicken teriyaki, which was nowhere near as tasty as those chicken fingers.  They also have hot sake with a splash of plum wine, which is pretty tasty.  I ordered my usual sushi staple, the Kappa Maki roll, and it fell apart before I could poke it with my sticks.  Our waitress was great, and put up with the fact that we brought in a case of beer and were trying to float away on a river of sake.  She didn't get mad when we ordered random appetizers, and little else.

Not impressed, but not going to run away next time someone suggests it, either.

One thing was the music... 

I blame the Sopranos.  Why else would Journey's "Don't Stop Believing" play THREE TIMES IN ONE VISIT?
author: Pam S.

description: Went last weekend for a late dinner, and here are my thoughts.  Anywhere I can have a real dinner after 9pm in this town is OK in my book.  Sushi is good, and the people watching is priceless.  Some girl came stomping in and broke down crying.  I was a happy camper, as this is the entertainment I am looking for.  Good 49'er roll as well:)
author: Nicole F.

description:
My first time at Ace Wasabi was amazing! 
Really good and fresh sushi. 
What impressed me the most was the service. Every server was extremely nice and attentive. They poured my beer and sake for me when I was running low and were always available if I had any questions.
I live in the area and this will definitely be a spot I eat at often.
author: Jaime B.

description: Natissia is the best and she knows just what this place needed. Check it out for some great sushi.
author: Glenn G.

description: This is my Go-To Sushi spot in the Marina.  The staff is really friendly, the sushi is excellent, and the Happy Hour is awesome - especially Bingo!
author: AJ L.

description: Amazing yummy sushi and great fun ambience. The pork belly with mussles and chitake mushroom dih was absolutely beautiful and tasty. We ordered couple of roles and dishes, they were all delicous. The bartender was very nice and fun. I highly recommend this pace for a nightiut with the dear ones or a groupnof friends.
author: Haleh H.

description:
funny named rolls, decent quality fish, friendly staff (kitchen and wait), great ambiance however, the music playing went against the whole "Rock and Roll" vibe a la Rolling Stones and the other albums on the walls... lil Wayne isn't exactly what we were expecting to hear.

I'd definitely come back and talk to Akiyo again-- friendliest waitress ever! Too bad it's only open til 11ish...
author: Tyler A.

description: The new tasting menu is amazing!  It is more than enough for 2 people!  The tataki is amazingness in your mouth!
author: Bryson S.

description:
Rock N Roll time! 
Very energetic place that gets crowded all the time. With the good food and cool atmosphere, that's expected.

- They have BINGO on some nights where you can win a $20 gift certificate
- Sashimi is FRESH
- Seaweed salad is good
- Service is friendly
- Gets crowded and loud, especially after the sake starts flowing!

Location might be a hassle for parking, but there's plenty of bars to hang out at after dinner. Not a bad place to grab some good Japanese food in the Marina area.
author: Linda C.

description:
Was craving sushi and also had a Groupon for $55 worth of Sushi = a good night out :)

Got there around 6PM on a Wedneday and was greeted with a Bingo Board, winner recives $25 off their tab - not too shabby.  

Over food was delicious, got 5 rolls 3 beers and 2 large sakes and came out to about $85 without the Groupon.
author: Mayying W.

description:
This is a nice spot deep in the Marina beyond Fillmore & Lombard.  I like how it's understated from the outside but lively & kickin once you get in.  The food is good enough, definitely California style sushi with western influences on every roll.

Great way to start off a night of drinking, right down the street from Delaney's.
author: T D.

description:
I used to LOVE Ace Wasabi, however they've changed management and their menu recently and now it's TERRIBLE!  I would have given it a 5 star before, but now only a 1.  

Some of the menu items have remained the same, however they are not executed in the same style.  The best thing on their menu was the white tuna tataki appetizer.  It used to be delicious, but now the fish pieces are not thinly sliced, but thick and clumsy.  They are just thrown on the plate with barely any onions or ponzu sauce.  I've had this dish literally maybe 25 times, but now its not the same.
author: Kali H.

description: We tried this place last night with a groupon. We had an AMAZING time. They sat us at the sushi bar. The head chef and owner were among the three sushi chefs.  Our chef was neither, but he was extremely friendly and fun.  The owner started us out with a free roll.  Everything we had was delicious--eel, tuna, hamachi, scallops, seaweed salad, calamari.  Food was great. Nice ambiance. Water was slow, but that's my only complaint about the service. We'll go again!
author: Caligrrl G.

description:
Ace Wasabi presents a good middle ground between somewhere like Naked Fish (quiet) and Mas Sake (loud).  We had a table by the front, lively atmosphere but not obnoxiously loud.

Sushi was good.  The sashimi was fresh, the nigiri just so-so.  Really liked the lobster roll with mango.  Probably sacrilege for those "sushi snobs" out there, but it was a nice balance of flavors, had a good "tang" to it, and wasn't outrageously pricey.

Service was good; our waitress was patient with our ever-changing order and very attentive.
author: Nate H.

description:
yum. sashimi was good (we had the tuna, hamachi, and salmon) and a couple rolls. great service. thats based only on the fact that the waiter bowed at us. three times. haaaaahaha. white man bowing. i love it. is that wrong?

skip the edamame.
author: M S.

description:
i came here randomly with some friends one night, and yay i found another yummy fresh sushi rest!!!!  they have one of the best hamachi kama and the sashimi are soooo fresh.  Our waitress was extremely nice too. she even helped us pour our big bottle of alky when she saw our shot cups were empty! i cant wait to come back and try everything on the menu!  

btw, parking is a b****.  i came on a week nite. my god i was circling around that seemed forever!
author: Anna W.

description:
I am no marina girl.  I wasn't wearing heels with my Sevens, and I most certainly had not spent an hour in front of the mirror blow drying my hair straight.  I came straight from work, with a hole in my shirt, and a bright orange bandanna covering my fro.  I didn't come for the scene. 

I came for the unveiling of a pretty stellar juke box....and the sushi.  What an appropriate place to put up one of the most awesome, free play jukes.  Its Rock and Roll sushi...and now it lives up to the name.  Unique rolls made this dining experience pleasurable.  Whoever thought mango and pecans in rolls was a good idea was right. Albacore nigiri covered in ponzu sauce and scallions remains one of my favorites, especially because the quality of the Ace WAsabis sushi is top notch.  The saki bombs didn't hurt none either.  

Get there early and they play bingo every night at 6:30.  No joke.  When I yelled out BINGO...I just thought I'd get a pat on the back.  Didn't realize id be getting a $20 gift certificate.  Guess I'll be coming back....ignoring the crowd once again, enjoying the music, beer and food.
author: Lauren F.

description:
This is a totally average sushi place. Decent nigiri and a good assortment of funky 'white people' rolls. As a whiter person I enjoyed the one with scallop and green onion on top. Oh their tuna tartar is good too.

BUT, this place does BINGO every night at 6:30. One round and the winner gets a $20 gift certificate!! NICE totally RANDOM touch - love it!! 

Yes, the people here late night and on weekends tend to be tools but com early, eat sushi, win bingo and be merry.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Ace's... sit at the bar so that the ever-so-witty and charming Kyle can serve up some creative soju cocktails (which i hate, personally but other people like) and hilarious quips to boot.

The sushi here is decidedly Americanized so stick with the basics which are all done well.  Did not care for the Uni at Ace's... a bit bland, dry and completely devoid of any uni-creamy-richness.
author: lulu p.

description:
We walked in and I immediately wanted to walk right back out.  Actually, we pretty much did.

If there was a no star option I'd have given this establishment no stars. 

1) Smelled like old fish and filth. 
2) Was dirty
3) Was populated by the most annoying drunk white people ever

Needless to say, I didn't eat here and will not return.
author: Jess S.

description:
Sushi was good, so 3.5. I went with my standby of a rainbow roll, which was kind of small, but good, plus a whopping four maguro nigiri. Nigiri were large and richly colored, just how I like 'em. A shared mango/tuna sashimi salad was good. I drowned it all with a couple "Sake-2-Me," which I'm pretty sure were sake wine coolers, in Asian Pear or Mango Ginger flavors. Nice fizzy to go with my sushi, so points for that.

Service good, price ($50 each) alright, considering how much we got.

I'm torn about the atmosphere. They play a range of music, from Nelly Furtado to The Smiths to Peter Schilling, which is fun. The walls are lined with old concert posters, including for local shows at The Fillmore; also fun. They have nightly bingo, and my girlfriend ended up winning, scoring $20 off her next visit.

But it felt like they were trying too hard or something. My logic is that cheap places don't feel that way, and neither do very expensive places; so a lot of mid-priced hotspots often feel like the outshined middle child trying to get attention. Ace Wasabi didn't slide this far, but it seemed on its way.
author: Tara R.

description:
Eh.
Fish - excellent.

I thought the 45 minute wait for food warning was one of those 'just in case' postings that didn't actually mean anything.  
My two top order of two rolls (one of which was just tuna), two pieces of sushi & one order (5 pieces) of shashimi took at least that long.  
On a MONDAY.

Overall I expected more variety - i didn't really see much on the menu that hasn't been done before - in LESS THAN 45 MINUTES.

Also the service pretty much sucked.  Slow & unattentive & she forgot my wine.  Of course the forgotten wine still made it to the table well before any fish.
author: laura g.

description:
Unfortunately for Ace, I went to Coach Sushi in Oakland for the first time just two days before going to Ace for the first time. That's a tough act to follow.

But Ace held up really well. I split several rolls with friends, but definitely took more than my fair share of the Spider Roll and Spicy Jalapeno Tuna Roll. Best Spider Roll I've ever had.

The service was excellent, and the prices weren't bad at all. Next time a friend visits and insists on going to the Marina for dinner (it happens too often) I'll be sure to suggest this spot.
author: Trey C.

description:
You know what? A lot of my friends think i'm a sushi snob. I'm just quite keen and particular as to what I like.
Ace Wasabi is not the place to go if you are a purist about your fish, come here for rolls.
So on a sunday night 3 friends walked in, one of which had a broken heart.
Although the other two knew that a broken heart cannot be mended right away, they figured some good food would at least get the band aid on.

Ordered:
the tataki - seared perfectly. the sauce is a bit salty because it is heavy on on the soy sauce, but the seasoning made up for it and the cut of the fish was perfect.
three amigos roll - although i read about this in yelp reviews numerous times, i felt it didn't have much flavor although it was topped with wasabi tobiko. 
tiger roll - AWESOME. the scallop inside great, and the salmon on top was delicious
3 orders of uni nigiri - the uni wasn't the freshest so it wasn't as sweet and had a slightly fishy taste, but it was decent and passable. i suspect it's because uni is not the biggest seller here.
2 orders of tobiko + quail egg nigiri (stanley K, i know you're jealous) - you can NEVER go wrong with tobiko + quail egg nigiri. tobiko is like the pop rocks of seafood and just imagine chewing it and having it pop while the creaminess of quail egg yolk blends the taste and textures together on your tongue.
1 lobster mango handroll - ORDER IT. it came with a generous amount of fresh, sweet, lobster meat , 2 slices of mango, macadamia nuts, cilantro (and i hate cilantro) but oh man it was soo good!!! i highly recommend it. it's not on their regular menu, it's on the special menu.
5 pieces of hamachi toro sashimi - you cannot go wrong with hamachi, and hamachi toro is even better. mmmmmmmm belly cut!!

our waitress, Carrie, gave us some damn good service. She was quick, efficient, and she was helpful with our special requests and what not and always came at the right time to see if we needed more sake or water. 

my friends had a carafe of the Demon Killer which is alright for sushi,but i'd go with a bottle of Running Springs if you have enough people. 

The bill came to be about $95, and of the three friends, 1 left a bit less broken hearted.


minus one star only because IT'S SO FREAKING LOUD. I CANNOT HEAR MYSELF THINK. MY THOUGHTS ARE IN ALL CAPS AT THIS PLACE. lol
author: Susy C.

description:
Try the salmon crunchy roll or the Hamachi Appetizer's....usually a long wait but it's also a really good time to sit at the bar.  

The bartender's are super cool and will comp a shot or two to you if you can share some surfing tips. And of course, I have only witnessed this b/c I know nothing more than they do!
author: Yelper A.

description:
UPDATE:

I received this charming, charming message from Brad S. early Saturday morning.  I'm not sure whether or not he's associated with the restaurant.  He actually reminded me that it's a great idea to keep track of which restaurants use green packaging.  Thanks Brad!

I just reread his note; it seems like he probably does work there.  Funny that someone who uses styrofoam calls Me a lazy ass!  Ha!
_____________

You trash  Ken's restaurant , where you actually like the food, because he served you food to go in a waterproof  and insulating container so that your lazy ass will have cool and dry sushi at home. Nice. Grow up. 
______________



I actually really like the food here.  Yes, it's overrun by Marina tools and, yes, the service is slow (but quite sweet) but, really, the food is pretty good.  So good, in fact, that I took it home.  (Yeah, that's right, I eat sushi the next day.)  And it wasn't until I was enjoying my sushi today, after a trip to Ace's last night, marvelling at how much I was actually enjoying it the day after it was "fresh" that I noticed.

It was packaged in styrofoam.  

Styrofoam.  How, um, retro?

Seriously, people, are you fucking kidding me?  I pay Marina prices and deal with fembots for two hours and you can't walk your ass down to Clement Street and get some recycled cardboard containers?  Good god, SF has BANNED plastic bags, there's a six month backlog for one of those boxy-ass Hybrids, and Leonardo DiCaprio is suddenly cool again.  Green.  Get on board.
author: Pammy C.

description: One might think that with the gimmicky theme and all, that the quality of the sushi might be compromised, but its certainly not.  The fish is quite good, very fresh, and they cut the sashimi in very generous portions.  The prices are reasonable as well and its fun to enjoy sushi to cool 80s rock.  I guess if there were any complaints, it would be that the food was slow in arriving and one of my dining companions complained about the table being too low (?).  The place is a bit cluttered with all the Saporo boxes stacked up along the walls.
author: Rick H.

description:
My boyfriend and I ventured to the Marina to get some sushi because I knew that I had seen some sushi signs at one time or another there. 
Initially, we were headed to Naked Fish, but after noticing the underwhelming selection of sushi on the menu, we decided to try Ace Wasabi's.

Fortunately, we walked in right at the end of happy-hour, which goes till 7. WHAT an awesome deal! We got sushi rolls, the Cajun Shrimp one I believe, for like $4! And my boyfriend got the Hamachi Kama for only $5..and that was A LOT of fish for only $5. He was thoroughly impressed with it.

I loved all the rolls we got. The sushi was fresh and delicious. We got the rainbow roll, or something like that, and vegetable tempura and all of it was very, very good. 

IHowever, it is a little small and they tried to put us at the low bar in the back, but we asked to move up to the front. The waitress was more than happy to oblige, thankfully. 

I definitely recommend Ace Wasabi's. GREAT CHEAP Happy Hour and good, fresh sushi.
author: Ashley B.

description:
Came here with a friend not too long ago to have dinner and to visit a fellow named Mikey who works here (and used to be a customer of ours when we were bartenders!).

After getting situated at the sushi bar (where all the action takes place), we drank some sake cocktails which were fruity and light tasting (couldn't tell they were alcoholic). 

We ordered some tuna tartare to start which was on top of guacamole which we happily scarfed down with those styrofoam looking shrimp chips. For sushi, we had various nigiri and some of their special rolls. One of the spicy rolls had chopped jalapeno that made it extra good. The fish was all very buttery and good quality. Just when we thought we were good with the amount of food we ordered, the sushi chefs (as playful, goofy and flirty as they were) gave us a ton of other things to try on the house (other nigiri and rolls)! My favorite was the tuna tataki and we were also made a special lobster omelette by Mikey...he insisted that he make something for us even though we were thisclose to exploding from fullness so we just said "surprise us!"

Just as we thought we were done gorging ourselvers, he made us dessert in the form of tempura bananas, sliced up and present like sushi, haha. 

and lastly, just as we thought that it couldn't get any better, Mikey refused to let us pay the bill no matter how much we protested! Unbelievable! I'm eternally grateful for such a wonderful dining experience.
author: kristin e.

description:
I can't get enough of this place for some reason. #3 on my top sushi places in the city.  I frequent here often with friends or out of town guests. A great place to hit up before heading out for a night on the town. This place is fun and loud, so if you're not fun, than I recommend staying away. 

All the sushi rolls are top notch.   

Personal favorites: U2 Roll and the Flying Kamakaze Roll

Go heavy on the sake!
author: Allen X.

description:
Yummy sushi and sashimi, great drinks, laid-back vibe, REASONABLE prices, and bingo = Two thumbs up!

I used to like this place, but after being to several other places for sushi, I'm beginning to love it.  Considering what you would pay and what you get, it is a deal.  Favorite roll is the salmon with the thin slice of lemon on the top, with tempura bits center (Can't remember the name )!  Yummy!
author: Priscilla N.

description:
Fun, friendly, and most of all, good food.  

Butterfish, tataki tuna, and their daily specials all are good.  Cider Sake Bomb is my staple drink.
author: Jacob J.

description:
Ive known this place for the past 6-7 years now. I worked there for a good 2 months or so when I was 16 and it was very enjoyable. Ive dined here countless times and I'm always satisfied..but then again its probably because I know the chefs here heh heh. 

Always sit at the sushi bar if you want the best. No matter what, unless your just planning to keep within your own group. David, Danny or Les is my top lineup for the chefs when I go eat. 

Now for the people that have never been to Ace Wasabis...Its a loud atmosphere with music and during the weekends, it can get pretty crowded. Their menu and style of sushi is made for this crowd. Your not going to find traditional japanese food here and its pretty obvious. So if your into the whole, simple quiet japanese type of place then I wouldnt really recommend it, But if your in for a good time and dont care much about sound factor then by all means go and enjoy yourself.
author: phillip w.

description:
I spent hours doing research on yelp looking for a good sushi restaurant in the Marina.  My friend and I wanted an easy on the stomach meal for a night out on the town and have tried most of the other sushi establishments in the Marina so decided to try somethign new.

The reviews for Ace Wasabi's let me think that the atmosphere was to be desired.  I really wasn't all that concerned about the food b/c I typically order the same thing at every sushi restaurant.

However, the atmosphere was less than desirable.  The crowd was unnattractive in a cocky way and the place looked very commercialized, maybe like tex-mex type.  It was hmmm,,,,unnappetizing?  

I must say the wait staff is courteous and the sushi isn't bad.  The service and food aren't why the place get's two stars.

As an elite member I have to start being pickier about handing out my stars....And this place just didn't do it for me.
author: leahnora r.

description:
All Bark and no Bite

this place is really loud and is fileld with a  party of loud obnoxious drunk 23 yr olds.

I think the restaurant knows they can get away with B grade quality because their customers are inexperienced and have heavily imbibed.

the sushi is very much the California influenced stylish sushi and not very authentic.  

If you don't like the Marina crowd, you will absolutely HATE this place.  If you do like the Marina crowd, like waiting in line for decent overpriced sushi, are looking to have 6-7 drinks in a loud environment, you will LOVE it.

If you are looking for a stylish sushi place with better sushi and better style, go to Blowfish.
author: Spencer G.

description:
I'm scared of being reprimanded by my fellow real Japanese nigiri sushi lovers but Ace Wasabi has won me over with the spicy tuna roll and Orion beer. Spicy tuna roll has chopped jalapeno pieces in it.  I really liked it. I crave it.   Plus, the point of ace is to have fun and rock n roll while you eat and they got that pat down. 

And, I tried the aji nigiri.....and it was good!
author: Wakako U.

description:
One of my favorite neighborhood places for sushi with friends. We go there all the time for sushi bingo! Yup, most weekdays at about 6:30 they pull out the bingo cards for your chance to win a $20 gift certificate for your next visit. I haven't won yet - boohoo! But so far, the first timers we bring always win. WTH?!!

Such a great atmosphere and the music the play there just brings you back to the 80s and 90s. Lots of fun! I have to admit that I really only venture there on the weekdays. Fridays and Saturdays tend to be a bit crowded and a bit of a scene, but other than that the sushi is yummy enough. I recommend the butterfish nigiri, crunchy sake roll, the seared something tuna with ponzu sauce appetizer (sorry, can't remember the name!)...  and wash it all down with hot sake.. mmm mmm
author: Bernadette L.

description:
Another trip down memory lane! 

3 very solid stars for a nice party like atmosphere, hence the name Rock N Roll in the title. You don't come here for classical Tokyo style nigiri sushi, but you bring friends and party like frat boys and sorority girls, minus the drugs, strippers, and false Duke LaCross rape charges.

Again, avoid nigiri here, and stomach up to some really fancy fusion kind of dishes (well not really fusion but definitely not traditional). Not necessarily the best quality of fish (which is why nigiri will be a disappointment), but the overall result like fancy rolls, or sashimi with sauces, is edible and well fun to share with drunken friends. The spicy crawfish handroll is actually quite interesting, it is as if you are eating a fusion style lobster roll, but without the Boston style baked bread roll. So all you have is a shruken lobster with edible shell, rice, seaweed in a cone form. Maybe it is not a lobster roll, but an el cheapo fusion spicy shellfish ice cream cone.

This place was fun in the late 90s as an additional pre-karaoke dinner spot gathering with some friends from another college. Thank gawd my tastes have matured and moved on. This may be a fun place to bring a date, or go bar hopping at A16 then come here for something else.

But you got to love the name. What does Ace really mean?
A polite alternative way to say "cornhole" or the orifice between one's rear cheeks? The British version of "best" or "favorite"? Or does it mean expert? Either way the wasabi here is not the real stuff but the powder to paste.
author: Ken K.

description:
Great roll's, sake, the works...its just too darn loud and crowded. I prefer to hear the people I dine with, since we usually have a thing or to say. If you go here on a Weekend nite be prepared to bring out the sign-language. 

Crowd is usually the young hip, wanna be seen prior to hitting the clubs or bars. Can be fun, but it is crowded.
author: Kristina A.

description: I looooove this place! The fish is very fresh and tasty, there's great ambiance and prices are reasonable for the Marina. It can be very crowded on the weekends but it's worth it. We'll be going back soon!
author: Sadia J.

description: my favorite thing about this place was the decor. super sleek and modern, with rock and roll pictures all over. definitely got excited when I walked by and saw all my favorite musicians and bands on the walls so I had to go in and try. My edamame was great, I was a little sad about my miso soup..it was a tad too salty for my liking and took away from it. my sushi was great though. my boyfriend ordered r special...the chicken fingers..he didn't like them and found them to be a little pink. so he didn't eat them. other than that the place was good. the guy in front thought we had a problem because we ate and left quickly which I thought was nice...he wanted to make sure we were okay.
author: Jenny N.

description:
Thank you, Ace Wasabi, for providing a meal/experience so abysmal that I had to join Yelp to tell about it.

This was the worst sushi and worst total meal I have had since moving to SF last year.  I was dragged here on Friday night by a friend who was "craving sushi" - but who doesn't eat fish.  "Sushi" to her is cucumber and avocado rolls.  Enough said?

No.  After the "twenty-minute" (I mean, an hour and twenty minute) wait, we were seated at the sushi bar/hot crowded service corridor in front of old and sickly-looking fish.   Appetite for raw food gone.  We order spicy green beans that tasted like wood, crab cakes that were basically the crab sushi filling deep-fried, and, upon our other friend's insistence, albacore tataki that I took one bite of and almost vomited due to the metallic past-its-prime fish.   I could not bring myself to try her oversauced something roll covered in sad grey eel and stuffed with tuna dregs.  The only edible thing was, yes, the cucumber and avocado roll.

This food is not clean.  This food is not good.  Do not go here, not even if the drinks are comped and your friend pays and gives you a ride home.  Once home, I had to eat half a pint of strawberry Haagen-Daaz just to get that bad albacore taste our of my mouth.  

I can only assume this place is popular due to the low prices and Marina "scene" (shrieking girls, overgrown frat boys, you know the drill).  Please do not be fooled by the crowds clamoring for a table.  Other than some amusing eye candy, there is nothing edible here.
author: Melissa B.

description:
There are so many things wrong with this place I don't even know where to start.

Of course I do, you start with the food.  Rule #1 - nuts and cream cheese DO NOT belong in sushi rolls.  Sorry to be a snob here but, any place that serves this I can't help but write off immediately.

Not to mention the obnoxious drunk marina crowd more interested in sake bombs and picking up on each other to notice the food blows and is a total rip off.

Need I really say more?
author: Jenny S.

description:
This was our first time there. Online advertised a tasting menu for 2 but when we got there, the waitress said they no longer served it. I said I had checked the website that same day and it was listed. The manager was nice enough to have the chefs make the tasting menu for us. It was outstanding! it was a wonderful sampler consisting of a trio of edamame, miso soup, seared albacore, beef short ribs with pineapple and orange juice, gyoza, miso glazed fish, lobster, mango macadamia hand rolls, nigiri, scorpion roll, and yummy strawberry ice cream mochi. Have I made you hungry? Everything was so fresh and yummy. I highly recommend them.

I almost forgot, while we were there, at 6:30 PM, they had a game of bingo for all customers to play for a chance to win a $20 giftcard on your next visit.
author: Joanne B.

description: The atmosphere, waiter, bartender and food - 5 stars! How long it took us to get our food? 1 star. My friends and I had a great time eating here, but it took literally 90 minutes for us to get our food for some reason. Even the waiter felt bad so he kept bringing us free carafes of nigori sake (nice!). At least the food was worth the wait - my favorite, favorite roll: the Crunchy Sake that has crispy potato bits wrapped with salmon and lemon. Does not get better than that - yummy! Can't wait to go back and hopefully get served faster this time :-)
author: LuLu M.

description:
I completely had Ace's pegged as more of a hang out sushi joint with the scene of every other table doing sake bombs while rocking out to blaring tunes and eating crap sushi than an authentic Japanese restaurant (it's a general assumption apparently,) but I was pleasantly surprised by the selection of Japanese specialties and sake on the menu. 

We ordered a few rolls from the regular menu and a special roll that our server practically forced us to order. His "It's REALLY good" went from a light, suggestive tone to a deep, commanding snarl (no joke.) He claimed to have ate it for 2 straight weeks and would take it off our bill if we didn't like it, so we did bc we had nothing to lose, although it was a little intimidating and really weird. 

All the rolls were really good, specifically the special roll (shame on me for not remembering the name) that our server "persuaded" us to order. I could definitely see myself eating that everyday for 2weeks if I had the opportunity. Anyways, I stood corrected, as Ace's does serve quality, authentic fare, and we were the only table slamming sake glasses and rocking out to the tunes of our own obnoxious voices.
author: Deanna T.

description:
Wish there was one of these in LA...

Pros:  Fresh sashimi, hamachi kama is well done, prices are really reasonable and it's got a great laidback vibe and the staff is awesome...they usually hook us up with free sake when we're there since we're regulars...

Cons:  Hard to think of any...honestly.  It's not the best sashimi I've had in my life, but it's pretty damn good.
author: Nelson W.

description:
an hour wait for takeout, yikes. and i had to call like 10x to even just get through to someone who wouldn't just hangup the phone. 

we were so looking forward to trying the lobster mango roll. tummy rumbling sounds in the background. 

till next time! 


(fyi, after getting two groupons, we've been literally addicted to ace wasabi sushi, its really fresh and amazing tasting)
author: Sara D.

description:
Great Sushi and great ambiance.  Their Tataki is amazing, but so is everything else.  Great atmosphere on Friday nights, but you still get your food quick and its not a sauna in there (**AHEM Mas Sake).

Love it, I will be back soon.  Better park at your friends house who lives in the marina and walk.
author: Jackie M.

description: My favorite sushi place in Bay Area...delicious food, fun atmosphere!   Short rips and/or beef tataki as appetizer and dragon roll for the main course are a must! Also ask for their special made saki bomb! gochisōsama
author: Ramin S.

description:
I am a big fan of Ace Wasabi - in fact it might be my favorite sushi place ever, in addition to Shogun in Santa Cruz, my hometown.  The sushi always tastes fresh, the servers, sushi chefs and hostesses are always so helpful and friendly!

Our typical order and the things me and the bf love:
Kamikaze chicken fingers
Pot stickers
Edamame (of course)
Dragon Roll
Crunchy Ace Wasbi Roll
Cajun Shrimp Roll
Maguro sashimi
Sake sashimi
Butterfish sashimi

'Nuff said.
author: Jen L.

description:
Hola folks!

well well well...seeing as how I took a very timid foreigner here, who isn't used to fresh California and Japanese seafood, it was already destined to be a wonderful, daring experience!!

the folks here are all very friendly, even the Asian chefs who usually are rather quiet seemed to light up at each and every customer, they threw out their suggestions freely and happily...our waitress was amazing and beautiful, she even comped us a saki and beer at the end

the restaurant offers a great mix between cooked and raw dishes so everyone can easily find something to munch on. i hiiighly recommend the sauteed scallops, not only are they a garlicy-delight, bu they come in a  beautiful clam shell with endives and cheese smothered all over the top...fabulous. second, order the fresh sashimi of the day, it was definitely exotic and wonderful.

the missing star? the seating is a little awkward and marina yup yups can disturb the dining experience..tee hee...other than that, its definitely worth a visit, if I lived closer i'd be a regular fo sheeeze.
author: Tina D.

description:
To the 200+ reviewers below:  We get it - you think the Marina is pretentious. By the way - you (i.e. Hayes/Cole/Potrero/etc hipsters) still keep visiting and bitch every time ... so suck it! 

Now to review the actual restaurant ... 

They actually have pretty damn good sushi. I'm not talking about a Philly Roll. Which by the way, if anyone mentions a Philly Roll in their review please disregard immediately! 

Their sushi is legit and well priced. The owner/manager is extremely nice (and she's hot). Its a fun crowd (please see comment above before rolling your eyes) and they don't take resos so grab a drink and wait. 

This is NOT Mas Sake. The food is very good and so is the atmosphere.
author: Peter C.

description:
I just recently dined here, on a Monday night. It was moderately full. sat @ the beer bar where the bartender took our order. we had a couple rolls and several beers and sake. the rolls were great. 

The ambiance is rock and roll motif. wasn't too impressed But would return, with a group of friends to crank it up a notch.

It was overall a decent sushi bar. 

O yeah had the Green Tea Cupcake w/ Lychee Frosting...... Had better. but had to try the combo out... ;p Ya know.
author: Lady O.

description:
INCREDIBLE!  Huge fan of Sushi and have rated every sushi place in Nashvegas.  Ace Wasabi outdoes themselves.  Service was spectacular.  Atmosphere was great.  Food was better than most of us deserve.  Marissa, our waitress, was on fire.  Her personality, attention to detail and service were the best I've found anywhere.  
I'm a picky guy and largely a critic.  I found this place above reproach.
author: grant b.

description:
Fun scene, good sushi, tasty sake and drinks, and predictably cute marina crowd.  

Difficult parking, a bit busy and cramped, a little loud for conversation, and predictably annoying marina crowd.
author: Brad C.

description:
I'm generally cautious of going to Sushi places that are either themed (i.e. Rock & Roll) or not clearly authentic Japanese, but I stumbled into Ace Wasabi's following some afternoon drinks in the Marina because people were craving sushi. Maybe it was the drinks I had prior to dinner that fueled my appetite, or maybe it was just the fact that I wasn't sure what to expect, but the rolls at Ace Wasabi actually weren't bad. In fact, I stuffed my face like the piggy that I am.

A couple of highlights: 
Crunchy Ace Wasabi Roll
Flying Kamikaze Roll
Tiger Roll

The restaurant is loud and packed full of the Marina crowd, so it's a great place to hang out with friends...not so much for kids or a family dinner. Don't forget to check out the giant ipod-style jukebox that you can play with. Rockin.
author: Felicia C.

description:
This is my boyfriend and my favorite sushi place in San Francisco - so far. The only drawback is that you have to go to the marina to get it and it can be ridiculously loud and crowded - and marina-y. 

If you go early, like 6 or 7, its not so bad and the music is less loud. 

We ONLY sit at the sushi bar, order mostly sashimi, and occasionally go for some of their grilled items - which are delicious! The chefs are fast and stay friendly and attentive even though they're slammed, and the management has always made sure that we're happy and have a full glass of sake.

It IS pricey, but its worth it when you get a little 'extra' cash. 

Yum! I'm making myself hungry...dang.
author: Alexa S.

description:
This is our favorite sushi place in the neighborhood. If I need a quick fix for sushi and I dont feel like going all the way to J Town, this is where I go. The sashimi and nigiri are quite good. The folks that eat here alot generally come for the rolls though. I like more traditional japanese fare, but if I am tempted for a roll here or there, Ace Wasabis is where I go.

Be warned, that they dont take reservations. The wait generally isnt too long (with the exception of Thur- Sat nights). Fun atmosphere .
author: Alden H.

description:
So I may be biased (as I did work there years ago) but it still has an amazing staff, who always takes such good care of me and my friends. And simply said...the sushi is damn good! My favorites: the tataki of course! if you haven't had it - you're missing out BIG TIME!! for nigiri - the albacore belly and the tazmanian trout! and don't forget the rolls..the scorpion, U2, Kirota and oh yeah the Tofu salad is YUMMY too.
If you go in - ask for Talia, she's the best and she's been known to have a sake  (or TWO) with ya :)
author: jen v.

description:
If you are looking to spend your evening out with an ass load of sickly skinny fake blondes and of course their matching douchebags who are all in the same button down shirts and fancy pants...then Ace Wasabi is your place of choice!!!!  These peeps don't come here for sushi.  They come to judge others including their so-called friends who are sitting with them, be seen by other idiots, get drunk off of sake, and act like retards in what could be a nice spot for some food...as it is a restaurant!

If you get past the front door and squeeze through the twig-like figures in 6-inch stilettos, and are so lucky as to bypass the entire front end of the place...you might have somewhat of an enjoybale experience.  Sadly though, even when you sit at the sushi bar and talk with the chefs to see what their specialty roll is...their response is the California Roll.  Are you fucking kidding me???  Really??  "It's super popular here.  We are in California you know?"  Wow, that turned me off immediately.  We had 3 rolls total and I was done.  I was honestly scared to try any nigiri or other slabs of rawness as they handed over our plates with the ginger and wasabi on them and they were scorching hot!  The first roll we ordered came on the same hot plate.  No thank you!  It's great that your shit is clean...but I'd rather not have my raw fish cooked slightly by my plate.
author: Ayrn H.

description:
Pretty good sushi for the price.  Great atmosphere inside..and love the "buy one sake bomb, get one free" special. 

Get drunk then walk to the bars. FUN
author: Tiffany L.

description:
This is such a fun place for sushi.  Sure it's LOUD in the front section but that's why it's called Ace Wasabi's "Rock N Roll" Sushi.  It can get really crowded on weekend nights w/ all the beautiful peeps swarming the bar (where you can also eat) and waiting for tables so sit in the back section if you want a more sedate scene.

I love their sushi.  Nice, healthy-sized rolls, fresh fish and they have some really good small plates.
author: Jeannie C.

description:
Been there more than a few times because friends want to meet there.  The sushi is good but there are MUCH better places.  Not a great plce to hold a conversation- VERY loud.

Things that prompt me to give it three stars:
-Happy hour- 5:30- 7:30-  $2 Kirin, $2 Sushi handrolls
-And they play bingo every night at 6:00 and knock $20 off the winners bill.
author: Aaron F.

description: This was my first real time having sushi and I'm glad it was here. My friend and her husband took me here to thank me for helping with some things, and it was awesome! Can't tell you exactly what I had, but I think they ordered just about everything on the menu and it was all delicious. The atmosphere was fun, they play bingo (only once a night/week?, not sure which) and it's super fun; kick ass music, a few tv's for sports, not too loud so you can talk to people next to you. All in all it was a great experience. i'd totally go back again.
author: Josh S.

description:
My friends and I love this place! 

Here's why: 

Awesome sushi (fresh and yummy) 
Awesome staff (everyone including chefs)
HOT bartender! 

Okay, so we're girls and not to shabby looking.  So every time we go there, not only do we come out full and a bit tispy but we have so much fun.  The bartender always gives us free drinks and we have some pull with the chefs.  So we get a couple free rolls here and there.  

Even without the free stuff, we love this place! We always have fun. What could be better? Good food, good drinks, good company and good service!  

My only complaint, it's a bit pricey but what sushi place that's good isn't.  I don't want to get sick, so I rather pay for quality fish than eat something questionable.
author: Lexie S.

description:
The staff is friendly and the sushi is great. 
Yes, it's in the Marina, but I don't mind since it's pretty close to my house and I have friends that live in the area.  
My absolute favorite is the Cajun shrimp roll!
author: Hannah F.

description: So we go to Naked Fish Sushi happy hour religiously but their happy hour ends at 6 on Fridays and we didn't get down to Chestnut Street until about 6:05 so we decided to try something new. What a huge mistake that was. The sushi was terrible - it was a little worse than Safeway sushi....very similar quality though. The happy hour menu was ridic - the rolls were about 50 cents less than the normal menu...total ripoff. The place was also dead. Will NOT be back.
author: Lindsay D.

description:
BF and I went here a few months back, and though it was my first time, he'd been there quite often in the past. I wasn't that impressed, and neither was he - saying it'd gone down hill since the last time he was there. I would agree that it was OK, but not great. 

(We ordered the kobe, some rolls, and I got some nigiri...)
author: Sally M.

description:
Update 7-25-07:

I have now gone to Ace Wasabi twice in recent weeks and have had a blast. I've gotten to know some of the staff including their manager and they're all great. The food is very consistent and tasty and the scene at the front bar is lively and usually full of cool people. This is a great place to start your night off before heading downtown.

_____________________________________________________

Ate here for the first time last night. My dinner date must know the place well because she requested a table in the back. Our sushi came out pretty quickly and was nice and fresh with a basic presentation. The tuna was really good here and the rest was as expected. Our waitress was nice but not overly helpful and the hostess that night was extremely friendly. What cracks me up is when you walk by the sushi bar and about half of the staff starts saying hi to you in all kinds of broken Engrish! You just expect a hug to come next...nice people. The main bar in the front seemed to be filled up with a very well-dressed and yuppie crowd. Overall, a decent place and worthy of a second chance.
author: Gabriel R.

description:
i was hungry and parking in the marina sucks.  boo to that.  but food here is not too bad for a japanese place where no one yells irashaimase when you come in.

this was another cozmo deck pick (http://cozmocard.com/deck/) so we got $15 off our meal which is pretty nice.  we had a beer, tiger roll (scallop, spicy crab roll with avocado and salmon on top), uni sushi, amaebi sushi, sake sushi, miso cod with mushrooms, halibut cheeks with enoki mushrooms, mixed greens salad for $60 something with $15 off.  the salad was good.  sushi was ok but i have to remember that i dont like spicy rolls.  the hot food was a bit too salty but still decent.

this was my second time here. so i guess i would come back.  but not that often.  marina just isnt really a place for sushi.
author: claudia y.

description: Best Sushi in the bay area!!!!  Love the Teryiki Chicken sushi, miso soup, california rolls, ahi mah sushi....wash it all down with beer.  Great place.  Get there early because the place fills up quickly!
author: Sweetpea M.

description:
sickass jukebox - free music - lil weezy

and

sake bombs!!!

this place is ill!!!
author: Kevin L.

description: Simply put, Ace Wasabi is like a better version of Mas Sake when it comes to food. Mas Sake has a more "clubbish" environment with its lighting, music, and waitresses but when it comes to food Mas Sake is WAY better than MS. They have a great variety of rolls and I was impressed with their creativity. Prices are not great but reasonable. People come here to mostly drink and do sake bombs along with eating sushi so it is excellent for groups. Fun atmosphere combined with good food makes coming to Ace a good time out.
author: Ed L.

description:
Everyone I know loves this place.  
It's good but I can't bear to give  this white washed excuse for real Japanese sushi 5 stars. 
Still the Tuna Tataki is the best I've ever had! The cider bombs [Pear cider with a shot of Sake] are an amazing drink that will take you straight to drunk.  And the upbeat young atmosphere make this a great dinner/drink hang out spot!

Oh and don't forget Sushi Bingo on Tuesday.
author: Kat R.

description:
If this place didn't have great service and awesome food I'd give it a 1 because the night we hit up Ace a retarded side show of drunk Marina A-Holes took place 10 feet from us. Between spectacles of loud yelling, throwing food, and impromptu karaoke to fraternity party hits from across the room, my crew and I enjoyed a variety of Japanese sushi classics delivered by the one and only Roku along with enough Sake and beer to drown out the nauseating regional wildlife.

Favorites of the night were the spicy green beans appetizer that took healthy finger foods to a whole new level and the tuna takaki that disappeared in a couple minutes. Of course there was plenty of Sashimi to go around, but I think my taste buds started dumbing down after a few delicious pear cider sake bombs forcing a disinterest in the raw delicacies in favor of the large Sapporo in front of me and the pack of smokes tucked away calling my name.
author: Marcos M.

description:
The decor was boring and the set-up hurt.  Didn't have that cozy feel.  The wait was forever, no fault to the staff.  People don't realize that there are other people waiting for your table after you're done.  It's cool to hang out and talk if its close to closing time, but c'mon...during prime time.  730pm.....don't get to sit until 830pm?!  The staff finally got them to move and apologized to us profusely, even hooked up some sake...a nice touch.

Overall, the food was surprisingly, pretty darn good. I wouldn't go back though.  I just don't like the marina crowd.  Frat boy central.
author: Ezduzit S.

description: Natasha was an awesome server... awesome recommendations on the rolls. My wife has been there several times, and she has ranted and raved about the place. NOW I KNOW WHY. THIS PLACE ROCKS AND IT ROLLS
author: Benjamin V.

description:
Shame on all of you 5 star raters of Ace Wasabi's!!!

Okay, so it's a Marina "scene".  Does that mean we should we pay no attention to the fact that the sushi is awful (lacking in freshness, style/presentation) and quite simply... boring?  First and foremost this place is a sushi restaurant, not a loud playground for all the MySpace hipsters and Marina chicks!  

Stop accepting mediocrity from your sushi haunts just because your parents stil lhave you on their payroll and finance your lifestyle.  Stand-up for yourself and demand better!
author: Aaron N.

description:
I'd give this place 5 stars, but I just wasn't impressed enough.  Sure, the rolls are great, and pretty creative, but they were all lacking some kind of oomph.

The sake is delicious... Try the peach.  Calamari and rock shrimp?  Eh... Sauce was weak.  Yes, weak sauce.

Yummy sushi.  I'll go back.  Marina people are ridiculous, but I happened to sit next to some nice guys who struck up good conversation.

Oh, and the music is awesome.
author: Carrie A.

description: In town for a wedding from Wash DC. Looking for some good sushi and came after reading some other reviews. All I can say is FABULOUS!  Awesome sushi, rolls and service. Wish we had one back East!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Sometimes - when Im feeling just hip enough, and am wearing the proper combination of distressed jeans, distressed leather, and the right peck clinging striped black shirt, I deem myself worthy of a dinner in the Marina.

If you are in the area - Ace is a solid sushi choice - but nothing to go out of your way for.  

Service ****
Food ***
Atmosphere ***
Price***

Based upon my expectations, I thought the service was very thoughtful, from the bartender to the server.  The server was also quite knowledgeable on the sush and sake.  

The atmosphere was a little crowded - and it is tough to get a drink as several people are eating at the bar.  The front room is nice because it is a little more open and has a view of the street with all the marina hot mamas rolling around.  However, it is a little generic, and somewhat similar to the decor of a fancy high school cafeteria.  The backroom is cute with brick walls and old movie posters, but I feel it is trying just a little too hard to capture the essence of "hip".  The crowd was a bit goofier than usual for the marina.  A gangly, IT-looking double date across from us was seemingly conversing over whether I was tapping both or just one of the girls I was sitting with (me and two quite cute ladies at dinner), where by fact, if you are interested, the answer was neither.

Sush!  One of my favorite foods for sure.  Just average.  But certainly not bad.  The jalapeno tuna roll was mediocre, but there was a different specialty roll that was ridiculously hot.  As I type this on friday night (I went out thursday) my lips are still a little irritated.  For the non-specialty rolls I think the 49er roll was solid.  Sake selection was solid, and we were happy with our servers recomendation.  

I am planning on trying Naked Fish soon - and I will compare / contrast.  All in all - its a positive experience, but dont expect anything to "wow" you.  I know they have a happy hour on tuesday - I would def. come here again for happy hour - but it wouldnt be my first choice otherwise.
author: Aaron D.

description: For fresh fish that melts in your mouth this is the Marina joint in San Francisco.  I'm a foodie from Hong Kong so I know my seafood department.  I  bring my friends here oftenly so they get to taste fresh fish & most importantly be convinced like I once did the non-stereotyped-Marina-sushi favourite.   Believe me you don't need a native Japanese sushi chef to impress here, just mind their own buz & whip out their freshest sushi & sashimi are all that you care!   My absolute must-haves during visits are shiromi & hamachi, my best tip to you is to ask adding extra spring onions garnish-on-top,  this is TO DIE FOR!   Other favourites: Ebi dish with fried shrimp head, (just make sure you learn how to swallow head well), aga-dashi-tofu, wok-tossed spiced green beans.  Bon apetite!
author: Linda L.

description:
i took my wife there and had one of the nicest and most interesting dining experience in a while.  The food was absolutely wonderful. 
Nick, the bartender that night, was just delightful and extremely helpful with both drink and dining suggestions(we decided to sit at the bar).  With Nick's expert advice we ended up with a selection of the house specialities  which have to be some of the finest sushi in SF.  The wine list offers a variety of both premium Napa and global wines like the delicious Argentine Chardonnay.
I would highly recommend this place. Altogether a fun evening, great spot, excellent staff.
author: Tim H.

description:
I love this place. Not for it's large crowds of drunky eyed marina regulars but the for the freshest fish I've eaten in SF. 

The white tuna is amazing. I don't know how they can afford to cut such large pieces of fish and still stay in business. Something works because they have been around for more than 10years. What?

The salmon is buttery and tangy, the walu is rich and cold, the O toro is marbled deelish, the uni is nutty, the halibut is firm and delicate. 

Buy the chefs a Sapporo and see what happens...a reciprocal delight the likes of which you have never before experienced will appear on your table. 

The kitchen has been rockin lately as well. I love the miso black cod and green beens. OH yeah.

It's just a good restaurant. 

I'm not sure how Naked Fish gets business other than from the people who can't wait for a table at Ace having no place to go.
author: Johnny H.

description:
There's no real need to read any of the reviews listed below.  There's a quick way to experience this atrocity.  Go to their website; it's actually quite an accurate metaphor for the restaurant itself.  Dated, tacky, uninspired, chaotic, and sadly, busted.

If you do decide to go, please don't forget to take a peek at the live webcam beforehand (you wouldn't want to show up with the same color cami or anything).

(P.S. I feel it's pointless to review the quality of the food since the prices are artificially inflated to incorporate aforementioned ambience)
author: Tones P.

description:
I have been going to Ace Wasabi for about eight years now. It is my favorite sushi place in SF.
The sushi quality is above standard. Always so deliciously fresh and tasty! Soooooo good!
I really like the waiters, the host, and the sushi chefs because they don't have a chip on their shoulder, but  a  friendly smile.
author: Angel L.

description:
Ah ace.. when exactly did our love affair start? I think it might have been almost 2 years ago now.

The first time I came in, you sucked me in with your ceared tuna and spicy woked beans. They are like crack to my tastebuds. I dream of days where i can eat nothing but these two dishes (and the philly rolls of course another staple). 

However over the past few months you and I have not seen each other.  I know that you think that I have been cheating on you with other sushi places, and to be honest, you have right to feel that way because I have been unfaithful.

This is for a few good reasons:

1. you are in the marina, parking is scarce. And i dont feel like driving around looking for parking for 45 minutes before i haveto wait another 45 mintues to be seated. 

2. you are in the marina. I liked going to the marina when i was 21, 22, heck even 23. Now i am over the drunk 21year old girls all wearing essentially the same outfit and  the boys who only seem to have striped shirts in their wardrobe.

3. the hottest bar boy ever stopped working there (although i heard a rumor that he is back).

But my dear ace, i shall be back shortly. Through some beans in the wok for me. I am comming home baby!
author: Landon M.

description: Pretty poor, slow service with disappointing rolls. I've never had rolls that actually smell like fish. Would not recommend for the typical sushi-goer.
author: Michael P.

description:
First off, the sushi was mediocre. Also, the edamame was disgusting. I know that isn't really what you should judge a sushi place by, but it was gross. Squishy, almost sweet... ick. What really bothered me... I was here with a group of 10 people, who all got their food 15 minutes before I did. I sat for 15 minutes, all the while trying to convince my friends to go ahead and eat! Apparently they split the orders from one table and give them to different chefs. Really? Who thought that was a good idea? Once my sushi finally came, all of my friends were done. I was embarrassed that everyone had to sit there while I finished, and they had to watch me eat, which was weird...

And after all that, a few minutes after I left I got a stomach ache. 

The one redeeming factor is that they were able to accommodate 10 people quickly without a reservation (although my friend made a reservation about a week ago, but when I got there early and told the hostess I was there with a party with a reservation, she informed me they don't take reservations... what?)

Eat somewhere else.
author: Kathryn A.

description: I wanted to add a special shout out to the staff at Ace - especially Mike.  We go here somewhat often because we love the food and the people.  The staff is great and Mike is one of the most personable and best waiters I have ever experienced.
author: Arica V.

description:
Worst dining experience I've had in a long time. Things started out OK but quickly went downhill. 

We did start with the garden tofu salad with candied pecans and oranges with a nice miso dressing which was great. And it's hard to go wrong with seaweed salad, so they did fine on that count too.

The food took forever to come, especially the most simple dishes. How hard is it to make vegetarian nigiri? Apparently almost 40 minutes is required to put some avocado on some rice. The fish didn't taste fresh at all and I lost my appetite part way through the meal. However, the BF did love the Garden handroll with tempura asparagus, garlic eggplant and avocado.

The server was pleasant but we had to flag her down every time we needed refills or wanted to order something. She didn't seem to notice whenever our plates were empty or that we were waiting forever for our food.

The worst part of the evening though was a large party of belligerent 20-somethings who came straight from the Beer Festival and had been drinking all day. They were literally screaming, throwing food at their table, knocking bottles over and making a very unpleasant dining experience for the rest of us. It's one thing when a baby screams in a restaurant and the parents are trying to control their child who can't be consoled. It's another when you're a 20-something and acting like a teething toddler.

I know this is already a loud restaurant and I'm not complaining about the music or normal conversations that most patrons were having - but this table was making it impossible for anyone else to talk. All heads in the room would stop and turn their heads to look at the obnoxious table and the management didn't seem phased by their inappropriate behavior until about an hour and a half into the debauchery.

A highly disappointing meal and I will not be coming back again.
author: Cher E.

description: The sushi was surprisingly delicious...  The U2 roll is awesome!  For a place as popular as it seems to be, I was surprised how short the wait was - only 15 minutes at the prime eating time.  As expected, the place was loud and crowded - definitely not a place for a date but great for a group of friends.
author: Wendy L.

description: I have been LOVING this place for more than 10 years.  The sushi never disappoints.  Yes, it can get crowded (and noisy) and, I hear, the youngish crowd can sometimes be annoying or obnoxious.  But don't let that steer you away!  This is not authentic sushi by any means, but the food is incredible.  Seriously.  Melt-in-your-mouth incredible.  It's more like designer sushi -- but at a reasonable price.  If you're feeling adventurous, sit at the sushi bar, buy the chef whatever he's drinking, and allow him to create a personalized experience for you.  Despite my deep-felt affection for this place, I am withholding that last star for lacking service that matches the tastiness of the food.  Almost perfect...almost.
author: Jason C.

description:
*** 3 1/2***
It's close to closing time and we didn't want to go home JUST YET cuz we were hungry from all the damage we had done to our livers that day and night...the starvation came from all the energy our bodies were expending just to pass the toxins through out body..ANYWAY...as I was saying came here and instead of denying us like Mamacita's did, we were very nicely accommodated to a table and our waitress was very friendly despite the fact that we held her back from going home...food was good, quite impressed considering that we were the last people to order and the sushi was yummy...so thank you Ace Wasabi's for allowing our bodies to recover from our purposeful intoxication and for feeding us so close to your closing time...we will come back!!
author: Karen B.

description:
Of all the amazing sushi places in the city, we had to land at a non-traditional place. I guess I should have known by the 'Rock N Roll' reference in the name. 

Our friends suggested it, so we met them there and were greeted with LOUD music being pumped throughout the restaurant. There is a bar in the front part of the place manned by a frat boy looking guy slinging sake and beer. 

There are tons of rolls on the menu; all of them seemed to be drenched with all of that mayonnaise sauce stuff that I dislike. 

It was so loud where we were seated that we had to yell at our friends across the table. Not a relaxing experience!

One thing going for this place is that the prices are inexpensive. I would have been upset to pay a lot of money for mediocre sushi. 

On our way out we passed by the sushi bar and my husband pointed out that all of the chefs were speaking Chinese. 

Another sushi place run by Chinese! That's the second place for us in less than a month. I wonder if this is a trend?
author: Lee H.

description:
While I love this place, the sushi is not out of this world amazing, but the whole atmosphere makes it perfect for those nights when you want something fun, but don't want to deal with lines or covers

The Scene
Typical Marina restaurant, full of college, recent grads and party goers getting ready for a big night out.....sake bombs here I come.I love that they have sushi bingo.....really,anytime I can combine games and free sushi...wow! The place is loud, high energy,  and trendy....and yes, it feels like everyone knows each other here, I like it.

The Food
It's a sushi bar...... it is all very good....I always get
kani
unagi
sake
uni
crunchy ace wasabi roll
flying kamikaze roll
spider roll
warm crispy soft shell crab salad
author: Bianca L.

description: unreal happy hour.  $7 gets you a pint of beer (including Anchor Steam amongst others), a shot of sake, and a large hand roll Sushi.  Are you kiddin' me!?  Menu is fantastic.  Tiger roll is 5 star and the tamake is 6 stars.  garlic/chili edamame is awesome, and only $3 during happy hour, too!  Really nice staff and owner, Ken, who is always there to greet you, even before he knows your name.  What's not to like?!
author: Ken H.

description:
...another memorable joint for me.  My - now hubby - but back then boyfriend and I would frequent this place often.  He lived close by and it was our "go to" spot for sushi.  

This is the only sushi place where the boy has truly LOVED their spider rolls --- they are OUT OF THIS WORLD at Ace Wasabi.

Love the atmosphere... it is a fun place to meet up with friends and enjoy decent quality sushi.

It certainly isn't "the BEST" but it hits the spot.
author: Sheila D.

description:
Let's get this straight--the sushi here is decent. However...

I like to stay away from crowds like this. If there had not been incredible people with me and an actual sushi bar, I would have put down my foot and insisted that we leave. A sushi place does not seat only 6 at a sushi bar. A sushi place does not promote its bar over its sushi. A sushi bar should not have slightly dried out rice. 

Now that we have established that this place is simply a bar with an Asian fetish, I'll admit that this place does have decent sashimi. The himachi & saba were fresh. The spider roll & kamikaze roll were equally tasty (minus the slightly dried out rice). I'm sure the price is not as tasty, but we had a coupon that made it good.

But what makes this place memorable, is how the sushi taisho tried to set me up with his fellow, younger co-worker. This scored me a free spicy tuna roll--yum.
author: Wendy L.

description:
I've been here twice and if someone asked me about the place I'd give them the kind of grimace I make when I'm sitting on the toilet "thinking" very hard.  Ace Wasabi is located in the Marina so you get what tries to be a trendy restaurant with loud annoying music (we got Golden Girls and disco) with sub-par food.  This is not the place to go if you are really looking for great sushi.  The rolls are okay but nothing to write home about.  In fact I'm not really sure why people hit this place up unless it's that word that I'm looking for .... yes pseudo trendy.

Although the prices were above average this is not the first place I think about when I'm down in the area.  You'll see your "Oh My God!!" girls who think it's so chic to eat Japanese food.  Somehow I don't think actual Japanese would approve.  

Now that I've been writing this review, I think I need to go somewhere and "think" very hard.  Brandon that works there is one cool dude though.
author: Bill P.

description: Awesome! Thanks Groupon for the $55 worth of sushi for $25,  thought they would give me a limited menu or crappy service but no, full service, full menu, great sushi! I'll be back :)
author: Lisa L.

description:
This is a great place to take an out of town visitor for great food and fun atmosphere.

Extremeley fresh, relatively inventive rolls. Of course the more creative the roll, the higher the price, but there are plenty of affordable options on the menu that are just as delicious.

Cucumber salad is an absolute MUST, a favorite dish of mine at any Japenese restaurant, Ace Wasabi's take on this dish is absolute perfection! Cruncy, sweet, and tangy all at once. I daydream about this, and its only an appetizer.

Philly roll (I know, I know) is one of my favorites along with the Halibut tempura. (MM--The batter is sweet and flaky, and the fish is light and tender. YUM!)

Great spot for a fun date as well. Service isn't always top of the line, but to me it's all about the food food food!
author: Sara D.

description:
Decent sushi in a extremely loud, crowded, bar atmosphere.  There is regular table seating at the rear of the restaurant which is a little quieter but not by much.  If you do not want to wait long to be seated, try to get here before 6 pm.

3 stars is for the sushi and not the overall experience.
author: Steve D.

description:
Worst. Sushi. EVER. Folks, seriously, you go HERE for sushi? Either you're going to pick up somebody, or you have absolutely no taste in sushi... or both (most likely). Ugh. Ugh. Ugh.

Packed. Loud. Lousy sushi. You still seriously considering it? Well good for you, because there are a lot of other people who have just as bad taste in sushi as you do. :(
author: Gregg G.

description:
I craved sushi, so I called up my hot Israeli model friend Anat and she had me meet her at Ace Wasabi's. We sat at the bar and talked to the chef while gossiping and drinking cold unfiltered sake. The rolls were exquisite, and I had butterfish nigiri that knocked my socks off. 

Even if you don't live the life of an international male model like me, you'll like this sushi place.  I recommend more than two people though, and make sure you're prepared to drop a hundred dollars on sushi if you are a pig like me.
author: Darren M.

description: Thought I would update and reiterate how delicious the garlic edamame is. It is super spicy though, so be careful if you can't take the heat.  It comes doused with that hot Thai chili garlic sauce. Yum. Came here last night with a g/f and I basically ate the entire plate. Service is good and the sushi is always super fresh!
author: Jenny W.

description:
I won't be going back there-- be warned if you make a reservation for a large group, it doesn't mean you'll actually get seated on time.  Made a reservation for 10 more than 2 weeks prior, but they were overbooked (what is this, an airline?) and we waited an hour.  The owner was less than helpful, and actually quite rude.  

Food is ok, there is much better sushi in this town.  My advice, skip this place!
author: Emily C.

description: If you're looking for a REALLY GOOD & good quality happy hour menu, Ace Wasabi's has it. For only $8 you get a maki roll with 2 drinks. The rolls by themselves are only $5. You also have a great variety to choose from with drinks and rolls so this happy hour isn't that "so-so, it's alright" typical happy hour food. We ordered the spicy garlic edamame for starters and once again, I found myself licking my fingers and the chopsticks when we devoured all the actual edamame. The rolls we ordered were the jalapeno tuna, new york and the beastie bacon. MMMmmmmm! All of them were so tasty! A typical sushi menu includes the contents of each roll and sometimes you can't taste some of the things listed. We were able to taste every single thing in those rolls. We also ordered the kani cakes with crab and those were delicious, also. Ace Wasabi's is a really cool place and they play mostly Rock & Roll. They have awesome decor in the place and it's not expensive.
author: Trina C.

description: Fresh fish and close to my house - can't ask for more. Although some people recommend Mas Sake, I prefer Ace Wasabi because it isn't so loud and is more laid back.
author: Emily K.

description:
I ate there 2/27/05, a Sunday night, with 2 friends. I'm giving it a 4 star review because there was nothing really wrong with the place (tho service could have been better for the money and for the lack of people in the restaurant as we ate right after opening time). 

We had 2 orders of edamame, spicy hamachi tartare with shrimp chips, chinese wok tossed green beans (not very Japanese, but tasty none the less), hot appetizer of scallops cooked with mushrooms and onion in a creamy-yummy sauce, two orders each of hamachi and tuna sashimi with bowls of rice, two orders of unagi sushi (cooked eel), two orders of kabocha squash tempura (4 pieces), and a fancy roll of some sort. Not to mention some nigori sake (unfiltered and served cold - the best to my taste). The bill was about $150 with tip! Yikes! Eat a burger before you go and save some dough.

Everything was good and fresh, just not the best value for the money unless you like paying for trendy, loud, generally crowded places in the Marina.
author: Dana B.

description:
One of the best sushi places in SF!  Fun atmosphere...
The Ace Wasabi role is definitely a great roll to get... hope you like Macademia Nuts!
author: Jennie L.

description:
This place was excellent.  My first time there before heading out to Ruby Skye.  

The sake was great, and we sat right next to the bartender and he was awesome!  Really nice and always asking what else he could do for us.  Only con was the small waiting area.  You are going to need to wait outside on busy nights.  

I had the Teriyaki sushi roll and it was AMAZING!
author: John R.

description:
Any place that has great sake typically will make me happy.
The sake bombs are one of the main reasons I come here. I am not generally one for the bar scene, but they have some awesome sake. On top of that, I really haven't had bad sushi/rolls here. I've had some average food, but it has always been very edible.

A tip? Sit at the sushi bar if you want the best service and the best food. They haven't screwed up anything and they've introduced me to new things that are very good. 

It is trendy so it is more crowded than other places so if you hate that kind of thing, avoid it on the weekends for sure. It definitely isn't your place if you can't stand the Marina b/c this is a stereotypical hangout for many Marina dwellers, but I don't really care either way. 

I really think it's more like 3.5 stars, but I was generous.
author: Anita B.

description:
This place is hilarious.  

For the longest time, a group of us would be in the area.. and see that this place was PACKED!!!

So finally one day we made a point of actully eating there.... and for college students.. that's a bit of sacrifice(look it up in economic terms).

I remember there being some rather odd rolls, but overall, the food was good, I ended up buying a couple t-shirts(I think I still have them and they are all holy) but it's a pretty cool/trendy place to go to.

Parking was kinda tough, and the place isn't real big, so just go with that in mind.
author: Eric K.

description:
My husband and I had our first couple dates at Ace.  He was a proud regular at the restaurant and knew the head sushi chef and owner.  When I was introduced to the sushi chef David. David was really nice kept hinting that my James (my date) should marry me. Ha we did (three years later.)  Thanks David!

The sushi is really tasty and generous portions.  I love the "three amigos" roll, tuna tataki, and hamachi kama.  With the sushi we order hot sake and beer.  We are always satisfied and happy eating there.  Just try to get there before 7pm to prevent the big crowd.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
i enjoyed myself and the sushi was decent - but the atmosphere lost this place some stars.  I could barely hear my dinner company over the bumping music.

I'd go back for a drink maybe or some sushi with people i didn't want to have decent conversation with...but that's about it
author: Lauren V.

description:
Fantastic food, service and atmosphere. Specifically three things stand out from my night at Ace Wasabi's.Two pros and one con. 

Con: the jalepeno on the Ozzy roll is hotter than anything I have ever put in my mouth. If the menu says a roll includes jalepenos, it is a lie. It is a green habenero x10.

Pro: The tataki appetizer is outstanding - the fish melts in your mouth like butter. 

Pro: "Don't Stop Believin" came on around 10pm and the entire back room started singing just like Steve Perry. Are you shitting me?! That rocks!
author: Kate S.

description:
Ace Wasabi's is fantastic. Every trip I make to the bay area includes a stop there. I introduced 3 friends to their sushi a few nights ago and they all said it was the best they'd ever had!!

Among the favorites: Albacore Tataki, Three Amigos roll, Ozzy roll, and of course, the Kamakazi roll!  Just mentioning those names is making me already yearn for my next visit!!!
author: Trace S.

description:
What do you say about Ace? It's been around forever and more of a scene than a great sushi place. But I gotta say, that the food is actually pretty decent and consistent.

Style-wise, the place is pretty crowded and loud.

And, oh yeah, one important note. One night the refrigeration went out on them - we all got food poisoning there. ouch.
author: Lucky L.

description:
This place was very busy on a friday night.  Service was slow based on how packed it was.  We were initially very frustrated as we watched 3 other couples receive their orders before we did when we had ordered first.  
This sour turn was quickly remedied by great service from Kyle at the bar.  He made sure everything was as it should be in the end and we left satisfied and vowing to return. 

The  Seared Albacore Tuna was the tops!  Great specialty rolls.  Try the lobster, mango roll.  The spicy tuna with jalapeno was a very welcome variation on the classic.
author: Scott F.

description: Tasha is awesome!!! She made our eating and drinking experience the more meerier. Really sweet and made sure we were liquored up. We had a groupon deal so decided to check this place out. I'm glad we did because we had a blast. Pretty good sushi and the buy one get one free sake bombs!
author: Lisa Z.

description:
Ace Wasabi's Sushi Kicked Asses!

This is a cool restuarant with excellent sushi.  
Highly recommend the tartaki tuna for 12 bucks, very tasty sauce with good portion of tuna.  Yummy!
We tried a couple of rolls, all very fresh and tasty!
Sat at the sushi bar and turned out to be the best.  Very interactive sushi chef with food delivered to us really fresh (coz we were right there in front of the chef).
LOVE THIS PLACE
author: Edmond T.

description:
On a Friday night in late September when the weather is perfect, this place was slammed, with people spilling out of the doors waiting for a table. The bar was crowded and all the tables where full of fashionable 20 and 30-somethings out for the night.
