Ace Wasabi's Rock 'N' Roll Sushi is in the Marina district, off of Chestnut street (the main shopping street).

I went with a group of ten, and were seated right way because of the size of the group. It was loud, boisterous, and very fun. The sushi was amazing and the service, even though it was crowed, was great. We sat for a very long time and where never pressured to leave, our waiter was very friendly and helpful with the specials. I had a mango lobster roll that was to die for, and a tofu salad that blew my mind. For 10 fairly hungary collage students our bill was $178 including tip (but we didn't get any alcohol).
author: Tre B.

description:
This place is absolutely worth going to, the prices are extremely reasonable and the food was delicious! The sashimi comes tender, sweet and plentiful.  The special rolls are delicious and spicy!! Delish! Service was quick, efficient and friendly..they brought the food out in the perfect amount of time between courses and the drinks were brought out immediately.  

Bingo at 6:30 was definitely fun! i'd definitely go back and try more rolls =)
author: Lulu C.

description:
Ace Wasabi Restored to Excellence!

Thank you Ken Lowe! Thank you Akiyo! Thank you Marisa! Thank you to all the Chefs! Thank you to all the Bus Boys and Dish Washers!

I'm here today to tell you my faith has been restored. I can honestly say without any reservation that Ace is back on top of it's game. And yes, I do believe we here at IrascibleChef had something to do with it...

Of course Ken Lowe's response to his loyal customers comments ultimately deservedly gets the credit and thanks! The last time I was back, a short while ago, I proclaimed that Ace was back, but this past visit pushes it over the top!

The latest addition to Ace's dining room--Akiyo our lovely host and manager visibly present and actively participating in our fantabulous dining experience.

We did have to wait to be seated (but it was welcomed.) Great, there's a favorite place around the corner to get a drink. We were back within the time limit, but we did have an additional 35 minute wait. No big deal--Asahi and Saki does the soul good.

When we were seated we followed the hostess to the back area and this nicely dressed woman apologized for our wait. (I thought that was interesting--very interesting!) I asked the hostess if that was a manager (A visible floor manager was something I highly recommended and had previously been painfully absent.) I was delighted to hear that it was in fact a manager. (I was asked if I would like to speak with her. I said no, knowing I would before the end of the evening.)

We had many of the past favorites including the Albacore Tataki (which is still the best ANYWHERE,) Tuna and Salmon Tartare Old Style on deep fried Shinto leaves (not on the menu any more--just ask for it Old Style. This time the ingredient I don't care for was isolated--dill and I think a little lemon that starts to chemically cook the tartare.)

On the rolls side of things we had the Kamikaze--spicy tuna & asparagus wrapped w/ albacore tuna topped w/ ponzu & scallions, which is always a treat, Spider Could be claimed to be the best Spider roll any where, and the newest addition to the USUAL the Ozzy--oh my, it's soooo goood! The Ozzy is crab draped on top spicy tuna, topped with sliced fresh Jalapenos that give the flavor without too much heat--simply scrumptious!

On the Nigiri side of things--Salmon sushi is my favorite and always a must order--it was fresh and delicious and Hamachi Toro, which I've been getting into lately, was as my brother said, "that was the best bite!"

--All was washed down with Asahi and Saki as if there were any doubts...

We were served quickly with a smile by a helpful, knowledgeable server Marisa who did graciously join us for sip of Saki.

As we were leaving I stopped to thank Akiyo, whom didn't have business cards yet, gave me some chopsticks with her name and my favorite restaurant in SF it's restoration to excellence. Ken Lowe--great decision, great hire! Thank you!

For the complete review and commentary visit: http://www.irasciblechef.com/ace-wasabi-restored-to-excellence/
author: Irascible C.

description: I've been several times - we try something new each time and are not dissappointed.
author: Joyful Jenny H.

description:
Background: I got a groupon here (such a fab deal) and unfortunately during my move I lost it.  I called and talked to the owner (Ken) and he was nice enough to let me come in and still use the discount. AWESOME.

Location: The ambiance of this place is interesting... it's mostly tall tables and barstools w/o backs which is probably easier for guys vs. girls with large handbags and jackets.  Parking was easy late in the evening (around 9 PM).

Service: The service was great- our server was nice and provided great recommendations.

Quality: The food itself- it's good, but not enough of a variety.  that's where they loose the star.  Also, the rice around the sushi rolls was a bit mooshy for my taste.  Fish itself is pretty fresh.  I really liked the hamachi roll and the mango lobster (different and sweet so prepare).

Overall 4 stars- good quality, reasonable prices, but not the best sushi in the city.
author: Nushie N.

description:
I don't care if it IS in the Marina- it's really fun to go here! I love the atmosphere, loud and rockin'. Also the firecracker scallops appetizer is the BOMB! I could eat like 4 of those!

I love the salmon roll that has tempura sweet potato and a lemon slice on it- yum!
author: Diane S.

description:
A friend was visiting from out of town and wanted to go to
the marina area - so I put on my best stripped shirt...

Blah. This place was cooler in 2001.  Or maybe I was a 
lot younger and drank much less back then?

Food was OK, service was slow, if you are in your early
20's and want a California roll and hot sake to go along
with your fashion show, then head on down to Ace Wasabi's.
author: Mike R.

description:
Oooh the sushi here is sooo good. I've heard about this place for years and was happy to finally experience it for myself. You really should stop in for Saki and sushi, it is a fun crowd -- a true SF place to be. 
Things to try:
Unfiltered Saki
Tuna and Salmon Tartare W/ guacamole and shrimp chips
Tuna Mango Pok W/ avocado, sweet/ spicy vinaigrette & slivered almonds -- so yummy! 
U2 Roll tempura shrimp wrapped w/spicy tuna, avocado & tobiko -- this was ok I don't really like tempura 
Philly Roll Smoked salmon & cream cheese
Three Amigos Roll tuna, yellowtail, eel, cucumber & avocado topped w/ wasabi tabiko
My mouth is watering just thinking about all the good sushi I ate.
author: Kimberly C.

description:
Good sushi, good sake, good times. 

My friends and I have been coming here for a few years & keep coming back.I think some of the more disgruntled reviewers below were looking for something a little different. 

Let's clear the air. Ace Wasabi is not a quaint, hole-in-the-wall secret sushi haven. It's high energy, fun, and a rad pre-game to City nightlife. I'm a little confused as to those who were shocked to find that Ace was loud & trendy. Dude, welcome to the Marina. I am all for those authentic Japanese haunts that leave you dreaming about rainbow rolls for DAYS but Ace Wasabi is not your private geisha house.

Ace is good for what it is: inexpensive & delicious sushi, drinks & a young crowd that's DTP - Down To Party, so don't rock the boat!
author: Kitty C.

description: We started off with the chili garlic sauteed edamame which was very good!  We ordered the hamachi lime roll, rainbow roll, california roll and one of their special rolls for the day.  What was very good is that they do not use imitation crab!  The fish was very fresh and the service was very good.  Our check was a little on the high side because we ordered quite a bit of alcohol...  Overall, it was a great experience and if i am ever in San Francisco again i will be there for sure!
author: Ryan T.

description: I come here almost every time I'm in town. kinda discovered it by accident 10 years ago, but I'm glad I did. my family comes here all the time when they are in town as well.
author: Jon F.

description:
buy one round cider smoke bomb, get one round free? yes pls!! 

My gf and I are definitely fans of ace wasabi! happy hour is always fun and they have bingo at 6 ( or is it 6:30?) where the winner gets a gift certificate to ace. We almost won a few times, but always got beat to it! 

no matter what else we order, we always get the crunchy ace roll and the crunchy sake roll. both are very different rolls that you cant find anywhere else. the crunchy ace roll has macadamia nuts that give it a different texture. the crunchy sake roll is fried potato bits with salmon and lemon on top...very different and very scrumptious. my gf had the eggplant and avocado handroll and said it was just mediocre. the toro and blue crab handroll were both delicious. our server was also very attentive. another waitress had came out  with our dishes and didn't know what we ordered so our waiter came out to describe each roll. 

we'll be back!

*nom nom*
author: Steve H.

description: went here tonight, sunday, w/friends after work. We loved it!! we got sat right away and our server was super friendly and attentive. We all had beers; sapporos and one small sake. The garlic chili edamame were soo yummy, seaweed salad refreshing, and our rolls were delightful. overall a pleasant experience. Too bad they don't carry green tea ice cream :)
author: Erica Z.

description:
Two words: 
Scorpion Roll

...get that and the tuna tataki with a Sapporo, and you're set.  The crowd's another story. Try getting a table in the back room or even at the sushi bar, but be prepared for a s-c-e-n-e. Nobody comes here without putting some thought into their look. Thursday nights are especially bad (or good depending on your perspective). Any night though, the food's real good.
author: sarah s.

description:
It was crowded and hot inside the restaurant on Saturday night.  We felt a little like we had stepped into a sauna.

However, once we acclimated, we downed our sushi with relish.

Highlights:  
Lobster Mango roll -- fresh and unexpected.  
Godzilla roll -- strawberry?  Weird!  Dare you!  FINE!  MMmm. . . not bad.
Spider Roll -- crispy and fresh, always a classic
Cod in miso sauce -- like butta

In conclusion -- 
food = yum!
atmosphere = stifling!

Hence 3 instead of 4 stars.
author: Rebecca S.

description: Simple the most fun you can have with friends and eating sushi.  The staff are great regardless of busy and the fish and cider bombs are always fresh and tasty.
author: Hubert B.

description: The new "Tasting Menu" is amazing! Tons of food, and all of their signature dishes. The sushi is great, and the service was excellent. I have already told 2 people what a fun night! Make sure to hit the Happy Hour. Thanks Ace.
author: Nicholas H.

description: This place has different sushi dishes, like the sushi nachos, yumm... the girls are really nice and great service! Good happy hour with a good atmosphere!
author: nancy v.

description: this place didnt have the most amazing sushi I have ever had but it def wasnt bad.  The sushi chefs were really nice and they gave us (and everyother girl ahah) a free roll called the victoria secret.  The food wasnt too expensive and we ordered a large sake, a spicy tuna roll, a samon sushi, a specialty roll with yellowtail, and I think maybe one other thing that I cant remember and it came out to like $50.  I wouldnt choose this as the first spot to go to but if someone wanted to go there I wouldnt be opposed.
author: Alexis R.

description: went here the other night with friends who love sushi and wanted to eat, though I don't and accompanied them and watched them eat. yeaaaa....  I didn't eat sushi but they had tasteLESS fried Calamari that was fresh, hot but not even supplied sauce and salt could out flavor into it. Friends finally walked out not happy as they thought the sushi they ordered was yeck, plus when another item was ordered, after 20 mins and no delivery, they gave up and we departed. The staff was very friendly greeting us upon entrance and exit, but such slow service. The place was crowded front and back though, but still...  20mins for an additional item to be served is quite long. The miso soup was tasty...  :-)
author: Tony L.

description: Their sushi is so cheap compared to all the other places!  It's really good.  They have a lot of different rolls to choose from.  The place it bigger than it looks.  A little loud, but that's okay.  Can't find parking anywhere, but in a good location to hit a bar up afterward.  Wish we had places this cheap back home!
author: Reanna R.

description:
I've been in SF for almost 5 years, and can't believe I'm just now getting around to going here.  

I went on Friday, and shockingly, walked right in at 7:30. The atmosphere was fun as a pre-going out dinner, but could be annoying if you're trying to have a real conversation with someone.  

The sushi was good, not spectacular. The tuna tataki app was great, I would highly recommend. Everyone that worked there was super nice, although I did go with someone that goes there often.
author: Julie E.

description: Great service... from our waiter! He was very attentive and understanding, where as it seemed some of the other gals working there had more of an attitude. The sushi is very good, the atmosphere is fun -it's definitely really loud so I would recommend it as a stop before a night out.
author: Rada I.

description: Stopped by for a much-needed stomach-filler after some heavy 4th of July celebrating and were happily greeted with delicious -- though not mind-blowing -- sushi. We sat at the bar and chatted with the charming server, who served us some awesome malt Japanese beer (not that we needed it...) and some other snazzy drinks I can't recall. Can't say it's particularly original, but it's a great modern spot and a nice break from the general Californian gastropub theme in the Marina.
author: G. J.

description: This place is perfect if you are looking for a fun atmosphere and like hanging out with the Marina-types.  The service is efficient and friendly, but the sushi is not anything above ordinary.  The best dish is their signature albacore tataki, where the fish is like butter.  I recommend going here for a lively atmosphere and good service.
author: Carolyn D.

description: I wanted this place to be good.  Friendly staff, BINGO, and a good vibe.  The sushi was, in a word, disgusting.  FIrst, it smelled really fishy.  I know sushi is fish, but it doesn't typically smell like a wharf.  The spicy tuna roll was awful.  Horrible flavor and stuffed with lettuce.  Lettuce!  Again, our server couldn't have been nicer, and it has the makings of a great place... minus the sushi.  I won't be going back.
author: Josh G.

description:
First off, I have to give it five friggin stars.

For a first timer to go there, it was really good. A nice friendly environment with almost an almost club feeling. They have two separate rooms, one seems to be more of a "party, let's drink and eat!" room and the other is quieter. We got the quiet room, haha.

So what we ordered were:
Crunchy Ace Wasabi Roll
Spicy Jalapeno Tuna Roll
New York Roll 
Crunchy Fried Calamari & Rock Shrimp 
Sashimi Deluxe

Everythin was good. No, not good... great! Except for the small plates which were the Crunchy Fried Calamari & Rock Shrimp. The fish tasted fresh and not fishy and the sushi was made very well. I was quite satisfied. The price wasn't that bad either. 

I think it's a great place if you're a sushi lover who wants to have some fun. Everyone's friendly there, so try it out!
author: Joseph V.

description: This place is so fun. I am a sushi addict, and their sushi is delish!!! Loved the vibe and liveliness of the restaurant. Sat right behind the bar, the sushi chefs were super funny and nice. Everything was delicious. Sake-bombed here also. Great fun! Perfect place to get some food before heading out with friends! It does get crowded, but I was there on a weekend night, so I'm guessing week nights are more mellow and good for a date night, but not sure...
author: Chrissy A.

description: came here for dinner one day and it was a-ok. They don't have a huge variety of special rolls but lots of sashimi type rolls and I like that. None of your regular bento box specials if you are like that type of set dinners. Besides the rolls we tried the teriyaki chicken skewers and that was not good, chicken was dry so stick with the sushi. I'd come back but make reservation cuz it does get pretty crowed. I called at 6:30 to make a 7:00 reservation with no problem =)
author: meL Z.

description: Accomodating and friendly staff, the most fresh and delicious sushi around, and a wonderful atmosphere to dine in.
author: Carly D.

description: I love sushi and have always wanted to try this place so I went in and had dinner at the bar. The hostess was nice, the bartender was cool and filled our sake to the brim, but the food was just okay. When we finished, my bf was still a bit hungry and asked to order another roll. The manager came over and said the kitchen/sushi bar was trying to close. I've worked in food service and I know it was a Sunday night, but it wasn't THAT late and there were still LOTS of other patrons in the restaurant. It's not like making one more roll was really going to up his labor cost for the night.  The bartender was super apologetic (because even he thought the manager was being ridiculous) which I appreciated. Honestly though, I was pretty disappointed with this place. There are much better sushi joints in this city. If you're thinking about going here, I'd go to Naked Fish or Mas Sake instead.  They have waaaaayyyyyy better sushi.
author: Nicole W.

description: yummm yummm yumm yumm mmmmmmmm.... I suggest sitting at the Sushi bar. The guys are nice and make for a good time as well as the servers and bartenders. Not to mention the sushi is sooooooo good. Decent price for the quality of fish. I totally recommend the Tiger Roll, Sake nagiri, and spicy tuna. The most fun with quality fish I think I have had in a long time. Saturday night at 8:30 the place was EASY to get into and even though it can be a wait for an earlier time I swear it is worth it. yummy yummy yum yum
author: Kylie L.

description:
I dont know how I am supposed to feel about Ace Wasabi. On one side, the food was VERY good. But on the other, the atmosphere and service were way less than par. 

Positives: We ordered two spicy jalapeno tuna rolls, cajun shrimp roll and chicken teriyaki roll. All were very good. The spicy jalapeno rolls weren't spicy on their own, but the flavor was so strong. You could definitely taste the jalapeno flavor, it just wasnt spicy and overwhelming. Mixed with the wasabi soy sauce and it was super. The chicken teriyaki roll was an experiment we tried. Not bad. Its a nice combination, the sticky rice and teriyaki chicken. The meat was a bit dry but what more can be expected of chicken pieces that probably sit in the cold sushi bar all day. Whatever the case, all were delicious. 

Negatives: Out 4 rolls came out on a plate with no ginger or wasabi. At a place called Ace WASABI, how do you forget the most important part of a sushi dish? Since our waiter was MIA, we waited with our food in front of us for almost 10 minutes. They bring you a water glass then expect to use a bottle of water that is already on the table for refills. Unfortunately, the bottles sit on the table, not being refilled. We looked around to other empty tables to find their bottles half full. 

Other than that, the atmosphere was just awful. The music was really loud and awful. Luckily we sat in the back where it was a little more quiet. Nevertheless, the back room looked like a pizza parlor complete with red, yellow and green decor and red brick walls! Our waiter came to our table twice duirng our whole time there. We had to get our wasabi and ginger because he was missing. And when he did come over, he was super loud and VERY obnoxious. 

I dunno. Up in the air about Ace Wasabi. The food was really good and defnitely warrants a second trip, but man if I have to see that awful server or drink out of that pitcher I might lose it...
author: Sarah I.

description: Draft beer, fresh fish, and good service. These are the components of a good sushi bar and Ace got it right! I was very surprised by the quality of the food. From the outside, it looked like a dump. The smell of fried food from the pub next door made me sick while waiting for a table at Ace. The decor inside the restaurant was crappy. It reminded me of a college hangout and the crowd was a bit "frat-tastic". My friend and I waited about 20 minutes for a table on Saturday night (although it took us 20 minutes to find parking in the Marina district). We were seated at the sushi bar overlooking the kitchen. They had Kirin on tap, which made me happy. I ordered a sampling of nigri: butterfish, yellowtail toro, albacore toro, salmon and the house special kamikaze spicy tuna roll. It was all very good and fresh. Best of all, it was rather inexpensive.
author: Koko M.

description: I have gone to many sushi places in SF and northbay. Ace is the best! Best for food (fresh and different), atmosphere and service. The owner is nuts and usually drunk wearing his golf clothes, but a super cool and funny guy. He really takes good care of his staff and cares about his customers. The waiters are always very nice and care about there people. Sushi cafes can make whatever you like and always try to give you something different. I can't think of a time were I didn't feel taken care of or didn't have a good time at Ace. The owner has really done a great job of bring the best out in a restaurant.
author: Kj D.

description:
Ace rather throw rocks than dine at your sushi!  
We discovered this disaster via groupon and reserved a table to dine before we hit the comedy club.  We waited 40 minutes past our reservation time to be told by the host (that we finally tracked down after waiting another 15 min) that they did not know how much longer we would have to wait, "probably a half hour or 40min"... which would of course mean that we wouldn't make the show.  I can't remember the last time I was treated so poorly as a patron.  
We wound up getting some cheap Mexican food down the street which was palatable and came with free entertainment: two drunk chicks starting a fight in the middle of the place.   Least we laughed it all out at Punchline before retiring for the night.
author: Berkeley E.

description: Usually, really good sushi places are hard to find and the popular spots tend to have their business rely on the spot as a hangout as opposed to the actual quality of the sushi. That's not how it is with Ace though. It's a fun place with a great atmosphere, but their sushi really is quality too. I love their three amigos roll and their rainbow roll. Also, the Red Cross roll, which is a special, is awesome. Plus, they donate $1 or something to the Red Cross for each one ... that way you can feel extra good about eating it.  The staff is awesome and Ken, the owner, is a really cool guy.
author: Alex F.

description:
sushi sucks.  fish was not fresh, sushi rolls looked way better than it taste.  oysters weren't fresh either.  atmosphere sucks with loud ass music. service is super slow. pretty much a bar with a bunch of loud mouth drunks.  don't be mistaken and come here with a date or your friends thinking your going to be able to get to know each other or catch up on things and have a good meal.  if your looking for a place to get some drinks and some snacks to go with it, this is the place for you.

ehhh...this place is not sushi to die for...
author: Chrissy F.

description: I was a little scared when I first walked into this place because it smelled a little fishy (literally), and that's never a good sign at a sushi restaurant. However, I was financially vested since i had purchased a groupon (p.s. if you don't know what groupon is, check it out at groupon.com  ASAP for great deals), so we proceeded to sit down. The restaurant was clean and the service was great. Overall the sushi was par for the course, but not excellent, and the prices were pretty standard as well. We were pleasantly surprised at then end of the meal when they passed out BINGO cards and the entire restaurant played a game, with the prize being a $20 gift card. Although I didn't win, i thought this was a nice touch. Overall, a good experience.
author: myrtle m.

description:
3.5 stars really.  I wish you could give a half...."sometimes a girl needs a half."

Cute bartender Kyle gave my friends and me free sake.  Yow!  Ok, so this place is super narrow and skinny making it an absolute train wreck to move around, especially if you are waiting for a table on a busy Saturday night.  After a long time, we were finally seated in the back, which was nice because it was a lot less crowded.  Our server was very good giving us suggestions for appetizers and being prompt with drink and food orders.  Friendly and nice staff here for the most part.  I enjoyed all of our food very much and was glad to try some new inventive rolls here.  Try something with jalapeno in it.  I really liked the Ozzy roll and the U2 roll, however, I compare all sushi places to Wasabi and Ginger and this place just isn't as good in terms of food.  But the atmosphere is definitely young and hip.  Actually, so young and hip in fact that in the back of the restaurant where we were enjoying our dinner, we heard "Happy Birthday" sung about 6 different times from about 2 or 3 tables.  It was really loud and the people were being obnoxious, but I guess that's what you get with an immature, young crowd.  Anyway, I also found it interesting that they had a web cam here.  There is an article on the wall and a web cam above it.  I don't see why a sushi place needs one, but whatever, it's cool.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: It's a shame that the service thinks they are on a reality show for the next "Top Model."  The food is pretty good, not the best, and the location is great, but not always worth dealing with the waiters attitudes!  It is true that the bar is ten times too small for same locals that go every night, but it is nice to be near a window.  Overall, I go there sometimes, but know there is better service and food in SF.
author: Lulu B.

description: What is the big effing deal? If you want a 1/2 hour wait for mediocre sushi, then Ace Wasabi is your place. Sure, it's kinda sceney, but whatever. There are a million sceney restaurants in the Marina, and if sushi is your game, Ace Wasabi shouldn't even be on your radar. Ok now I'm bored with this review. And I'm bored with Ace Wasabi. Bye.
author: Kristen D.

description:
every time i start heading to naked fish, this place pulls me right in.  

i don't know why since there is usually a wait and i'm staring at all the people happily munching on their sushi as my stomach rumbles.

as much as i love my usual salmon sashimi, spider rolls or dragon rolls, i would recommend their daily specials.  my friend had their butter fish and it made me melt a little.  hmmm.
author: Anh V.

description: Ok.. I must admit this place annoyed the ?!?! out of me the first time I went, plus the sushi was a bit off, but since then I've been back and they have not let me down.  Place can be pretentious at times but I can not deny the food.. Jury is still out for now.. but I'm leaning toward the right more and more.
author: Tom C.

description:
meh, i like naked fish better - yea free edimame!

Normally when you go to a sushi place the menu is loaded with different simple rolls and sashimi, and then there are some fancy rolls - not here.  The downfall here is that the menu is limited - they have a few simple rolls, a few fancy rolls, a couple sashimi and nigri options, and some other entree options.

What we got did taste good though!

Also, the front of the restaurant is very casual - kind of looks like a fast food place? (think high tables and stools) The back is more like a restaurant with tables and chairs
author: Caitlin B.

description: Yummy happy hour bingo specials: $2 beer and hand rolls-- what a great deal, seriously!  I also ordered a sashimi mixed plate, which was high in quality-- the salmon was like butta'!  A fun place, but if you go during happy hour, you would be wise to sit near the bar for faster service.
author: NaNa M.

description: Who cares if it's in the Marina? Who cares if it's trendy? Who cares if the servers look like supermodels? Is that supposed to be bad? Anyway, it is really good sushi and that makes it worth it. I will not eat here without ordering the Crunchy Sake Roll.  It's very simple, but sooooo good.  The Albacore Tataki is also very good. It is also very fun environment and worth the wait in my opinion....I have good memories of this place :)
author: Angela T.

description: I love this place. Its totally a scene and totally a marina resteraunt but the food is fantastic and very reasonable. The manager is great. We had a bottle of champagne with us that was supposed to be a gift (whoops), and he recognized the vineyard and chilled/opened it for us with no corkage. The tuna/salmon sashimi apetizer is my favorite. It's pretty much my perfect food!
author: Roseanne W.

description: Typically...I hit up Naked Fish if I want sushi in the Marina. They have amazing sushi and really yummy Mochi ice cream - MMM. But back to Ace Wasabi which I thought I should at least try once - it is 1/2 block closer to my home after all, ha. Poor decision. The sushi was so so - nothing to write home about. The Miso soup was WAY too salty. There weren't nearly enough appetizer choices and the service was eh. ALSO - note to anyone who was thinking of coming here on a date. I went on a Tuesday night with a girlfriend of mine. Right when we sat down our server gave us these BINGO cards cause apparently they have a super cheesy round of BINGO with a $20 gift certificate as the prize some nights. We both agreed that it would awkward if a date took you there and that happened. Anyways...bottom line - go to Naked Fish instead.
author: Esther A.

description:
What is with the rock 'n' roll and sushi combo in this town?  Sushi Rock and Ace, both, seem to think the two go together like...soy and wasabi?

Ace Wasabi's true point of differentiation from its competitors would have to be the live web cam they post on their Web site.  I've spent many a Thursday through Saturday night sitting on my couch at home, watching the crazy sake-bombing ensue down on Steiner---it's a distance I'm the most comfortable with.  On rare occasion, I have actually made it out of the house and in to Ace, though, and have found the sushi overpriced and the sake under-intoxicating.
author: Hannah J.

description: Half off drinks for happy hour was a nice Friday surprise, as well as a round of bingo! Specialty roll was great and the drinks are fun, what else can you ask for. oh wait, good music... and great staff. This isn't the first time I've been and it's certainly not the last.
author: Sydel S.

description: Ok, I don't know what happened last night, but our dinner SUCKED.  Everything about it was gross...except for the beers.  The edamame was really cold, the miso was way to salty and luke-warm, and then the fish....ugh, the fish.  We started with the sashimi platter (seemed like a good deal), and my boyfriend put it best when he said "I feel like I'm doing you a favor" as he finished off the last few pieces at my urging.  The texture was all wrong for both the maguro and the hamachi, and everything lacked flavor.  It was as if the fish had been frozen or something.  Then the rolls were all pretty standard.  Not terrible but definitely not great.  However, the WORST part of the meal was the piece of butterfish nigiri I ate.   I almost gagged, seriously.  It was watery, chewy, and tasted like plastic.  I couldn't eat anything else after that.  It was miserable.  I'm never coming back here.
author: Dale M.

description:
UPDATE 4/25/2008:

So I finally ventured back here and I had to give it the FULL 5 STARS! 

We arrived around 7:15pm and it was PACKED! We sat at the sushi bar. The chefs were so fun and friendly. When you made a good choice on food selection they let you know and they were not shady on their cuts of nigri! I was please to see that the Hamachi Toro was on the menu again for specials. We got the Tuna Poke Salad which came with tuna, mango, almonds, fresh greens and get this shrimp chips. It was one of the best salads i've ever had at a japanese restaurant. For rolls we got the Scorpion Roll which was FANTASTIC! We also got the Tiger Roll which I had on my last visit but I don't remember it being as spicy...but it was just as yummy as I remembered.

This has become my FAVORITE place for sushi! The music is always jammin and the service is the best! I HEART ACE WASABI!!!

______________________________________________________

I've been hearing about Ace Wasabi around town but had not had the chance to go there. Finally on Friday with it being Lent and not being able to eat meat on fridays myself and a couple of friends decided to check the place out. 

On a Friday around 6:30 parking wasn't too bad in the Marina like it normally is...thank the lawd! We walk into Ace Wasabi and it's not crowded which is nice. I love how they have a regular bar area, then the sushi bar and then family style tables in the back. Nice mixture without being too secluded.  The waiter comes up to us and hands us BINGO cards. Then brings us to our table in the back with other parties that have 4 or more people. He tells us to play while he's showing us our table because you can win a $20 gift card for your next visit! And whaddaya know...my friend Sarah wins! NICE! The price is very good for the sushi rolls and even the nigri. Rolls were no more than $12 and Hamachi toro nigiri was only $5.80!!! The food is very filling and delicious! The only negative is that the music is really loud so you have to make sure your waiter hears your correctly...but another side of that was the the music was AWESOME!!!

I will be venturing back to this little spot...and if you decide to go there go around 6-630 as it tends to get busy by 7...the whole restaurant was packed by the time we left at 8.
author: Jazmine S.

description: Happy hour hamachi kama...the best!! N perfect price!!!- sushi is good, hand rolls are excellente, sake ( I always get the unfiltered one) great.. Good crowd, friendly service, good location. What else can I ask for?!;)- I've been there multiple times and am curious if there are any health risks for eating sushi almost everyday?!?! I want some hamachi Kama right now!!!! Yum! I absolutely recommend it! try it, u'll see!
author: C A.

description: this is a fun place to go if you are in the mood to eat dinner in a wild environment. It is loud, very very loud, and usually packed, but the sushi and other food items are great. I also love the agedashi tofu, which is not on the menu, but they will make it for you. The tuna poke salad is delish, and it is fun to go on Monday night, when they play one round of bingo. I think you win a gift certificate. Despite the party atmosphere, I find the service to be very good.
author: Lisa H.

description: The sushi is fresh and great, and they have a cool mix of rolls if that's your thing.  There is one particular waitress that screwed up our order twice and is a bitch, but other than that I've always had a good time.
author: Ty W.

description: Ive only eaten here once but what we got was really good.. really really good! if it weren't in the marina I'd possibly start going here but i am a marina hater tho.. sorry ;) just to far out of the way for sushi. The Flying Kamikaze Roll was outstanding, everyone fought over that before moving to the other rolls.. which were all great to! If its crowded your wait wont be worth it really, go to naked fish next door they seem to be similar quality just no Flying Kamikaze Roll.
author: Barbara C.

description: We used our Groupon here on Thursday night and it was delicious! I've never been here before and what better way to try a new place than WITH a coupon!? We ordered the Walu sashimi (to DIE for!!!), the Mori Mori which is the crispy rice cake topped with spicy tuna, the ace wasabi roll, futomaki, edamame with garlic chili, rock & roll, california roll and a couple of other things and the grand total was about $65, but since we used the Groupon, the total was about $10!!!! What a DEAL!! And the place was packed, it was delicious, the only thing is, I wish we had won BINGO! YES, they have bingo Mon-Fri nights!! Will be back again when we're in the neighborhood and want sushi!
author: Julie H.

description: One of the things I miss about living in Stockton is fried asparagus. In the lovely Stock-town, every Chinese and Japanese restaurant carries it. Its wonderful stuff. Since moving to SF 4 years ago, its been virtually impossible to find it. I end up pleading with a waitress to make it special, which they are rarely happy to do. So, behold my joy at Ace Wasabi the other night when it was actually on the menu! I did a dance of joy (probably also attributed to some excellent sake). Fabulous!
author: Noelle Q.

description: You kids in the Marina need to get out more. If I want cream cheese, I'll order a bagel, not sushi.
author: Rene D.

description:
Came here Friday night around 8:30pm, packed and loud, could barely hear each other...

Tuna tataki: 4 stars
Halibut sashimi: 4.5 stars
49ers roll: 3.5 stars (portion is small)
Spider roll: 2 stars
Seaweed salad: 3 stars (portion is small)

Over all 3-3.5 stars...will probably come back only for the sashimi...
author: Amy C.

description: I'm generally not a big fan of the Marina, but once I strap on my Cougar kryptonite, this is a pretty good place to grab sushi before heading out. The appetizers and rolls are great and sake selection is above par. Wait staff is also laid back and responsive, a rare combo.
author: Ahsan M.

description: OK PEOPLE--- enough about the "Marina Crowd" If you don't like us, then stay the hell out of our neighborhood bars and restaurants!! Quit stereotyping "marina chics and guys" not everyone who lives here is fake, just like not everyone who lives in the Haight is a hippie, not everyone in the Castro is GAY! GOT IT??? On with my review....I LOVE ACE WASABI--the bartenders and servers are HOTTIES...(Chris and Drew).  Great service and a really fun scene.  Oh yeah, I guess you're curious to know how the sushi is....yes, it is really good!
author: Theresa M.

description: We always come here... the food is amazing and the atmosphere is cool the music rocks and Kyle is dope ...........but the server don't know his name (asian with mohawk) is a trip we gave him a 50 dollar! tip and he asked at the end why? if he did something wrong? service was bad? or was the food no good? He did this in front of other customers making us look bad! I pulled out another 20 and he thanked me but WTF! 70 dollars total for tip for a group of 6? Thats just wrong and to complain infront of others?! WTF for reals!
author: antonio a.

description: This place rocks! the sushi was super good. and it was fun to sit in their awkward table and chairs to eat! our service was kind of crappy but we got to play bingo which made up for it. check it out!
author: Danielle C.

description: Some buddies of mine work/worked here so I have a bias...here are my observations of this interesting place.  Bunch of the waiters/bartenders  were surfer dudes (not posers, but guys who hit Ocean Beach all the time, when its cracka-lackin freight-train barrels) generally good looking, (though I am not sure if this is still the case).  But anyhow, these dudes attract loads of cute girls who hang out at the bar, who in turn attract dudes who recognize that there are hot girls who hang around the bar...regardless, go there for Bingo and maybe some "demon killers" from the bar.  Fun place, good food...
author: Evan B.

description:
good selection of hot and cold sakes.  my favorite apps are probably their tuna tataki and tuna sashimi salad with a hint of fruitiness (mango) and nuttiness.  as for their rolls i love anything with that spicy mayo sauce that some people despise.  

always a very good time to be had here at ace.  it's fun, loud and outgoing.  hence the 'rock n roll'.  i'm by no means a regular but if you hear hip hop it might be me sitting next to the music player trying to inject some hood jams into the usual rock rotation.  it's got that neighborhood vibe as it seems like everyone knows each other.  i've even been offered to share food and drinks with surrounding patrons (both men and women).  so if you're antisocial and mousy this place probably isn't for you.
author: Cindy N.

description: The sushi is good if you're into rolls but the nigiri was just okay. The crowd seemed hip and if the din was any indication of how much fun everyone was having, it must've been a really good time.
author: Kristi K.

description: Great sushi and very good service.  We ate at the bar and the bartender filled our drinks as we were asking...  I loved the rolls we selected.  They were tasty and interesting.  One had lobster and mango.  I can't remember them all but each one we had we really enjoyed.  We also got to play bingo and almost won.  Good music playing on the free juke box.
author: Kris K.

description: The food here was kind of disappointing considering there are so many great sushi restaurants around. Mon- Thurs at 6:30 they play BINGO in the restaurant though and the winner gets a gift certificate which was fun.  Basically, decent sushi and a pretty good, casual atmosphere.
author: Katie M.

description: Pleasantly surprised by my experience here. The atmosphere is fun with a definite bar vibe going. The rolls aren't really anything super special, but there were a couple that were pretty interesting. Tempura Jagger roll was oh so bad for me but oh so yummy. The jalapeno poppers (filled with hamachi) were excellent. The thing that really threw me over the edge was the Osaka beef. I am a firm believer in knowing where are when you order, and thus never order cooked meat at a sushi place. The boy wanted to try it, however, so we did. It was so good. Some of the best sauce I've ever had, and the meat was cooked perfectly. Honestly, I would go back just for that. They had some interesting cocktails that we didn't get to try, too.
author: Monika M.

description: I give this place a 4 star. The atmosphere is a bit rowdy on a saturday night. The prices were extremely reasonable. The service was great. I recommend trying the poki mango tuna salad/ ahi tuna w/chips. The sashmi was fresh but not the freshest i ever tasted. Still not the best sushi ever.
author: Tiffany L.

description: I recently started eating sushi (i know, i know..late bloomer) and i've liked it at a few places. This place made me L-O-V-E it. The scorpion roll is out-of-this-world fantabulous!!!!!! The atmosphere is cool, and we made it just time to play "sushi" bingo - for a chance at $20 gift card. Even though I did not win, I'll be back!
author: Heidi B.

description: I really don't care for the Marina folks, but Ace Wasabi's is worth the yuppie crowd!!!  I know this sounds crazy since its a sushi joint, but they have the best chicken fingers ever!!  All the rolls are good and very creative.  The appetizers are awesome, and the sake menu is very helpful because it describes all of their varieties and you always get the type you want.  Great for groups and great for a night out with your sig. other.
author: Maria B.

description: Yes, it's the Marina.  Yes, it can get way too crowded.  And yes, that crowd can be annoying.  But there's no denying that Ace Wasabi's makes some pretty good sushi.  Not my first choice, but I'm not too proud to eat here either.
author: Andrew E.

description:
not your typical / traditional sushi joint.  it's more like sushi-fusion.  place gets crowded, wait can be long and parking is hell.  

on a positive note ... sushi is very creative & tasty.  there's this salmon, fried potato sticks and a thin slice of lemon-ish sushi roll that is to die for!!!  actually, all the sushi i've had here was good.  along with the chicken finger-ish appetizer  - yum!  

i guess you can say this is a sushi fusion tapas place.
author: elaine i.

description: The food here is great, but I had to deduct a star for the crowdedness.  Is that a word?  It's more of a scene than I would typically want in a sushi place.  But you can't find much fault with the food.
author: Anna S.

description: Fun place to have sushi.  The fish is fresh, they have a decent selection of sashimi and rolls.  A fun place to go in large groups and saki bomb the night away.
author: Katie P.

description: This is my fav. sushi place I've been in SF!  Hands down!  Thats all I gotta say.
author: Britt B.

description: I did not like this place at all.  I wasn't into the crowd and I didn't like their food.  I was having high expectations because there were so many people hanging out in there so I assumed it must be delicious.
author: Toni C.

description: Atmosphere is better then the sushi, but good food nonetheless.  Definitely worth a trip. Good place to take people from out of town who want sushi, but with a different experience.
author: John G.

description:
Good Sushi with a good vibe. Come early and you can play the game of Sushi Bingo which is a blast. 
The bar can get a bit rowdy, which can be good or bad depending on your mood for the evening.
author: Abra A.

description: Umm, don't think I have really every tried the food here, at least not that I can remember.  If you want some sake bombs and want to flirt with a seriously faternity/sorority crowd this is the place for you.
author: Lauren H.

description:
It has been a long time since I have been to Ace Wasabi's. I got dragged there by a business associate who insisted. The poor ambiance and loud and immature crowd usually steers me clear of this well known trap.

 We arrived to be greeted by a happy go lucky (hot) hostess. We were promptly seated and immediately greeted by our server Talia. What a treat. She was friendly, knowledgeable and cute. And she bought us a hot sake. The service was impeccable. 

The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5, was the unusually long wait for food. Which Talia smoothed over with a smile. I know where I will be going the next time I want sushi and service with a smile!!!!!!
author: Marisa B.

description: I'm surprised by reviews that call Ace Wasabi "expensive" because I think its one of the best values in sushi in the city.  The sashimi is always very fresh, the tuna tataki is awesome, and Ace Wasabi has one of the most creative menus around.  While maybe not as authentic as other places, their rolls are to die for.  Expecially the kamikaze roll.
author: Erica G.

description: Try to get seated in the back, because when the bar starts to get crazy, you cannot eat your food without getting someone's drink spilled on you, or getting jabbed by an elbow. It almost seems like opposite worlds when you go to the back. Only three things on the menu that really stand out for me: the albacore tataki, flying hawaiian, and the other non-rice roll that i always forget the name. It's wrapped in ginger i think.... MMMMMMMMmmmmmm
author: Marina K.

description: It's okay, it's like you pay to be in that trendy, cool environment rather than for the food.  The seaweed salad was a very generous serving however for the price.  Sushi's nothing special and overpriced for what you get, but this place is definitely a see and be seen spot
author: Emiko M.

description: It's dirt cheap, they have some unique roles, and a decent selection of sake. Try the tuna tataki appetizer - it's great. I also suggest the roll with mango and avocado onto of shrimp, as well as the potato flake lemon roll. (I realize I should be able to remember the names, but its been a long day). Be warned that their rolls do tend to fall apart, the atmosphere is fall from traditional, and the crowd is very yuppie. The staff is unbelievable and it seems to be the only place in the Marina where every single person on the staff greets you on your way in and out. If you decide to come here, I would dabble in their specialty roles rather than their nigiri.
author: Alicia J.

description: So, the sushi didn't make me explode with delight, but it was pretty damn good. Nothing mind blowing. Had all your staples of rolls and what not. What got me was that this place seemed like a cool place to actually be at with friends. The chefs were friendly and helped me out with suggestions. It was a good time all around. It was a little crowded so I suggest planning your trip. It IS the marina after all.
author: Erik U.

description: A fantastic place to get great sushi at a cheap price.  The service isn't bad and the place is always happenin.  The wait is never too long and they have a bar to grab a drink before being seated.  I love the tuna-tartare with won ton chips!  A great appetizer.  The music is fun and the bingo is a great idea.
author: Megan M.

description: A really fun place to meet a group of friends, have a beer and eat some good sushi. Beware, when they say a roll is "spicy" be prepared, they're NOT kidding. The menu is tasty and creative (and very "Westernized"), which is great for people who aren't so keen on traditional sushi/sashimi.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Best salmon sushi I've possibly ever had.  Very trendy Marina atmosphere, though, and loud bar scene at the front.  Best seating in the back unless you're there to see & be seen.
author: Don H.

description: ultra hip sushi place.  I was very impressed by the sushi selection and the reasonable prices.
author: Debbie Y.

description:
i love this place. esp. for their albacore tuna tataki!! mmmm, i wished i lived closer to the marina..

definitely you'll need to get there early to avoid the long wait but it's worth a try. their sushi rolls are fresh and definitely can't leave without having a sake bomb!!
author: Mika D.

description: Dinner last night was great! I don't get the negative reviews at all. A good friend and I ate sushi here last night and she is not adventurous nor the sushi type but she loved it as much as I did. It helped that we went during happy hour b/c the drinks were half off and ended up being like $2 and $3. In  the Marina, that's a crazy good deal. The sushi was def affordable, super yummy and very fresh. The drinks were great as well. We ordered the veggie roll with fresh eggplant, the spider roll with soft shell crab and some hand rolls (which were only $2)  The place gets pretty busy around 6 and they have nightly specials as well as bingo on Tuesdays! I will absolutely be back, yum !
author: J D.

description: I was starving and Aquew was already closed so we went here instead and while I was expecting overpriced faux-sushi, I got a pretty tasty treat at not so bad prices. The waitresses were cute, but I don't know about model material since one was about a foot shorter than me. Not bad of a place until the table near us got annoying by repeating every thing we were discussing. Hey what do you expect you're in the Marina afterall...if you're not a twenty/thirtysomething re-living fra-rority days, then, you my friend are not K-E-W-L.
author: Charm N.

description: A fun, not so typical sushi joint in Cow Hollow. It's actually quite amazing, the fusion of rock music, eclectic style, and japanese food. Sometimes you feel like traditional fare, but other times you just feel like enjoying a modern take in a more relaxed, fun atmosphere. This place is for those other times.
author: Jon N.

description: I used to come here all the time just for the hamachi kama (one of the best in the city) but was completely disappointed at the last visit. We were seated in the backroom & promptly ignored for most of our meal. The servers were just talking & trying to look beautiful most of the time. We had to ask the busboy several times to get our waiter for us. He even forgot to order some of our rolls. We called the "manager" after we left & she kept defending our waiter saying that he is the best. We would've been happy with an apology & "I'll speak to him" response but obviously they don't care about keeping customers happy. Doubt if I'd go back. Hamachi kama or not...
author: Jenny W.

description: Save your money and ego by making a reservation at Sushi Groove north.
author: Lane K.

description: I might like this place if I were better looking but I felt like the ugly duckling. It seems like that kind of place to me. Not that I didn't mind the eye candy but. It is really loud, cramped and busy, which some people like but not really my scene. Oh, right hah and in terms of the food, I thought the sushi was overall fine.
author: Dan C.

description: Been to this place a few times. Mostly the foods are pretty good. I like their Golden Tofu Salad, grilled calamari and most of their rolls are pretty good. Why only 3 stars? First, I think Koo sushi is much better, Secondly, parking sucks, Third: I don't like the tiny waiting area...it's tiny and you have to endure the staring from all the Marina crowds.
author: Levy O.

description: This place was good, but not great, their fresh fish was delicioso but their rolls were okay. Other than that had the teriyaki and tempura and it was standard good.  A good place to go for average good Japanese food.
author: Sabrina T.

description: Not your traditional sushi restaurant, but as long as you aren't rating them against traditional, it's fantastic! Super reasonable on the price, on the louder side and fun. Lots of interesting sushi options, and so far I've always had good service. My only complaint - which I didn't consider when grading - is that a few times I've been here on the later side of a Friday or Saturday night, there have been some totally obnoxious drunk groups. It's the marina, it's going to happen, but if you want a quiet romantic evening I wouldn't pick this particular sushi place. Defintely recommended though.
author: Niki N.

description: Hip and rockin' sushi joint w/ beautiful people and tasty sushi. Yellow tail hamachi... *swoooooooon*
author: Ikeb I.

description: Its okay.  The sushi dishes are named funny, the wait staff is attractive ...the prices are a bit high.  Go to Blowfish Sushi instead ....just bring your gun before parking your car.
author: Marc M.

description: Fun sushi restaurant: high quality food and fun vibe.  We used to call this "rock and roll sushi".
author: Art A.

description:
definitely not the place for kickaround jeans and a t-shirt if you want to fit in here. i always feel like i have to wear something hip! aaaahh the pressure!

theres some pretty unique rolls here and their salads are pretty good. the scorpion roll is my favorite which if i remember correctly is a fried crab and mango roll. i always come during happy hour so i can order the $2 handrolls and play bingo for a shot to win a $20 gift card for your next visit. i've won once, and it feels so good until the next time you come in and your one away from bingo - and another woman from across the room yells BINGO! and you feel like throwing your board at her head.  but it's all in good fun.
author: Douglas F.

description: The sushi here is so good. They have a roll that has a slice of lemon on top and the acidity slightly cooks the salmon it sits on. You eat the lemon (it's sliced really thinly) and it is SO refreshing!!
author: Carson H.

description:
I would have given them more stars but we didn't have such a good experience when I took my out-of-town friends there for dinner. It was pretty busy so we were told there would be a bit of a wait.  This would have been no problem if the hostess hadn't sat her friends and the people who came in behind us (a party with the same number of people) before us.

However, once we were seated we found the sushi to be very nice.  Try the lobster roll with mango and macadamias.
author: Sarah T.

description:
excellent sushi, great service, great atmosphere and great people. 

BEST and funnest sushi place in the city, hands down!!! 

HIGHLY recommended
author: Bobby B.

description: Ace Wasabi has always been my favorite sushi place in SF. I've had birthday dinners here and brought my parents here. But I have to give them 1 star for the appalling service we received today. We arrived around 630pm, and the waitress seated us, and gave us the regular menu and the Happy Hour menu. She didn't mention the HH menu, and that it was available until 7pm. We just discovered it and started reading it. She took drink orders, but neglected to come check in on us. When she finally did, at 7:05pm, she curtly told us it was too late to order the HH specials. Common sense would dictate that she should go out of her way to make up for her slow service. But she was clueless. Bad service can ruin a good meal, as was the case tonight.
author: Nadim H.

description: I'm not a big sushi buff (whatever that means), but I do like some good raw fish once in awhile.  Ace had a pretty hefty selection of rolls in addition to numerous cooked entrees.  My fiance and I had one of the special Lobster Rolls and a spicy tuna roll.  Both were extremely tasty, however my main complaint was the tightness of the roll.  I know it sounds strange, but the rice was very clumpy and made securing a piece of sushi in a pair of chopsticks difficult to say the least.   The staff was extremely friendly and the prices were slightly above average.  All in all, I'd come back.
author: Ryan R.

description: Ken and his team have been serving up some of the best sushi for years now. THe atmosphere is always entertaining. Make sure to ask Ken for a sake shot!  Update: They have added a spicy tuna tartare..it is now my new favorite..awesome!
author: Not M.

description: I'm not gonna lie...I do love this place! The ace wasabi roll is to die for, and the pear cider sake bombs are well worth the hangover!
author: Lisa K.

description: If you're into rolls, this is the place for you.  The rolls are definitely flavorful.  The waitstaff seems to spend more time flirting with each other than actually attending to the patrons.
author: Karen K.

description:
one of our favorite sushi restaurants.  parking sucks but once you are settled and in the restaurant, we're nothing but smiles.

everything is good here sushi or sashimi wise but one thing we always get is the grilled hamachi. it is only $7 and you get an entire hamachi grilled and served with this ponzu sauce.  it is delicious and very complimentary to the rolls we have.

also they also have a decent sake selection.  it is great for groups of friends for an outing.

sit at the bar if you can. the sushi chefs there like to show off :)
author: Hao L.

description: I used a $25 for $55 groupon here and had a reservation for 6pm on a wed night. There was really no need for one since we were dining pretty early but the groupon said we needed reservations so we made one. We were seated in a table in the front of the restaurant. I've read reviews saying it gets pretty rowdy here but that wasn't the case that night. It was probably because we came early - good thing. We decided on the tuna and salmon tartar appetizer, the steiner, kamikaze, three amigos, and a garden. The bf also had a miso soup. Since I had yelped this place early on I knew I had to order the tuna and salmon tartar because everyone raved about it. It was the best dish that night! The tuna and salmon surprisingly went well with the guacamole and ponzu. I never thought about eating raw fish with guac but it certainly works well! Since the bf does not like raw fish by itself I pretty much ate most of it myself. I was almost already half full at this point and I had not even started on our rolls yet! The steiner, garden, and three amigoes were the best ones and kamikaze the least. Overall I thought the rolls were ok but not amazing. The bf liked them though. I've definitely had yummier rolls elsewhere but it sure was a lot of food. I was hoping to order dessert for our remaining balance but we were told they donot serve dessert. No dessert? How absurd! The waitress told us we had accumulated $51 so figuring we had just four dollars left we ordered a shitake tempura for another $2 even though we were already really full. We paid and took leftovers home. We didn't realize until we were on the car ride home that we did not claim our full $55 worth of food. When she said $51 she should have said $51 with tax because we could have ordered another $8 worth of food to go... =/ The food is not yummy enough for me to want to come back though I do have to say the rice from the leftovers was not hard or anything so I was able to eat it cold just fine the next day.
author: Helen L.

description:
Great place to come for really great sushi, and a fun atmosphere.  I was surprised at how busy it was on a Wednesday night.  A fun crowd, friendly servers, and good for people watching.

First of all, I tried cold unfiltered sake, which was delicious.  I didn't know I liked sake, as I've only tried the hot (sake bomb) sake.  They have a really great menu at Ace Wasabi, really something for everyone.  A sushi beginner or expert could be equally happy here.  I had the spinach gomae and the cucumber salad to start.  Okay, the cucumber salad is amazing!!  So fresh, crisp, and has a bite to it (due to the spices they put on the cucumbers).  If you love Korean cucumbers, you'll adore this version.  We had the ahi toro nigiri, which melted, so buttery, in my mouth.  My sister ordered the california roll and added daikon (tasted a bit weird with the daikon- but that's my sister's issue), which was tasty.  The crab meat is fresh and not imitation, and it's not a crab salad mix.  Just straight crab, yum.  We also had the green beans- spicy and hot.  Solid food, great selection, and a clean place.  Love it.

Service is excellent, all the servers/bartenders are really friendly and fun. 
I think Ace would be a great place to have dinner with friends or a fun date place.  Go!!!
author: Sarah F.

description: Some of the best sushi in the city... amazing rolls, so delicious!  A very fun place to eat.
author: Stephanie P.

description: On a busy night, the bar or the backroom is best, as the front area gets really packed, and really loud. The bar (the sushi one, not the drink bar in front, just to be clear), is great -- talk to the chefs and just order what and when you feel like it. Good quality fish, and the cooked items (generally, grilled things on skewers) are pretty good too. Basic sushi/sashimi is good quality, and they have a selection of "fusion" rolls, which are couplings of things you might not expect in a sushi roll, and some more normal combinations too. This place is true to its name -- not traditional, by any means, with an energetic atmosphere.
author: Bruce C.

description: I'm totally embarrassed that I like the sushi at such a long time trendy marina dig like this (feels like I should like some place with a Japanese name and a lot of traditional music in the background), but really...I could marry the plate of albacore in ponzu sauce. Everything here is fresh and tasty and I always have a good time. It does get crowded, but it's worth it...just to see that plate of albacore.
author: Yvonne Y.

description: Sure, the sushi is only slightly above average for San Francisco, but you come to Ace Wasabi's for the SCENE and not the sushi.  The crowd is almost entirely "Marina."  That said, there is no better place to mix and mingle over dinner and drinks in the area.   It's similar to eating your dinner in a bar.  I used to hostess here and would watch men cruising for women for 5 straight hours.  Plenty of the female patrons sit at the bar to ogle Chris, the cute bartender.  Other women would specifically ask to be seated in "Kyle's section." For sushi in a raucous environment on the weekends, this place takes the cake. The prices are reasonable and the staff/owner is super friendly. Sure, it's a Marina crowd, but it's probably the hottest crowd in the city.
author: Poker B.

description: I had some time to kill so, I decided to have sushi in the Marina district. Ace Wasabi was my first pick since I've been here before and thought that the music/sushi combination was quite cool. The ambiance was exactly the same but with less people this time around (no Union Street Fair). The music, as usual, was great and entertaining. The sushi was hit or miss this time. I ordered the Jalapeno Tuna roll and was quite disappointed. There really was no spice to it. It felt like eating a bunch of wrapped up, watered down, and unflavored coleslaw. Other than that, the rest of the sushi was tasty. The service was also quite slow for a Sunday afternoon (only a handful of patrons were dining at that time).
author: Bill D.

description: Go here if you want a scene in the bar area, not great sushi. The rolls are pretty ho-hum and I'm not a fan of their spicy tuna. While the sushi IS better than at nearby Naked Fish in terms of quality, it can't compete with the likes of Tsunami and Sushi Groove North.
author: a p.

description: Hooray!  I have finally found a sushi place that is cheap with amazing rolls, strong drinks and friendly service!!  On a Saturday night with no reservation, we were sat at the sushi bar within 30 minutes.  Immediately we were asked what we would like to drink and 2 minutes after that we were downing very yummy Cider Bombs.  I recommend the Albacore Tetaki (sp?) from the small plate menu as an appetizer.  Warning: it's no small plate and so delicious you will eat it all.  I had to practically be rolled out of this place.  Too much good sushi or too many strong drinks....eh, it's a toss up.  Go here, leave full and drunk :)
author: Erin H.

description: Ken Lowe...thank you for a consistently good sushi restaurant in the Marina with the hottest crowd & most fun bartenders.  Love it...  But, I'm still waiting for you to have a dessert menu...
author: Valerie B.

description: Chances are if you walk in at around 6:45pm you will hear someone yell BINGO!  They host a nightly game of bingo starting at 6:30 on the dot-don't be late...wining means walking out with a $20 gift card. I love there garlic & chili edamame-sooo spicy, but so good. I tired a couple of rolls and no complaints-everything was delicious. The crowd is fun and lively-cool place to check out and grab a few drinks-they have a cool happy hour on drinks and rolls. Check it out!
author: Aurora B.

description: I love this place!  I've been eating here for three years, the staff knows me, and always adds that personal touch.  The room is fun and the crowd is too.  Is it THE BEST fish I've ever had?  Probably not.  But, it's fresh, it's good quality, the rolls are creative and, like I said, it's fun.  In it's price range, it's my personal favorite.
author: Chad K.

description:
go for the trendy, marina experience, if that is actually a reason to go somewhere.  the sushi is good but not that great.  we went with a large group, and when our orders came out, our server had no clue what the name of each roll/dish was.  shouldnt they know what they serve?

it was loud and hot, but it seemed that most everyone was having an enjoyable time.  we waited 25 min to be seated (with a reservation).  i think the wait at the bar helped everyone to not realize how crappy the service was - i wasnt drinking much so it was sort of hard to miss.
author: Kristin K.

description: We ate so much & I don't even know which items we ate because there was heavy drinking involved with our dinner but nonetheless it was AWESOME!  I love, love, love this place, minus the marina crowd-gag, but food was great!  And a free jukebox with sushi-I mean come on now-that's life!
author: Steven K.

description: It takes a lot to get me out to the Marina. Let's just preface this reviewing by saying that. A lot. When my friend invited me for free sushi, of course I could not decline. We ventured out into the Marina. We made a reservation which didn't seem like it mattered because they sat us down right away without asking if we had a reservation. We sat in the front room and the music was kind of loud. A mixture of top 40 and random rock. I ordered the kamikaze chicken fingers to start. I loved the spicy garlic aioli sauce too. I had the Ozzy Roll which was also delicious.  It had tempura shrimp with spicy sauce and sliced jalapenos. I loved the jalapenos on top it was the perfect touch of spicy. We came back a few weeks later and I ordered the same thing with an Anchor steam. The food was consistently good. We didn't have a reservation the second time and I wish we had-since there was a long wait for a Monday nite. The service was not as great the second time either. No one refilled our drinks-which you kind of need when you are eating sushi-especially when there are jalapenos on top. I  wanted a second Anchor steam but no one ever came around to ask to refill it. They also never brought us plates! We were eating out of our soy sauce mini plate. It was a little strange that the server never picked up on that. I wouldn't come here for an intimate date. Great for may be a loud group or a good friend outing, not somewhere I would go if you wanted to have a serious conversation.
author: Kristy H.

description: So what if the sushi isn't the best? They don't call it rock and roll suchi for nothing. The scene is young and loud, the sushi tasty and it's crowded most nights. For a slight upgrade on the sushi and a cool but more sedate atmo, check Naked Fish at the end of Steiner.
author: Patrick B.

description: I confess to being one of those people who is anti-Marina at times, so I was a little afraid to try Ace's, especially when I heard that the waitstaff all looked like models. However, I was pleasantly surprised by the tasty fish, reasonable prices, and friendly staff. I'm not a huge fan of the elaborate roles (I'm more of a nigiri girl), although if that is your thing, this place has an amazing selection.
author: Michelle O.

description: Do you have a count down calendar to the Union Street Festival? Do you like to get some grub before heading to the triangle?  Do you prefer to not hear your friend during dinner because they play the music so loud and marina girls/guys have to yell above it to let everyone know how fabulous they think they are? Then you'll love Ace Wasabi's after 8pm any night of the week
author: All About Town ..

description:
I absolutely adore Ace Wasabi's! Every time I come here I feel like I just walked into a house party where everyone knows each other. I've be frequenting Ace for over 4 years and the great service and delicious food hasn't changed. I love the laid back but spunky attitude of the staff, and the fact that they down Sake bombs with the customers makes the experience all the more fun. The Sushi chefs are loud, funny, and can't resist flirting with cute girls. Try the Ozzy roll...to die for.

If you are in the mood for a party atmosphere while you inhale the best sushi in The City come to Ace. It doesn't hurt that the bartenders and waiters are HOT.
author: Anna F.

description: I came here with my gf tonight.  Waitress took our order after about 15 minutes (ok fine), waitress finally came over to take our order. So we order some rolls including the Elvis (the most expensive roll on the menu), and also our favorite. Waitress comes back about 5 minutes later to tell us verbatim - I'm sorry but we can't make an Elvis because we're short handed tonight and it's too complex..can you order something else? So we order another roll. 45/50 minutes later our food comes. Tempura is cold and soggy in one of the rolls. The other was supposed to have seared albocore- which was torched beyond being edible. Bill comes rather quickly, and no apology, nor discount, is made for an hour wait for marginal sushi. Looks like they have started to get complacent here - after living in the neighborhood for quite some time and coming here often, we'll be going down the street to Sushi In where they have a little more pride in what they serve.
author: Dexter R.

description:
An excellent sushi restaurant.  I have been to this restaurant around 100 times.  I have no affiliation with the place so my repeat busines is a statement of their excellence -- and I am a sushi connoissuer!

The fish quality is equal to or better than most other sushi spots in San Fran (a lot of the fish is purchased through the same channels by most restaurants so this stands to reason).  

Atmosphere is nice.  It has a more contemporary feel than most Japanese restaurants.  The music is always playing and it is excelelnt.  A jukebox in the bar allows patrons to tailor the music to their tastes.

Service is very good.  Staff is attentitve without being intrusive.
author: D G.

description: Great atmosphere for a sushi restaurant on thursday nights!  Food was good and the prices are very reasonable.  If you want good sushi with a big social scene, head over the Ace's any night.
author: Cameron M.

description:
Not my favorite sushi place but its decent. First of all, from what I gathered, NONE of the sushi rolls come with any sauces... NOT that I like sauces, but its nice to have that option... Secondly, didnt luv their sushi "creations"... very basic... there was ONE good roll... something with spicy tuna... it was delicious... the rest were pretty basic... tasted good, but basic... whatever their sushi roll with the potato bits in it... not very tasty... potato bits in a sushi roll? its MY bad for thinking to order it...

OK, so I'm sitting with my girlfriends in the back at a table and this awful smell just takes OVER the entire area... its some sort of dish... and it stinks... the couple three tables over ordered it... later in the nite, the party across the room ordered that same dish... it was fowl to even smell, i cant imagine the taste... who knows though, it may have been delicious...

Plus side- servers are friendly, good looking crowd... great bar... accomodating with reservations

Downside- NO dessert... yeah, no green tea icecream... NADA...
author: Vic M.

description: I had family visiting from out of town and Ace was recommended to me by a SF local. We sat at the sushi bar and had really good sushi and wonderful service. The fun part was trying the many different rolls we saw being made for others. I will definitely go again.
author: Susan C.

description: Solid 3 1/2 to 4 stars but personally prefer the bar with the "whitefish sushi" appitizer, rocks and is one of the best in the country for the money :-)  table service was hit or miss..
author: Nicole S.

description:
Great people and yummie food!

We've been going here for years and have never been disappointed. The sushi is great, you just have to ask for the old school monkey roll.  The Miso Glazed Sea Bass is one of the best dishes I've ever had.

It's a bit crowded and noisy on Friday and Saturday night, so go on another night if you are looking for a more leisurely tone.
author: James B.

description: Well priced, fun atmosphere, down to earth server (one free saki!) and yummy sushi. Came here on a Sunday night, so the louder club music playing felt slightly out of place, but I can imagine it being perfect for first stop Fri/Sat. evenings. Above all: sushi was quality.
author: s m.

description:
surprisingly great sushi, has a cool little rock and roll atmosphere with all sorts of concert posters.  The bingo every night at 630 is kinda cool

i do agree that the a lot of the locals are complete tools.  but then again come in shortly after opening there shouldn't be a problem.

service is hit or miss, everyone at the host stand is always friendly, but last time we were there, our server was very obviously not happy  being at work that day.  Anytime we needed anything we need him to flag him down after about 10 min of waiting.  He was way short and super rude with us, but i didnt let that sway me away from how much i like the sushi.

not a cool date place, but its great for a chill night with friends
author: jose f.

description: yes we we're the only minorities in here, a black dude, a japanese dude, and me a chinese dude, enough with the marina jokes..  the tataki here was amazing above the sushi rolls.  service was stellar, the tab was $107 and we left $24 for tip.
author: Pickle R.

description: Might have been some of the worst Sushi ever. It would not even be worth it if they paid me for the food. The Sushi bar reeked of bleach, while for the first time ever I was served up frozen Sashimi.
author: Bill K.

description:
I finally (after living here 3 years!) got around to trying out this hyped up Marina venue last week. Was it everything I dreamed it would be? Not really, but a pleasant experience overall. Their poke was unique, with added almonds and mango, which I found delicious! The grilled hamachi didn't thrill me nearly as much --- just ok, and a little dry. I must also admit, albeit sheepishly, that I swooned over my waiter. Yes, he was hot, but the service was pretty good, too. 

The music was fun, but way to loud to have a comfortable conversation (a big negative for me).
author: Cheeky C.

description: i go here for dinner with my boyfriend as often as we can. Our favorite is the U2 roll but on our last visit we had the Jagger role which was on special. We really hope they add that to the menu. As always, it was a great experience. the sushi chefs are the best part because they are always so nice!
author: Andrea B.

description: Ok, so I have been going to Ace Wasabi for about 10 years.  I saw all the recent "groupon" posts and have to respond.  iIf you hate the Marina, then you will find a reason to hate Ace Wasabi as it is in the Marina.  if twenty somethings with fancy handbags disgust you, then stay away and go find a taco truck in the Mission.  Ace Wasabi's food is consistent and very good.  In addition to standard sushi fare, they have a ton of different, interesting rolls.  They also have a number of dishes that work well for kids (best chicken fingers ever!) and the back room is always family friendly. Bingo is also tons of fun for the little ones.  The difference between Ace Wasabi and many of the "hip" places that have fancy rolls is that the rolls are excellent at Ace Wasabi and the fish is always fresh.  They "get it", which I can't say of many of the "hip" sushi places that I have been to over the years.  If you want a family friendly restaurant, that is also a singles restaurant in the front, and want consistent, good food, then this is the place.
author: Schuy K.

description: fun atmosphere, and the sushi is actually pretty good!  they mainly have rolls, which are tasty.  cute bartenders, which is a plus.
author: Helen T.

description: well this place has some different kind of sushi, none that youd actually find in japan but still pretty tasty.  i prefer the authentic japanese places with the shoji paper walls and tatami floors but this one is basically made for yuppies.  go to japantown instead for some authentic sushi.
author: Tiffany L.

description: I hear this place was voted 2nd best sushi in SF...I don't really care who got the top spot because this place is #1 in my book!
