My first experience here was a little out of the ordinary because I was taken here by someone who is apparently kind-of-a-big-deal here; upon being seated our server already had a large sake waiting for us and happily informed us "sake's on me all night kids!" Yesssss. We also got to order special rolls not on the menu (don't remember what they were called - one might have been the Cancun roll? it had jalapeno on it!) The seared albacore tataki is AMAZING - do yourself a favor and try it, you can thank me later... Also tried toro for the first time, salmon toro, it's from the belly of the fish so it's fattier and melts in your mouth, we ordered it for dessert...yeah, that good. My most recent trip here was for my birthday and served as ground zero for my blackout thanks to satan (you know who you are.) Ace Wasabi is one of the few places in SF I've been to more than once, and I'll continue to return over and over again - it's THAT GOOD!
author: Jonathan B.

description: i don't know why i never reviewed ace's Wasabis earlier, Ive only been here over 20 times! and all 20 something times, I've never been disappointed. This is actually my favorite sushi place in the city. After a long day of shopping in union square, I always drop by for dinner, regardless if its hella busy or not. I always order the Mango Poke, and Philly roll and then a different roll just to try. Its fun to sit by the big tv-like juke box machine cause you can pick what music you want to play. if you are there a certain night a server is there, he plays "gossip" a lot cause that's all we heard all night, which is great!  Food usually is really fast but for some reason it took a while to come out that night. they made it up by giving us some dessert after =) price range is great AND they have REAL crab in their California rolls! overall i love this place and i would be in really big trouble if i lived in the marina district =P
author: kim p.

description:
happy feb BYOO ary ... how do you all say it? 

feb BROO ary or feb BYOO ary?

bahh..

for most people, feb is a sticky month ...  it can either be a toss up between us single folks or the best excuse to spoil your s/o. some people think being single this month is a curse, but then again, it shouldn't be ... i have to say, being the sappy die hard romantic, it is one of my favorite holidays, but it is also an awakening moment as well... 

yes, it's so* true, ideally and realistically, january should be the whole "fresh new start"... but i use feb as the fresh new start since jan is just a lil warm up month ... i kno some of you "use and abuse" feb to keep your toys around to get spoiled and such, but i think some of you use to really put your foot down before anything gets too serious.

so yea .. sry for going off tangent there .. i guess having valentines around the corner just kinda woke me up to reality ... lol.

ace isn't all that bad of a sushi joint but it's definitely not my favorite. it cured my "fishy" fix for last night's dinner, all i wanted was walu, toro and saba ... 

very marina-ish, yuppie crowd .. have to admit, wayyy better than enoshima on chestnut ... 

when i stepped in and took my sushi to go, i saw all these peeps playing this game ... after talkin to the hostess, she tells me that they place bingo M-F, at 630, and if you win, you get to come back w/a $20 (don't quote me on that, i ferget the amount, i believe it was $20. double check) gift certificate. that's actually a fun lil perk .. average prices around $5 and up.
author: Jennifer S.

description: worth the trip to Marina. yummy, fresh, and creative rolls.
author: JJ J.

description: I came here with a few friends, but wasn't very hungry, so it may have affected my experience. The environment was nice and relaxing, but the food took a while to come out. The only roll that I remember being really good was the Philly roll. The salmon had a smoked taste to it! Overall, the place was pretty good, but I wouldn't drive from San Jose just to eat there.
author: Mr. J.

description: This place rocks the hizzy!  I've been going for years and the food, the service, the people, the atmosphere have all been consistently solid!  Three cheers for keeping up the great work.
author: Tom O.

description: packed. always packed. yummy food. fun sushi makers. packed. small and packed. fun first date place but packed. packing them in here that's for sure. just plain packed.
author: Ricquel N.

description: Great sushi rolls and appetizers, but extremely long line (waited over 1 hr for a table), and super noisy!!! If you don't mind the wait and noise, it's a great place to go!
author: M L.

description: I love sushi and used to be a sushi waitress.  I'm always looking for that perfect buttery textured fish that's not too fishy tasting.  Ace Wasabi is the best place I've been to in SF so far.  Most of the fish is very fresh and butery tectured.   I had the 3 Amigos and was a little disgusted by the mix of flavors, but most of their other rolls are fantastic.  The place can also be super crowded and they don't take reservations, so beware.  But still the best sushi Ive had in SF.  Anyone know of something better?  And please don't say Sushi Groove, I have never had such tough nasty end peices and I've been there 3 times.
author: nikki a.

description: I love this place. It converted me into a sushi eater, after 10 years of  resisting.  The booze and sushi is decently priced. I've been here 5 times and each time the bill is way less than I expect. The only problem is the wait, but the bar area is pretty fun so its not too big of a pain. Only go here if you want to be in a loud and packed restaurant and plan on getting drunk. (The crunchy salmon roll and black cod is the best)
author: Katie G.

description: this place is awesome....the sushi and the sashimi was delicious...the waiter sat and drank with us, i would definaly go back to this place if i ever come back to san fran
author: David C.

description: i'm not in love with this place...i think i'm just in like with this place, really...yet, for some reason, i keep going back.  the food is ok, drinks are strong, the wait is usually long, and it's too loud and packed in there.  but it is what it is.  bingo at 630 is fun tho.
author: Reina M.

description: 5 stars for their toro and albacore tataki.  best toro i've had *anywhere*.   1 star for the marina crowd and scene.  the toro and tataki are worth putting up with it on some nights.
author: Vic A.

description: the tuna and salmon tartare w guacamole and shrimp chips..OMG Yumm!! everything else we ordered was just blah.
author: E. S.

description: enh, pretty mediocre sushi, if you ask me.  But the decor is pretty cool and it's definitely a "happening" place.  They gave us free sake bombs because we had a hookup.  Totally too crowded to the point where it's hard to walk in and out.
author: jozilla w.

description: If you come on the weekend , you will have to wait. If you have time try to get a seat at the bar.  Price is very reasonable for the portion sizes that they serv.  If you are looking for a great meal come dureing the week.
author: Eli K.

description: Awesome sushi, great service. & they play rock music. I love the sake bombs too. Fun for going out at night with friends, or getting a great roll. It gets super crowded on weekend nights, so I wouldn't reccomend bringing babies in there. You can always have a good time though.
author: Katie M.

description: been there on a Friday night...the hostess told us the wait for two is 20 min but it took us an hour to be seated which was frustrating..food was good but not great...Salmon and yellowtail sashimi were good and fresh...
author: Mahyar K.

description: Best salmon crunchy roll in the city.  Delish!
author: nikki s.

description: My favorite sushi place in the city hands down! best rolls and you cant beat the good looking crowd and the fun atmosphere! :)
author: Luba R.

description: It's more than just a "scene". It really is great sushi.  Definitely order the albacore tataki appetizer--best dish on the menu. Love the Uni too (and very  reasonably priced for sea urchin). Big pieces of fish on the nigiri too--not like many places that overdo the rice and wimp out on the fish.  Staff is very hospitable and actually likes and engages with the customers.  Keep up the good work.
author: Ty G.

description: Great fresh sushi at good prices in a fun and hospitable atmosphere.   Inventive rolls but also amazing classics.  They have the best spider roll in town!
author: Maria R.

description: This is the PERFECT neighborhood bar and restaurant.  Excellent decently priced food & friendly quick staff!  Highly recommend the Tataki and the Spider Roll!
author: R O.

description: The decor and music are fairly awful here but the sushi and warm sake were fantastic. I went to have dinner with friends from out of town and we couldn't hear each other talk. =) It's good and casual but sometimes I like a more peaceful environment when i'm spending good money on sushi.
author: foodbot c.

description: Great place! I am always traveling in other parts of the country  for my job and can't wait to come back to SF to go to this place. You can even ask the chef to make special plates for you that aren't on the menu....like a mango roll...mmmm...
author: jane-paula s.

description: GREAT SUSHI! Kinda loud though, and around 10pm impossible to walk through, but the sake bombs are amazing, and the wait staff is adorable!
author: mike s.

description: I used to rave about this place...and will continue to do so after getting it out of my mind that I was about to eat an edamame pod that had a worm in it.  I normally just squeeze the beans into my mouth, but I wanted to take my time and just watch them come out of the pods one by one as I would do with M&Ms out of a packet...I had a lot of time on my hands.  The management was prompt to pay for our beers and even serve us the latest catch.  I really like this place because it is the first izakaya I've ever been to in the U.S.  The atmosphere is great, because you can be loud and not have to worry about disturbing anyone, unlike traditionally quiet sushi restaurants. I am a connossieuer of fine sushi and this is one place that makes it on my list. After having lived in Japan for five years - I know my sushi!  If you're just really into the sushi, this place ranks second to Uzen, located on College Blvd. in Rockridge, Oakland.  This place can get crowded during prime time, but check this out - you can view the restaurant through their website via webcam so you can see just how crowded it might be!
author: Raging R.

description: The ONLY reason I would eat in the Marina is my $55 Groupon coupon (for only $25) discount.  We waited 30 minutes for our raw fish order to arrive after the waitress claimed it was coming after about 20 minutes!  Subsequent orders didn't take as long.  We could sometimes hear the rock music coming from the speaker only one table away--over the noise of people yelling across tables to be heard!  When I left, my hearing was dulled as though I just left a live music concert!  Three Amigos roll was good but fell apart to the point that we had to eat it in little pieces.  Wahu was good, and the grilled jalapeno was uniquely good.  Seaweed salad was also good. Otherwise, this was pretty mediocre all around.  Their Specialty rolls mostly have nuts and spicy mayonnaise, which doesn't appeal to me--I prefer the more traditional stuff.  Conclusion:  We will never go there again, nor would we recommend it compared to all the competition.  Go to Moki's on Cortland in Bernal instead--they have an extensive menu that also includes cooked dishes, better atmosphere, pretty fast service, and the ability to have normal-volume conversation!
author: K G.

description: I went to this joint last night.  Lets get things straight off the bat: I dislike the Marina and the crowd which comes with it.  Ace Wasabi was filled with these people, so pretty, rich, happy and white. The service was good. Considering that it was fairly busy on a Friday having only two mistakes by the waitress was impressive.  First she asked if we were ready to order, we said yes and she looked away and bounced from our table for a few minutes. Second she should have left our table with a bottle of water to refill our cups or had her bus person more on top of that.  At one point she came up with water and refilled my glass and the woman sitting across from myself.  She then turned to the table next to ours which she had just laid down the check and asked if they needed more water.  Both of them had water in their cups, while another at my table had an empty cup.  She filled the other cups at my table (two remaining) but we shouldn't have had to have a member wait with an empty cup.  So even though I thought overall she rocked as a server, I am docking a star for the two screw ups. The servings of Wasabi were pathetic, so I am docking another star for that. How can you be a Wasabi Ace without any wasabi?
author: Max R.
